Too Good To Go is the world's number 1 app for fighting food waste. Why do we need to do that? Because 1/3 of the food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, 8% of greenhouse gas emissions come from food waste!

Our app has more than 32 million users across Europe, but we're more than an app. Our mission is to inspire and empower everyone to take action against food waste, so we're doing all we can to create educational tools, make our knowledge as accessible as possible, find new business solutions and even change legislation to reduce food waste. We're growing fast with 15 active countries currently and more to come and we are a certified B Corporation. But here's what really matters: through our app, we've saved more than 60 million meals from the bin - and it's only the beginning!

We're proud of what we've achieved so far, but did we mention the issue is huge? We are looking for a Key Account Manager to help us tackle this issue even faster and accelerate our growth!

Your mission:

We are looking for an experienced, dedicated and self-driven Key Account Manager with a passion for tackling food waste in a commercial way. Reporting directly to the Head of Sales, you will be pivotal in driving acquisition and development of partnerships with supermarkets. You will use your key account experience to continue raising the bar with our key accounts in the Netherlands by managing your own portfolio. You will be part of the Global Sales team where best practices and learnings will be shared across borders with our tribe of 750 waste warriors around the globe.

Your role:

Account management for key chains and partners from lead generation to roll out; autonomy in managing these Key Accounts and ensuring the relationship is strong and business KPIs are met.
Onboarding and training new stores in an efficient and scalable way, working with store-level contacts and senior stakeholders.
Identifying new and innovative opportunities to improve existing accounts to help them save more meals. Inputting into the Dutch strategy and assisting with international cooperation across global key chain opportunities.
Finding new business and opportunities, as well as mapping an account's organizational hierarchy to create an account stakeholder matrix.
Pitching, creating and delivering high quality and professional presentations to potential new partners, and confidently speaking about the business and food waste proposition.
Winning new businesses and growing existing accounts to achieve business targets set. Proving the business case with pilots and working with the client to define success metrics with the objective of rolling out.
Researching the market and identifying potential target stores especially within larger chains.
Taking a proactive approach to partner excellence and account management to ensure the highest quality service delivery.
Arranging meetings with chain HQ and individual stores and carrying out product demonstrations.
Using our systems to effectively manage your leads and upload sign-ups quickly and easily onto our app.
Working to weekly and monthly sales targets and KPIs.
Undertaking ad-hoc tasks to improve the Too Good To Go service offering and other ad hoc tasks connected to the Key Account activities.

Requirements:

You have strong experience working in sales and account management (at least 5 years) and a proven track record of acquiring new key accounts in the food sector. A background in FMCG is a strong plus.
You are business and performance driven with previous experience in a Key Account Manager role.
You're a negotiator by nature but with an eye for relationship building and have the ability to lead negotiations and create and deliver high impact pitches with excellent commercial acumen.
You have the ability to work cross-functionally to develop strategies to win key accounts.
You are a fast learner and can handle working on multiple tasks as you enjoy high performance and fast changing environments. You possess a high degree of self-motivation, proactiveness, forward thinking and assertiveness in order to manage expectations from leads as well as driving internal collaboration.
You have experience with project management and are able to create implementation plans for large roll-outs across complex organizations.
You are experienced in using a CRM/Sales tool.
You speak Dutch fluently and are a top of the class English speaker. You have the ability to speak to stakeholders at varying levels in an organization, tailoring your key message and being able to listen to the needs of their business.
You are a make-it-happen person who doesn't hesitate to roll up your sleeves – but you also think about the long-term business implications and requirements.
You have a true passion for sustainability - you understand the urgency of action for the planet.
You have a proven network within the Food & Beverages Industry and/or Food Retail.

What we have to offer:

A unique opportunity to work in a social impact organization (and certified B Corporation) where you get to wake up every day knowing you're achieving positive change.
The experience of being part of an international company with 750+ enthusiastic and highly talented waste warriors across 15 countries (and counting) – always ready to share knowledge and support.
Strong personal as well as professional development in an intense and high growth scale-up environment.
An open company culture where you have the independence and room to unleash your potential and contribute to our local Key Account Strategy.
A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together.
A competitive salary package.

Our values:

We fight together: food waste is a big beast to fight. We can do it if we fight together as Waste Warriors with no ego. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: we always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: we're proud of the change we're driving.
We care: we always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.

How to apply?

Do you want to be part of something huge and do you recognize yourself in the above description? We look forward to hearing from you. Deadline for application is March 21st. A video screening and case assessment will be part of our recruitment process.

We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above including our requirements. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go. We only accept applications coming through our platform: no resume or cover letter will be accepted by email or Linkedin direct messaging.

Too Good To Go is an equal opportunity employer.

Acquisition based on this vacancy is not appreciated.
A Movement for Everyone
We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it's only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we're allowed to be ourselves, and we're committed to a culture where all of us belong.
We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Picnic is de snelst groeiende online supermarkt van Nederland. Met onze app willen wij onze klanten iedere week helpen en inspireren bij het boodschappen doen. Daarom is onze app geen week hetzelfde: iedere week zijn er nieuwe acties, nieuwe producten en inspiratie die passen bij het moment van het jaar in de app. Lijkt het jou leuk om ervoor te zorgen dat acties, thema's en nieuwe producten elke dag opnieuw het beste onder de aandacht worden gebracht? Dan kunnen we jouw hulp goed gebruiken!

Wat ga je doen?

Onze app is iedere week anders. Er zijn verschillende onderdelen die wekelijks wisselen, zoals de actiepagina, de themapagina en de nieuwspagina. Daarnaast wordt er iedere week een email verstuurd aan al onze klanten. Al deze pagina's en informatie moet netjes en tijdig in het systeem worden ingevoerd zodat onze klanten altijd het juiste zien.

Elk onderdeel heeft een eigen dynamiek. De actiepagina moet klanten wekelijks interessante aanbiedingen bieden. De themapagina moet inspireren en verrassen op relevante momenten, zoals moederdag, BBQ en Kerst. De nieuwspagina laat klanten voortdurend mooie nieuwe producten zien en de Picnic e-mail zorgt dat klanten de highlights van de actiepagina, themapagina en ander nieuws wekelijks ontvangen.

Hiervoor doe jij de volgende dingen:

Productselectie en indeling per pagina
Configureren van ongeveer 100 promoties op weekbasis
Configureren van themapagina en nieuwspagina
Classificeren van type promoties voor reporting
Inzichten halen uit tools en dashboards om in te grijpen op unavailability en waste
Schakelen met een groeiend aantal leveranciers voorafgaand en tijdens de promoties
Schakelen met Inkoop om de afgesproken afspraken goed na te komen
Afstemmen klantcommunicatie rondom promoties en thema's
Aanspreekpunt voor meerdere teams (van logistiek tot category management tot inkoop)

Klopt er ergens iets niet? Dan zit je er bovenop en zorg je dat het meteen wordt aangepast! Elke verandering die jij doorvoert is namelijk direct zichtbaar voor onze klanten. Je ziet dus direct de impact van je werk, hoe gaaf is dat?!

Wie ben jij?
Enthousiast: je bent positief ingesteld en barst van de energie
Organisator: je kunt goed ordenen en voelt je verantwoordelijk voor je werk
Leergierig: je bent handig met computers en hebt een systeem snel onder de knie
Nauwkeurig: je werkt netjes en hebt oog voor de kleinste details
Commercieel: je begrijpt wat klanten willen, hoe je hen kunt helpen en inspireren bij het doen van online boodschappen.
Teamspeler: je vindt het leuk om zelfstandig te werken, maar je kunt ook goed samenwerken met collega's.
Communicatief sterk: je kunt makkelijk schakelen met verschillende mensen, van leverancier tot collega die niet altijd hetzelfde belang hebben als jij
Flexibel en hands-on: als zich problemen voordoen, schiet jij niet in de stress, je pakt het direct op om te zoeken naar een oplossing

Wat heb je nodig?
Je hebt minimaal een HBO-diploma
Je hebt affiniteit met de supermarktwereld, vindt het leuk om te volgen wat er in de markt gebeurt
Je hebt een neus voor commercie, jij snapt klanten en kan hierop inspelen
Je bent administratief sterk
Je spreekt en schrijft foutloos Nederlands
Je bent fulltime beschikbaar

Wat bieden wij?

Een fijne baan in één van de leukste teams van Picnic, al zeggen we het zelf ;) Je gaat werken op het hoofdkantoor in Amsterdam en komt terecht in een jonge en ambitieuze groep mensen. We werken hard, maar vinden het ook belangrijk om samen leuke dingen te doen. Dagelijks is er een heerlijke lunch en elke vrijdag (buiten corona tijden) sluiten we de week af met een gezellige borrel. Maar belangrijker nog: samen zetten we de supermarktwereld op z'n kop!

Job Title: SaaS Account Executive - Nordic and Benelux
Job Description:
Accelerate your sales career with the best in the industry!


Every day, we help companies to make the world a better place. One of North America’s fastest-growing technology companies, our software empowers better corporate decision making. We do this by providing a window into an organization’s global supply chain and the factories in which their products are manufactured, to reduce compliance risks, environmental waste, and prevent human rights abuse.
As we continue to expand our European operations, we are looking to grow our team of high-performing Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) Account Executives. Our ideal candidates bring significant experience in developing relationships with senior executives and have a proven track record of success selling in a B2B, SaaS environment. We are specifically looking for individuals who are driven to succeed and thrive on the challenge that comes with taking a new product to market.


What you will do:

Prospect and sell to new logos
Establish and develop an account-based sales strategy to achieve sales quotas
Follow a systematic sales process to progress prospect sales campaigns
Win new customers through self-sourcing activities, research, responding to leads, and building exceptional internal and external relationships
Manage a complex sales-cycle to prospective senior executives and/or multiple constituencies within an organization (Manufacturing Operations, Demand Management, Finance, IT)
Partner with Business Development to grow and optimize your pipeline
Manage all sales activity and forecasting of revenue in Salesforce


Join us if you:

Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator with excellent written and verbal skills in English. Additional language capability would be viewed favourably
Have at least 5 years of progressive B2B SaaS sales experience
Have masterfully led SaaS sales cycles from end-to-end
Have demonstrable experience meeting and exceeding sales quotas up to $1M
Are skillful in penetrating accounts, developing relationships, and selling to executive-level decision-makers
Are able to identify existing and emerging client needs, and to articulate the corresponding benefits of Assent’s offerings
Are a tenacious, highly motivated, and persistent sales hunter
Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator and presenter
Have excellent questioning techniques, active listening skills, and analytical capabilities
Are highly capable and self-sufficient in the development and delivery of all sales cycle artifacts including presentations, proposals
Are energized by working in a start-up-like sales environment
Have experience working with CRM tools
Have a combination of education and experience that demonstrates the above


What’s in it for you?

At Assent, your contributions will be valued and have a bigger purpose - you will help make a real difference to our clients. Our team challenges each other to be better every day and we dig deep to build a culture of innovation and high-performance.
In addition to a competitive salary, you can expect to:

Love what you do as part of a fantastic culture and supportive team that really wants you to succeed
Accelerate greatness in a challenging position with high learning and development potential
Choose how you work best with a flexible work arrangement
Spend your days making a difference, not just working for a living. We help our customers all over the world by providing a real understanding of their supply chain data so they can protect their brands, remove market access barriers, and reduce operational and financial risk


All applicants will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check.
Reasonable Accommodations Statement: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the aforementioned duties and responsibilities satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.

Are you looking for a hands-on internship focused on CSR practices? Want to grow your experience in a fast-growing global business? Then we're looking for you!
Our story (the bitesize version)
We've grown from a small attic company to become a global food delivery business. As Just Eat Takeaway.com, we're active in 24 countries across 5 continents, taking millions of orders every day.
But what drives us isn't food, it's people. From sales to sustainability and apps to analytics, our talented teams ensure we lead the way in a competitive, fast-paced industry.
All about the role
As our Intern: CSR/Sustainability, you support the manager for Corporate Social Responsibility on daily tasks and long-term projects. That includes anything from business admin to overseeing local initiatives and helping implement CSR components across the company.
Communication is a key ingredient in this position. Whether you're undertaking research alongside colleagues from our international offices or supporting relevant business cases and proposals, you're a key contact point for colleagues across the organization.
In this hands-on internship, you'll also have the opportunity to:
Get an in-depth understanding of sustainability topics inside and outside the organization
Develop your own initiatives and own them from start-to-end
Research of internal and external data and regulations
Be responsible for the CSR inbox: distributing information to responsible stakeholders
Be the contact for internal comms and support in the creation of internal CSR updates
Manage external stakeholders such as charity partners and agencies
Support on sustainability proposals and projects: business cases, slide deck creation, internal comms & stakeholder briefings
Be part of a larger sustainability project
Can you deliver…
Want to take on this exciting CSR internship? Here's what we need from you:
A University Degree (completed or ongoing), preferably in Business Administration, Sustainability, Marketing or another relevant field
Working experience in sustainability is an advantage: e.g. emissions, packaging, or food waste
Preferably some experience in one of our core countries: Germany, Netherlands, United Kingdom
Passionate about CSR and looking to boost your knowledge
Fluent English (written & spoken). An additional language is a plus
Strong communication skills
Well-organized, team player and an enthusiastic outlook
Able to create internal & external reports based on research
Hands-on mentality and a flexible skillset, from analytical to business-related topics
Available full-time for a period of 6 months
Here is our offer
Like the best food pairings, your skills and our great rewards belong together:
Competitive compensation of €650 per month
A varied, hands-on internship in a fast-growing global business with a strong position in major markets
Opportunities for personal and professional growth as part of a new department
A dynamic, friendly workplace in the heart of Amsterdam (close to Central Station!)
Office perks: Delicious tea & coffee, ping pong, our famous Friday drinks…and more!
Contribution to travel expenses (After Covid-19)
Ready to take on this exciting internship? Click Apply Now and send us your CV!

eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.
About the business:
Marktplaats, 2dehands and 2ememain are part of eBay and the eBay Classifieds Group (eCG). It combines the energy of a start-up with the resources of one of the leading technology companies in the world. We offer the top 500 advertisers relevant ways to connect and communicate with our 11 million monthly unique users, customized integrations and partnerships. Consumer and professional sellers offer a large and varied assortment of used and new products. But we want to go even further - we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. We invite you to join us!


Every month Marktplaats handles over 8 million unique visitors and 350.000 new advertisements every single day making Marktplaats the largest online trading platform in the Netherlands. Consumer and professional sellers offer a large and varied assortment of used and new products. We go even further - we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. We are a mix of Dutch and Silicon Valley cultures; like both, we are an international team of passionate people who share a common interest in solving problems using software and data. We invite you to join us!
About the team:
Classifieds is crafting the future of local commerce by bringing people together through an enriched online experience that allows them to work closely with the community around them. We are comprised of more than 1,000 people who are passionate for local trade and maintaining the customer-centric nature of the Group, while exploring growth opportunities in both the countries where eBay Classifieds Group already has a presence and in prospective markets.
We are looking for an experienced CRM Specialist to join the team, who will accelerate our CRM efforts on our Automotive business. You will join the Benelux CRM team (part of the central marketing team) with a focus on driving customer success and value in our Dutch and Belgian markets.
For this, you improve the experience and impact in all stages of the customer journey, from acquisition through retention to win-back. Our focus is on connecting buyers and sellers and encourage many relevant trade moments for all parties.
The CRM team takes the lead in defining the overall customer approach with regards to 1:1 customer communications. To bring the strategies to life, the team has a range of owned channels at its disposal, such as email, (push) notifications, and direct mail. Deployment of other channels such as performance advertising and in-product messaging are aligned with the respective channel teams.
Within the marketing team you will work with our integrated marketing manager, the content manager and the performance advertising manager. Outside of marketing your reach extends to the business & product teams as well as analytics and tech development.
Key responsibilities:
As our new CRM Specialist you are responsible for ideation and execution of CRM programs for multi-channel journeys.
Understanding customer journeys and finding opportunities for growth of our professional dealer base and private cars customers.

Creation of strategic and tactical plans to increase the activity and size of our customer base.

Development of campaign strategies, and drive execution through to completion with partners in the marketing and product teams utilizing both internal and external platforms and tools

Measuring the impact of CRM initiatives on campaign KPI’s and contribution to annual objectives, and develop ways to optimize and scale them

Working cross-functionally with business teams, product, engineering, and analytics to meet ambitious growth targets

Drive all campaign retrospectives to continue iterating and improving processes

What we expect from you:
3-5 years “hands-on” campaign execution of owned 1:1 marketing channels (e.g. email, notifications, direct mail, outreach)

Ability to understand our customer’s needs and translate them into compelling marketing propositions and assets

Data-savviness: Ability to process, analyse and interpret data

Strong stakeholder managing skills to ensure other teams internally and externally are aligned.

Project management: you will be developing and managing multiple campaigns at the same time. You are a structured multi-tasker.

Experience and/or affinity with marketplaces connecting (professional) sellers and buyers.

High technical aptitude

Experience in the Automotive business is preferred.

Hands-on experience with Adobe Campaign Manager is preferred

Strong passion to learn and grow and takes initiative to succeed

What you can expect from us:
An informal, international and energetic work environment in a fast paced company

Work with cool modern technologies, processes and consumer facing products

Teammates who will challenge you to give your best!

What we offer:
Dynamic, international teams with skilled personalities, ambition, integrity and a good sense of humor

A competitive salary, phenomenal benefits and an excellent working environment

Benefits:
Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs.
We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work.

The opportunity where you will make an impact:

As our CRM Coordinator you will be part of the CRM team and support the execution of the Body&Fit and Optimum Nutrition CRM / E-mail strategy. You will, together with other channel leads, including our CRM manager and our Head of Performance, drive incremental growth in existing markets as well as roll-out and ramp-up in new markets.

Full-time · Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Analyse customer data and campaigns in order to enrich Body&Fit’s understanding of its client base as well as to initiate new data-driven marketing campaigns;

Utilize customer behavioural, demographic, lifestyle and transactional data to deliver custom marketing messages with the aim of increasing CLV;
Optimize the segmentation & personalization strategy of the E-mail marketing team;
Support on implementation of targeted, timely customer retention programs that will increase loyalty, retention and encourage segment;
Brief, create and deliver email marketing campaigns in sync with the trade calendar for all markets
Taking concepts, stories and content from the creative team and making data driven decisions
Agile test email send-outs and incrementally improve performance
Create daily, weekly, monthly & quarterly reporting stack to ensure both operational excellence as well as optimal channel visibility within the business
Support the E-mail marketing manager is meeting the set targets
Deliver channel incremental growth, while positively impacting CLV, retention and engagement metrics

What you will bring to Body & Fit

2-3 years experience in CRM and an e-commerce environment;
Experience with Clang, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Adobe or other similar products
Experience in data infrastructure (AMZ) & visualization (PowerBI/Tableau-etc.) knowledge would be advantageous
Tech savvy with A/B testing, personalization and segmentation experience in a B2C e-commerce setting
Familiarity with the technical flow involved in CRM campaigns execution
Proficiency with Google Analytics, Excel and number crunching
Strong experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams to achieve business outcomes
Great team-player, a hands-on mentality and a sense of fun.

What we would like to offer you:

The opportunity to shape your career in our global organisation that is championing the healthy lifestyle movement!

Create your own nutrition formula with a discount on our products!

Are we the right fit for you?

Life is way too short to waste anyone’s time so there are a few things that we would like to be upfront about:

Politics, intrigue, gossip. We’re just way too busy for all that stuff!
Slow moving, corporate environment. We move pretty quickly here so we don’t have room for passengers.
Hiding in the background. If we’re to grow together we want you to step up and tell us how to do it. We need your voice!

With your strong analytical capabilities you will provide a deeper understanding of our consumer that aims at reducing the information gaps about the consumer’s journey.

Full-time · Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Create commercial insights and reporting related to all aspects of the consumer journey and website effectiveness (including product performance, site usability, marketing and sales), using GA web analytics data and A/B testing results

Work with wider business teams to transition key insights into self-service dashboards for use by the business
Develop and lead a consumer insights project board delivering key projects
Lead, manage and own external relationships with insight research providers

Proven track record of using insights that feed strategic decisions
Experience of working within an e-commerce business
Experience in using Google Analytics, Google Big Query, Tableau and related tools for data analysis
Knowledge in data science methodologies would be advantageous
Basic understanding of web principles such as accessibility, SEO, Iframes, URL etc
Proactive in solving problems and naturally inquisitive with a creative mindset
Fluency in English

Job Title: SaaS Account Executive - Nordic and Benelux
Job Description:
Accelerate your sales career with the best in the industry!


Every day, we help companies to make the world a better place. One of North America’s fastest-growing technology companies, our software empowers better corporate decision making. We do this by providing a window into an organization’s global supply chain and the factories in which their products are manufactured, to reduce compliance risks, environmental waste, and prevent human rights abuse.
As we continue to expand our European operations, we are looking to grow our team of high-performing Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) Account Executives. Our ideal candidates bring significant experience in developing relationships with senior executives and have a proven track record of success selling in a B2B, SaaS environment. We are specifically looking for individuals who are driven to succeed and thrive on the challenge that comes with taking a new product to market.


What you will do:

Prospect and sell to new logos
Establish and develop an account-based sales strategy to achieve sales quotas
Follow a systematic sales process to progress prospect sales campaigns
Win new customers through self-sourcing activities, research, responding to leads, and building exceptional internal and external relationships
Manage a complex sales-cycle to prospective senior executives and/or multiple constituencies within an organization (Manufacturing Operations, Demand Management, Finance, IT)
Partner with Business Development to grow and optimize your pipeline
Manage all sales activity and forecasting of revenue in Salesforce


Join us if you:

Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator with excellent written and verbal skills in English. Additional language capability would be viewed favourably
Have at least 5 years of progressive B2B SaaS sales experience
Have masterfully led SaaS sales cycles from end-to-end
Have demonstrable experience meeting and exceeding sales quotas up to $1M
Are skillful in penetrating accounts, developing relationships, and selling to executive-level decision-makers
Are able to identify existing and emerging client needs, and to articulate the corresponding benefits of Assent’s offerings
Are a tenacious, highly motivated, and persistent sales hunter
Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator and presenter
Have excellent questioning techniques, active listening skills, and analytical capabilities
Are highly capable and self-sufficient in the development and delivery of all sales cycle artifacts including presentations, proposals
Are energized by working in a start-up-like sales environment
Have experience working with CRM tools
Have a combination of education and experience that demonstrates the above


What’s in it for you?

At Assent, your contributions will be valued and have a bigger purpose - you will help make a real difference to our clients. Our team challenges each other to be better every day and we dig deep to build a culture of innovation and high-performance.
In addition to a competitive salary, you can expect to:

Love what you do as part of a fantastic culture and supportive team that really wants you to succeed
Accelerate greatness in a challenging position with high learning and development potential
Choose how you work best with a flexible work arrangement
Spend your days making a difference, not just working for a living. We help our customers all over the world by providing a real understanding of their supply chain data so they can protect their brands, remove market access barriers, and reduce operational and financial risk


All applicants will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check.
Reasonable Accommodations Statement: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the aforementioned duties and responsibilities satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.

bloomon is turning the flower industry on its head – for the better. How? By disrupting the traditional supply chain, where most florists operate offline and have done for decades. bloomon creates seasonal collections using unusual stems to deliver unique flower arrangements on repeat or as a unique gift. We always use field-fresh high-quality flowers straight from the grower and deliver to our customers through a high-tech and highly creative platform. Our e-commerce company launched in Amsterdam in 2014 and went from start-up to scale-up at hypersonic speed. We are already active in five countries: the Netherlands, Germany, Belgium, UK, and Denmark. Next step? To conquer Europe… and then the world. Our goal? To become the first global flower brand in the lifestyle segment, filling hearts and homes with happiness. One bouquet at a time.
Supply & Demand Planning at bloomon
bloomon has grown to its current size with a business model based around subscription customers - this means that we have been able to buy our flowers and produce our bouquets according to the direct order schedule of our customers, and did not have to do a lot of forecasting. Now, we are well underway expanding our on-demand offering, for which customer buying behaviour is much more volatile and harder to predict. And this is where our demand planning comes in.
The challenge? Perfectly forecasting the quantities of flowers needed to meet demand, but not have any waste. As you understand it is impossible to keep things on stock with our super fresh product… To do this we are looking for a talented demand planner to lead the development of our new and dynamic demand planning processes. To excel in this role you need a strong analytical mindset, great Excel skills, be driven by achieving clear tangible results and have proven communication expertise. If this sounds like you, keep on reading!
What will you do?
As demand planner, you will be part of the operations team, but you will collaborate as closely with the commercial team. You will hold a central position in which you will combine input from all relevant stakeholders to make informed decisions on the forecast. By gathering and analyzing data, challenging commercial assumptions and stretching supply chain capabilities you are striving to have an optimal result: maximum sales and minimum waste. The impact of your work is very significant: based on your forecast we make our buying decisions, with huge financial consequences. You will work on forecasting up to 6 months in advance, but also optimize for products that are on sale today and tomorrow to maximize results.


Your main responsibilities include:
Create, maintain and optimize the rolling demand forecast (1-200 days in advance) for our fresh and dry products (currently 10-20 SKU’s)
Determine forecast quantities per design/country/delivery day/color based on sales statistics, supply chain capacity, marketing and sales feedback
Incorporating inputs such as marketing campaigns, special commercial moments, seasonality and holiday changes into the forecast
Managing the meeting and process framework to ensure forecasts are constructively challenged to drive consensus and accuracy
Create and optimize KPI dashboard on forecast accuracy, waste and product availability, and strive to outperform these KPI’s
Coordinate supply chain planning around holidays and special commercial moments (Valentines, Easter, Mothers Day, Christmas, etc.)
Provide updated forecasts to meet the business-wide planning deadlines.
Further enhance bloomons’ business capabilities on forecasting and demand planning
Live gatekeeping of stock levels of all our products, across all countries and all delivery days, ensuring that where possible we are never sold out - in close collaboration with the junior demand planner
Requirements
Masters degree in business or related field
3-5 years experience in a supply chain environment and working with demand planning and forecasting
Highly advanced analytical skills and strong MS Excel/Google sheets knowledge
Great communication skills and experience in stakeholder management
Entrepreneurial and proactive mindset, ability to work on own initiative
You perform well under pressure
Commercial attitude: you want to win
You are fluent in English
Why bloomon?
Becoming part of bloomon means becoming a trendsetter. We make sure that we not only spread happiness amongst our customers, but also to our employees. We believe that different minds can create uniqueness. Our international team of highly talented people has different interests and hobbies and we support them all.

Current additional bloomon benefits:
Working in a young, flexible and entrepreneurial environmentHappiness days (4 extra days off per year for your personal “me-time”)Electrical Van Moof lease bike at your disposalAnd of course lots of beautiful fresh flowers!
Benefits when life goes back to normal:
Daily fresh and healthy lunch prepared by our lovely lunch chefA BBQ-worthy rooftop terraceFriday drinks and social events
We all love what we do – so if you like challenges, developing new skills, growing creatively and taking initiative, you’ll feel right at home as part of the bloomon family.

Leads cross functional teams. CRM is of strategic importance for Hunkemöller and the CRM manager plays a leading role in the organization.

Responsible for Email marketing driving traffic & revenue to online & offline stores
Analysing of customer data, generating customer insights and translating it into successful customer programs with segmented propositions

Continuously track new CRM initiatives or technologies in the market and adopt where relevant keeping Hunkemoller leading in CRM innovations
Development & implementation of strategy for optimizing customer data (quantity & quality)
Development and management of CRM suppliers (e.g. CRM infrastructure & tooling, CRM consultancy, campaign support, data analysis, etc.)
CRM reporting
Manage team of CRM marketer's, Email marketer's and indirect the data analyst
Competences:
Positive attitude and drive as well as motivator. Be a source of energy
Excellent planning and organizational skills
Strong results & data driven and able to translate data into insights and actions
Budget ownership
Customer centric; see customers as Nr 1.
Strategic view with hands on mentality
Flexible approach to work with the ability to respond to changing and fast growing business (24/7 attitude)
Team player, able to liaise and collaborate with different departments (IT, sales, merchandising, online, communications)

Minimum 7-8 years experience in CRM, preferably within a retail environment
Proven track record in translating customer data into effective CRM programs

Affinity with fashion and retail
Hunkemöller strives to be a much loved, social & inclusive brand. A place where people love to work, are proud of the brand, and where we create true brand ambassadors. Working in a passionate, energetic, design-led and performance-driven environment where our key customer persona 'Shero' sits at the heart of everything we do. Hunkemöller is certified TOP EMPLOYER of the Netherlands 2020, which underlines our people initiatives and achievements.

Apply now with your CV or LinkedIn profile only. In case of any questions, please contact our Recruitment team via (0031)35-646 5102.

COMPANY DESCRIPTIONShoplogix is a fast-growing and highly innovative organization focused on delivering smart, could-based, software solutions that improve production performance for manufacturers worldwide. We have customers in 32 countries and direct representation in 11 countries. Shoplogix is an autonomous company under Constellation Software, the largest software group and the most successful technology stock in Canada over the last 10 years [TSX: CSU]. At the same time, Shoplogix has a highly entrepreneurial and dynamic culture given it operates as a fully autonomous company.PRODUCT DESCRIPTIONShoplogix is an advanced IIoT software platform that increases efficiency, boosts productivity and improves performance in manufacturing. We offer an innovative web-based solution that transforms the way we see, analyze and interpret data to drive machine and process efficiency on the plant-floor. Kom bij Schneider Electric werken voor de volgende stap in jouw carriere
Ontdek de mogelijkheden om te werken voor een internationaal, dynamische en verantwoordelijke onder-neming dat de ontwikkeling van hun medewerkers wereldwijd continue bevordert. Iedere dag streven wij er naar dat onze medewerkers aan hun persoonlijke doelen werken en op deze manier hun carrière kunnen vormgeven. Wij zijn dan ook trots benoemd te zijn door Linkedin als top 25 ‘werkgever van keuze’. Ontdek hoe onze waarde en unieke positie jou laat kiezen voor Schneider Electric als (toekomstige) werkgever!

We zijn op zoek naar een Business Development Leader (v/m) voor het segment Water & Waste Water (WWW) opererend vanuit ons kantoor in Hoofddorp die gemotiveerd is om bij te dragen aan de groei van Schneider Electric. In deze functie ga je rapporteren aan de VP Strategic Segments.
Van de Business Development Leader wordt verwacht dat je als zelfstandige werkt en in teamverband doelen en doelstellingen realiseert. Je wordt ondersteund door de technische expertise van de organisatie.

Je gaat zowel op strategisch als tactisch niveau (werkvloer tot C-level) acteren en als leader deelnemen aan het ontwerpen van complexe voorstellen met een concrete waardepropositie om zo de WWW business te laten groeien.

Je voelt je thuis in een uitdagende en divers ingestelde werkomgeving met een no-nonsense mentaliteit en een klantgerichte focus.

Jouw verantwoordelijkheden
I.s.m. met het WWW team het opstellen en uitvoeren van het Industriële Automatisering businessplan en het bereiken van de verkoopdoelstelling.
Focus vanuit Industriële Automatisering op basis van onze EcoStruxure™ waarde propositie.
Het voorbereiden en leiden van contractonderhandelingen en afsluiten van orders in het industrie- segment WWW. Gebruikmakend van competitieve verkoopstrategie en uitvoeren van uitmuntende verkooptactieken.
Nauw samenwerken met de Schneider Electric Channel Manager om de betrokkenheid van onze partners op één lijn te brengen.
Nauw samenwerken met Industrie Marketeers om de Schneider Electric EcoStruxure™ WWW value propositie te verkondigen in de Nederlandse markt.
Nauw samenwerken met de verschillende Business Units van Schneider Electric vanuit een account- en projectstrategie.
Wat te verwachten @ Schneider Electric?
Je maakt deel uit van een vooraanstaande, wereldwijde speler die op een actieve manier meewerkt aan duurzaamheid en zorg voor de planeet.
Eindeloze ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden door het online learningaanbod van 10.000+ e-learnings over verschillende domeinen.
Een organisatie die zich hard maakt dat haar medewerkers worden gezien als de ‘beste erkende professionals’ van onze industrie.
Aandacht voor Wellbeing via trainingen en een Well-being Week.
De mogelijkheid om te zorgen voor een goede balans tussen werk en prive (bekijk onze global family leave Youtube video voor meer informatie).
Diversiteit staat bij ons hoog in het vaandel. Als organisatie voelen wij ons dan ook vereert om in 2018 zowel in de lijst van ‘Bloomberg Gender-Equality’ te zijn opgenomen en tevens de eerste plaats te hebben gehaald binnen de industriele sector van ‘Equileap Top 200 Gender Equality’.
Belangrijke vaardigheden in deze rol
Je bent een teamspeler en haalt het beste in mensen naar boven. Met zakelijk inzicht ben je in staat om georganiseerd en gedisciplineerd te werk te gaan. Tijdens je dagelijkse werkzaamheden hou je rekening met culturele gevoeligheid en blink je uit in presentatie vaardigheden. Luisteren is iets wat je constant kan en doet en interpersoonlijk ben je uitgekookt

Qualifications
De kwaliteiten en eigenschappen van de ideale kandidaat voor Business Development Leader
Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding in de richting van watermanagement met een zeer sterke affiniteit voor proces automatisering.
Ervaring in het sluiten van complexe oplossingsgedreven deals en begrijpen hoe stakeholder management werkt.
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden: van de shop-floor naar de top-floor.
Minimaal 5-10 jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare rol.
Je bent in staat om te werken in een sterk veranderlijke omgeving.
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift. Frans is een pre.
Customer First zit in je DNA en al je werkzaamheden zijn hierop gericht.
Ondernemerschap en het nemen van ownership is waar je in uitblinkt.
Competitie is waar je van houdt en verliezen is nooit een optie voor je.
Over Schneider Electric
Als specialist in digitale energiemanagement- en automatiseringsoplossingen staan efficiëntie en duurzaamheid voor ons centraal. Voor woningen, gebouwen, datacenters, infrastructuur en industrieën bieden wij toonaangevende technologieën, software en lifecycle services. Met ons open platform en geïntegreerde oplossingen helpen wij klanten bij het maximaliseren van beschikbaarheid, het versnellen van processen en het realiseren van energiebesparing.
De vraag naar energie zal naar verwachting in 2040 zijn verdubbeld. Bij Schneider Electric vinden we dat iedereen op de wereld recht heeft op toegang tot veilige en duurzame energie. Daarom zetten wij ons in voor energie-efficiëntie en duurzaamheid. Wij streven naar een innovatieve maatschappij en zijn betrokken, gepassioneerd en vastbesloten om onze ambities waar te maken. Dat noemen we ‘Life is On’.
Meer weten over Schneider Electric ?
Geïnteresseerd?
Graag ontvangen wij jouw cv en korte motivatie. Voor meer informatie over de vacature kan je contact opnemen met Milou van den Hout, Recruitment & Talent Manager via het telefoonnummer +31 23 5124 124.
Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Hunkemöller is a much loved social and inclusive brand and this has been rewarded by being voted by our Shero's as No 1 lingerie brand in Germany, the Netherlands, Belgium, France and Spain. Our vision is to make Hunkemöller the first choice for women in Europe with our whole focus being on designing our vision and strategy around our Shero. Building a brand that is truly social is a key part of our current and future strategy. We fully embrace social media when engaging with our Shero, our Marketing team is here the key driver.
As Social Media & Community Specialist you will support the team with the following:
Social Media:
Work closely with the Sr Social Media Coordinator on the strategic planning of social media marketing campaigns and in managing the execution of social media strategies, and campaigns
Work with PR, creative, and social team to create high quality, engaging, relevant, and timely content
Co-manage the social media editorial calendar and ensure the content is published by the stipulated deadlines
Contribute to foster and strengthen new relationships with key influencers within the community
Keep up with the latest trends on social media emerging social media platforms in the industry and within the influencer community
Increase brand awareness and audience engagement across a range of social platforms, and be able to report on the effectiveness of your activity
Analyze and provide feedback to optimize social media content (on a global level) for some of the key channels, including Instagram, Facebook, YouTube, Pinterest, Tiktok & Snapchat
Deliver insights and advice on social content strategy: for both organic and paid social channels; in alignment with content teams.
Grow and expand Hunkemoller social media presence. increase presence on existing platforms including but not limited to Facebook, TikTok, Twitter, and Instagram
Community:
Manage and develop Hunkemoller's online community. Act as the brand's spokesman and communicate with end-users within the community
Build the Hunkemoller's online presence and foster stronger relationships between the brand and the public
Be the point of contact within the social media community and strive to engage and provide support to members of the community for the company's social media platforms such as Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, Instagram, forum and blog
Communicate, provide support and interact with community members and customers in a professional, personable, and timely manner to grow and keep the community alive
Monitor trends and topics mentioned by the community and anticipate potential problems that may negatively affect brand reputation.
Generate comprehensive reports on overall community sentiment and notable trends and provide meaningful feedback
Deploy social listening tools to monitor positive/negative comments and topic trends, and strive to boost engagement and resolve any potential conflicts that may affect brand reputation
Monitor the social channels through Meltwater and other tools and work closely with customer service to effectively manage community engagement
Analyze the performance of social activations and hashtags, coming back to the objectives and identify successes and areas for improvement
Ensure social media KPI's are met each financial period
Come up with new creative (A/B) test options throughout the channels; and follow up on learnings.
Collaborate closely with our creative, PR, buying and merchandising teams for rapid and seamless execution
Our ideal candidate possesses the following skills:
Good knowledge about the social media landscape (especially Facebook and Instagram; others are a pre) and expertise in managing social media platforms
Ability to analyze and advice on creative content ideas
Familiarity with online marketing strategies and channels
Experience with social listening and community management tools
Experience with social advertising, paid social knowledge is beneficial, but not essential.
Ability to grasp future trends in digital technologies and act proactively
Excellent communication, writing and language skills; fluent English & Dutch (other languages are pre)
Multitasking, able to handle stress and has analytical skills (experience with Google Analytics is a pre)
Commercially and creatively minded
A self-starter with respect for others' points of view: The ability to work well alone as well as with different departments across the business
Process driven and demonstrate an ability to deliver in a timely manor
Energetic, enthusiastic, proactive and driven
Finished a Bachelor, HBO or Masters degree in (online) marketing/communications
Gained at least 1—2 years of experience in a social marketing role
Hunkemöller strives to be a much loved, social & inclusive brand. A place where people love to work, are proud of the brand, and where we create true brand ambassadors. Working in a passionate, energetic, design-led and performance-driven environment where our key customer persona 'Shero' sits at the heart of everything we do. Hunkemöller is certified TOP EMPLOYER of the Netherlands 2021, which underlines our people initiatives and achievements.
Together Tomorrow – Join a Retailer that's on the move to be better for our planet, better for people, better together! From diversity & inclusion, reducing waste, to product care and how we work with our suppliers, our Together Tomorrow initiative reflects what we do and helps drive change across our business. Ready to help us achieving our ambitious goals? Where ever you'll start working with us, if in Stores or our HQs, you can contribute!
Apply now with your CV (in English) and include a link to your social media channels. In case you want to share some (growth) success stories of social media channels in a portfolio or your CV, most welcome.

Ben je op de hoogte van de ontwikkelingen en trends op het gebied van recycling, weet jij kansen te identificeren en strategisch te benutten en nieuwe orders binnen te halen dankzij je commerciële kracht? Lees dan onze vacature voor Business development manager.Wat doe je als Business development manager?In deze rol ben je een belangrijk onderdeel van ons Sales team. Aan jou de verantwoordelijkheid om de internationale markt op het gebied van recycling in kaart te brengen en de afzetmarkt van Bezner te vergroten. Als Business development manager weet je niet alleen de kansen in de markt te identificeren, maar ook hoe je deze op een strategische manier kunt benutten en ben je in staat nieuwe projecten binnen te halen.Het genereren van nieuwe leads, benaderen van internationale (potentiële) klanten en het uitbreiden van het klantenbestand van Bezner.Je bent een gesprekspartner die met de klant meedenkt en weet de juiste vragen te stellen om een helder beeld van de huidige situatie en gewenste situatie te krijgen.Samen met de rest van het Sales team, welke bestaat uit technische collega’s, weet je de klantwens te vertalen naar een passende oplossing in een uitgewerkt voorstel, waarin ook de commerciële voorwaarden staan beschreven.Jij weet klanten te overtuigen van onze kracht en kunt ze, dankzij je technische achtergrond, precies vertellen hoe onze machines en installaties kunnen bijdragen aan hun bedrijfsdoelstellingen.Met de zelf ontworpen klantspecifieke oplossing in een uitgewerkte offerte, weet je klanten over de streep te trekken en nieuwe orders te schrijven voor Bezner.Wanneer passen wij bij elkaar?HBO/ WO werk- en denkniveau.Je hebt een achtergrond in de mijnbouw, procestechnologie of als chemicus.Minimaal 10 jaar werkervaring in een commerciële functie binnen een technische omgeving in een soortgelijke branche.Je bent commercieel gedreven, representatief, sociaal en zelfstandig.Je denkt in mogelijkheden, ziet kansen en durft beslissingen te nemen.Het is voor jou geen enkel probleem om internationaal te reizen om (potentiële) klanten te bezoeken.Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in zowel woord als geschrift. Beheersing van de Duitse en/of Franse taal is een pré.Gelukkig, we hebben nog steeds je aandacht!De thuisbasis voor deze functie is Heerhugowaard. Wij bieden jou een uitdagende functie in een organisatie die volop in beweging is. Daarnaast bieden wij een marktconform arbeidsvoorwaarden pakket; een salaris in overeenstemming met de functie, ADV uren, pensioen, doorgroeimogelijkheden en de benodigde opleidingen.Werken bij BeznerBezner is onderdeel van Heilig Group. Wij ontwerpen, bouwen, installeren en onderhouden machines en installaties voor het verwerken, sorteren en scheiden van verschillende afvalstromen. Met Bezner zijn wij actief bij afvalsorteerbedrijven, waste-to-energy afvalverbranding en recycling. Veel installaties worden turn-key opgeleverd.Werken bij Bezner is werken in een internationale, dynamische en informele organisatie. Je werkt in een enthousiast team met mensen op wie je kunt rekenen. Mensen die graag hun kennis en passie voor techniek met je delen. Met al onze medewerkers werken we iedere dag hard aan de beste concepten, uitdagende projecten en duurzame oplossingen voor onze klanten. Geen dag is hetzelfde.Is dit jouw droombaan?Dan ontvangen wij graag een korte motivatie met cv t.a.v. Annique Grooff, Corporate Recruiter. Heb je eerst nog wat vragen, neem dan telefonisch contact op (072 5716688) of stuur ons een mailtje! We zien je reactie graag tegemoet!Acquisitie wordt niet op prijs gesteld, wij zoeken en vinden zelf onze nieuwe collega’s.Soort dienstverband: FulltimeWerkschema:ma-vr

They have accountability for all strategic and operational activity including, but not limited to EH&S, client and customer interaction, work place modernisation and standardisation as well as managing the site-based teams for properties in their areas of responsibility.

Reference Code: 29468
Technical coordinator
Richemont
Amsterdam, NH, NL
Fixed Term
Richemont owns some of the world’s leading luxury goods Maisons, with particular strengths in jewellery, fine watches and premium accessories. Each Maison represents a proud tradition of style, quality and craftsmanship and Richemont seeks to preserve the heritage and identity of each of its Maisons. At the same time, we are committed to innovation and designing new products which are in keeping with our Maisons’ values, through a process of continuous creativity.
RLG Europe B.V., Amsterdam, is home to Richemont regional functions and 8 Richemont brands (including Cartier) that work to support retail and wholesale, marketing and communication for the BeNeLux and Scandinavian region. The offices also provide a platform for European E-commerce and a Customer Relations Center.

In the role of Technical coordinator, you will be in charge of coordination of all mechanical electrical plumbing, civil engineering works and maintenance for the offices and boutiques in the Benelux and Scandinavia.
This position is for three days a week, starting as soon as possible.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Management of long term maintenance plans
You will be creating the maintenance strategy and the long term maintenance plan. You will be managing the implementation based on NEN2767 inspection & completion and handover of recent investment and project scope. You will need to get full understanding of the scope of work per item & priorities.
Coordination of works
You will be planning, coordinating, supervising & handling the administration of works related to mechanical electrical plumbing & civil engineering works. This includes reviewing offers, and approval of work orders, advice on next steps and additional works. Also, quality control of all works will be done by you.
CSR-Sustainable development
Our monumental office building in Amsterdam is BREEAM certified and our ambition is to continue the certification to other buildings & our boutiques. In our building operations we would like to minimize waste and reduce electricity, water and gas consumption.

Contracts management
You will be in charge of managing approximately 15 technical contracts. This includes review of offers and contract agreements, organizing and holding KPI/ SLA review meetings.
Project management
The coordination of everything will be done as a project; based on space planning make sure there is enough power, data, AC, fresh air etc. for all workstations, meeting rooms and other spaces.
Budget management
Budget preparation of the long term maintenance plan and project plan. The monitoring of this budget will be done by you also.
Utility consumption
Review & analyse utilities consumption and strive to minimize cost.
Telephony & MDF
Multi-function device (Ricoh) & iPhones- contracts management, monitor consumption, reporting.

HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

Required experience and education:
Minimum 3 years’ experience in similar role.
MBO or HBO level
NEN 2767 certified
BREEAM expert

Technical skills and abilities:
Ability to read, write & speak English fluently. Dutch is a plus.
Good knowledge of MS Word, MS Excel and MS PowerPoint
You are customer focused and have a solutions oriented way of approaching problems and challenges
You are creative & innovative. You have no problem in taking initiative, and you are proactive
You enjoy working in a team, and working together towards a goal.
Good time management and pragmatic approach to things is needed in this role

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

We offer you a great international environment with strong professionals in the field. Grow and develop your knowledge.

We also offer a competitive salary to reward your efforts and a supportive environment.

YOUR JOURNEY WITH US:

If your application is selected, we will get back to you very soon. The first step will be an interview with our HR team, followed (if successful) by an interview with the Client Director.
In the interview process with us, we always ensure you have complete insight and transparency. If this sounds stimulating to you, we are happy to hear from you and hopefully welcome you to our team.

Richemont is an equal opportunity employer.

Too Good To Go is verkozen tot meest inspirerende bedrijf van 2020 in Nederland. We zijn een gecertificeerde B Corporation, groeien snel en zijn momenteel actief in 15 landen om de strijd tegen voedselverspilling aan te gaan. Onze missie is helder: iedereen inspireren en in staat stellen om actie te ondernemen tegen voedselverspilling. Dus we doen er alles aan om educatieve tools te creëren, onze kennis zo toegankelijk mogelijk te maken, nieuwe zakelijke oplossingen te vinden en zelfs de wetgeving te veranderen om voedselverspilling te verminderen. Via een van die oplossingen, onze app, hebben we inmiddels wereldwijd meer dan 60 miljoen maaltijden van de prullenbak gered - en dat is nog maar het begin!

We zijn trots op wat we tot nu toe hebben bereikt, maar hebben we al gezegd dat het probleem enorm is? Daarom zijn wij op zoek naar een Sales Leader die onze groei in Nederland helpt te versnellen door met een team van Business Developers nog meer partners en ondernemers te overtuigen om via onze app hun overgebleven eten aan te bieden.

Jouw missie

We zijn op zoek naar een ervaren, enthousiaste en resultaatgerichte Sales Manager met een passie voor het aanpakken van voedselverspilling. Iemand die energie krijgt van het door het dak laten groeien van nieuwe partners op onze platform. Direct rapporterend aan onze Head of Sales, word je lid van het NL Sales-team (20+ FTE volledig team met ook een Key Account Team) om onze ambitieuze missie verder te brengen. Daarnaast word je onderdeel van onze Waste Warriors-tribe van 850 medewerkers over de hele wereld, die samen voedselverspilling bestrijden.

Jouw rol

In deze rol geef je leiding aan een groeiend team van 10+ Sales Specialisten (Business Developers). De meerderheid van het team is gefocust op outbound sales, de rest op inbound sales. Met je Sales-team ben je verantwoordelijk voor de groei van het aantal individuele winkels (geen ketens) die via onze app overgebleven eten aanbieden op ons steeds groter wordende platform (4000+ partners).

Wat ga je doen?

Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de aansturing, coaching, groei en resultaten van het Independent Sales-team. Targets liggen rond de 20 nieuwe winkels per maand per medewerker, samen met de Business Developers zoek je naar mogelijkheden om deze te behalen en te overtreffen.
Tijdens wekelijkse 1-op-1's met je team stuur je op motivatie en resultaat en zorg je ervoor dat je team optimaal kan presteren.
Je werkt nauw samen met de Head of Sales om de markt in kaart brengen en de Sales strategie verder door te ontwikkelen. Strategieën om zowel het Sales-team beter te laten presenteren als om ons marktaandeel in Nederland te vergroten.
Je denkt mee over inbound lead generation en bent hierin sparring partner voor het Marketing-team.
Je geeft trainingen om je team te ontwikkelen in bv. pitch, presenteren en telefonische communicatie. Je doet dit zowel op eigen initiatief als met formats vanuit ons hoofdkantoor die in alle landen worden uitgerold.
Je ondersteunt internationale sales projecten en pakt daar in Nederland een leidende rol in.
Je deelt best practices met alles Sales Leaders uit de 15 landen en koppelt dit terug in samenwerkingen en ideeën naar het hele NL Sales team en visa versa.
Je hebt in samenwerking met het People & Culture team een actieve rol in het aannemen en inwerken van nieuwe Business Developers voor je team, we hebben flinke groeiplannen dit jaar en zijn altijd op zoek naar nieuwe initiatieven om meer actieve partners op ons platform te krijgen (zoals bv. het opzetten van een studenten of Field Sales team).
Je organiseert maandelijkse sales meetings en en presenteert tijdens wekelijkse en maandelijkse team meetings de voortgang aan het hele NL team.

Wie ben jij?

Je hebt minimaal 5 jaar werkervaring in sales, waarvan 2-3 jaar in een leidinggevende rol.
Je hebt een commerciële achtergrond en mindset en haalt energie uit het behalen en overtreffen van (team)targets.
Je schakelt gemakkelijk tussen de operatie en strategie en haalt energie uit het behalen van resultaten samen met je team.
Je hebt ervaring met cold calling en inbound sales en weet hierdoor je team goed te motiveren en te ontwikkelen als lead by example leader.
Je hebt ervaring met het gebruik van een CRM / Sales-tool en begrijpt hoe je deze kunt gebruiken om de processen en daarmee de prestaties te verbeteren.
Je bent in staat om met data en dashboards te werken en kan hieruit conclusies trekken en inzichten halen om te zien waar je je team kunt bijsturen.
Je werkt gestructureerd en vind het fantastisch om meerdere projecten tegelijk te hebben.
Je bent verbaal sterk en bent een verbinder door zowel met Marketing als met Sales samen tot resultaten te komen, je weet je groeivisie over te brengen aan jouw team en de organisatie.
Je werkt graag in een snelgroeiende organisatie waarin alles continu ontwikkelt en verandert.
Je hebt een enorme drive om voedselverspilling tegen te gaan.
Je spreekt en schrijft vloeiend Nederlands en Engels.

Wat bieden wij jou?

De ultieme kans om je commerciële sales kwaliteiten in te zetten voor een BCorp met een sterke missie om de wereld te verbeteren door voedselverspilling aan te pakken.
De ervaring om onderdeel te zijn van een snelgroeiende internationale Food Tech scale-up, momenteel zijn we actief in 15 landen en we groeien nog steeds hard.
Veel ontwikkelmogelijkheden zoals het volgen van een Team Lead training met verschillende Sales Leaders uit onze 15 landen.
Een internationale organisatie waar je veel kunt leren en veel verantwoordelijkheid en zelfstandigheid krijgt als je deze pakt.
Een centraal en bruisend kantoor in het centrum van Amsterdam (met dakterras!) waar we hopelijk snel weer naartoe kunnen.
Je wordt onderdeel van een groot internationaal Sales-team met veel support, kennisdeling, interactieve sessies en ruimte voor innovatie.
Energieke en ambitieuze collega's met leuke borrels en teamuitjes, in deze tijden natuurlijk allemaal online maar niet minder gezellig.
Een marktconform salaris met een bonusregeling.

Onze waarden

We fight together: voedselverspilling is een groot iets om tegen te vechten. We gaan samen de strijd aan als Waste Warriors zonder ego. Wij geloven in het werken als #oneteam.
We raise the bar: we streven altijd naar meer. We werken slim, doorbreken barrières en versterken elkaar.
We keep it simple: onze ambities zijn groot, maar onze oplossingen zijn eenvoudig.
We build a legacy: we zijn trots op de beweging die we in gang zetten.
We care: we dragen zorg voor elkaar. Betrokkenheid komt terug in de manier waarop we te werk gaan. We doen wat juist is.

Hoe kun je solliciteren?

Ben je op zoek naar een uitdagende rol waarin je echt impact kan maken? Wil jij deel uitmaken van iets groots en herken je jezelf in bovenstaand profiel? Overtuig ons dan van jouw kwaliteiten door te solliciteren en wie weet kom jij ons binnenkort versterken als nieuwe Waste Warrior. Een video sollicitatie is onderdeel van ons recruitment proces.

Too Good To Go is an equal opportunity employer.

Acquisition based on this vacancy is not appreciated.

Please note: To be eligible for this position you need to have a valid working visa / permit to work in the Netherlands.

Marley Spoon is the new way to cook. Bringing delightful, market-fresh, and easy cooking back to the people while building a sustainable supply chain for a waste-free world.
We deliver top quality fresh ingredients, in the exact quantities required, with chef-designed easy-to-cook recipes, to thousands of households across the globe. We currently service the US, EU, and Australia with three brands - Marley Spoon, Martha & Marley Spoon, and Dinnerly. Marley Spoon simplifies weeknight cooking and helps busy people skip the supermarket.
But in the end, it's simple: We started Marley Spoon because we love cooking and we love eating!
We are searching for a Purchasing Specialist.
Responsibilities
Generate, track, and manage Purchase Orders in Marley Spoon’s ERP, ensuring accurate quantities and timely delivery.
Manage daily supplier relations to ensure the timely delivery of the product; resolve shipping issues, manage purchase order changes, and review monthly scorecards to implement necessary corrective action plans (e.g. delivery times or quality improvements)
Support Strategic Sourcing in preparing periodical supplier performance reviews and internal meetings
Maintain a daily inbound receiving schedule and coordinate with vendors and/or carriers to make sure purchase orders are delivering on desired dates, communicating any issues to the organization.
Maintain adequate replenishment inventory to support daily fulfillment while achieving the desired turns and minimum inventory number
Review, track, reconcile, and approve invoices in conformity with received product.
Responsible for commenting on waste reasons from purchasing actions.
Coordinate with the warehouse supervisors to ensure the product is received and available for production.
Collaborate with Category Managers to resolve item and vendor issues where stock and service levels are not being met against established inventory plans.
Check and approve invoices
Available to be on call on Saturday mornings
Requirements
Associate or Bachelor’s Degree;
Previous experience in a Supply Chain/Purchasing/Operations related role;
Several years of experience in a related field;
Good analytical skills and intermediate user of Google Sheets/Excel;
Previous experience with any kind of ERP software;
Process and information flow understanding;
Driven to achieve the highest quality in daily work;
Strong problem solving & multitasking skills with great attention to detail. Team player and good communication skills with a passion to always learn more and share your knowledge with others;
Availability to be on call on Saturday mornings.
Benefits
Free Marley Spoon boxes
Awesome team events, such as company pub quiz nights and TGIF beers
Test kitchen in the office - you get to try our recipes first!
True ownership, real responsibilities, and strong opportunities for growth

Love the sound of the position, but don’t think you’re the ideal candidate? Please apply! At Marley Spoon, we value learning and growth.
We have worked hard to build a diverse team of inspiring and passionate people. We encourage people of all genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientation to apply!

eBay Classifieds Group is an innovative leader in online classifieds with ten brands that span the globe. Able to frame problems, collect data, perform the analysis, arrive at valid conclusions and present the data and metrics to influence others;Resourceful with ability to get things done. Capable of operating in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, across multiple teams and balancing multiple priorities;Experience with different measures of product discovery, quantitative testing (e.g. A/B-testing) and qualitative testing (e.g. Usability testing);Natural consensus-builder and collaborative decision-making style across partners, senior management, commercial, design & engineering teams;Self-motivated and results driven. You challenge the status quo with the ability to articulate a path to get there;Curious and passionate about learning and building great products to help us and our partners grow;Team player with excellent collaboration, communication and organization skills;Ability to quickly follow-up on impediments – having a ‘can-do’ attitude;You have at least a bachelor’s degree.Experience with first party advertising technology is a plusWhat you can expect from us:A collaborative, informal, international and playful work environment with self-organized, multi-disciplinary agile/lean teams;Managers and teammates who are invested in your growth as a technologist and as a person;Work with cool modern tools;Access to tools and resources to do your job (best-in-class laptop, conferences and meetups, all the coffee and soda you can drink, and much more);Ability to join and participate in multiple internal interest groups eBay Classifieds Group in trending topics like Machine Learning, AI, DevOps, BigData, mobile development, and others;Continuous Deployment through multiple environments to get rapid feedback about your work;What we offer:Dynamic, international teams with very skilled personalities, a real passion for e-commerce, professionalism and a good sense of humour.A competitive salary, outstanding benefits and an excellent working environment.Silicon Valley amenities, such as iPhones and MacBook Pros, crazy high spec dev machines and very nice office facilities.Interested?From the moment that you join our team we aspire to make your employment experience an outstanding and engaging one. Employment typeDefinite contract
LocationHoofddorp, the Netherlands
Seniority levelEntry level
Education levelBachelor degree
OMRON Healthcare Europe is looking for a QA/RA Officer to join our strong European Quality Assurance & Regulatory Affairs department. We offer you the opportunity to be part of our important mission to help realize healthier and comfortable lives for people around the world.
We are looking for an energetic, intelligent and hardworking individual with high integrity and willingness to learn and grow in the medical devices QA/RA domain to join our team. Do you have strong administrative and communication skills and excellent knowledge of the Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)? Would you like to work in a multinational professional environment? Then this might be the job for you!
The QA/RA Officer (position is 0.4 FTE), based in Hoofddorp, The Netherlands, provides administrative support to the QA/RA team with several Quality and Regulatory Affairs tasks and processes which are key for the continuous compliance of the OHE Quality Management System (QMS) with all applicable medical devices standards and regulations. The QA/RA Officer ensures that all reporting schedules are met, and customer satisfaction is achieved. The position proactively coordinates and leads the maintenance of Quality Records, the preparation of Quality documents, such as SoP’s, works descriptions and Forms, as well as the maintenance of the training matrix.
Your Key Activities:
Coordinate the process of reporting of Product waste materials (e.g. packaging, electronic waste, batteries etc.) as required by the WEEE and other related international, European or National Directives.
Monitor, maintain and report quality metrics and key performance indicators related to the OMRON Healthcare QMS and prepare the quality trending reports on a monthly basis.
Assist the QA/RA team with daily work activities, when required, or backup, e.g. authoring and revising Standard Operating Procedures, Work Descriptions and other Quality Documents, maintaining records and the training matrix etc. Participate in post-market surveillance activities when required.
Work directly with cross-functional teams and the OMRON 3rd Party Subcontractors in creating new or revising existing Work Descriptions for Inspection and light assembly activities. Provide training on the work descriptions to the 3rd Party subcontractors and monitor the implementation of trained items.
Participate and provide support during internal and external quality audits.

Desired Skills and Experience
The ideal candidate would have:
Bachelor’s degree
At least 2 years of experience in the QA/RA domain or general business experience
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)
Analytical individual with strong Excel skills
Proficient in the English language, both written and verbal (knowledge of other European languages is also welcome)
Good (interpersonal) communication skills
Basic knowledge of Quality Management systems under ISO 13485 is an advantage
Basic knowledge of the Medical Device Directive 93/42/EEC and the new Medical Device Regulation 2017/745 and other Medical device related international standards and regulations is an advantage
Risk management (ISO 14971) knowledge is an advantage
