Job Title: Technical Program Manager - Accommodations - Data Platform
Job Description:
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more. Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission. We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.

With over 1.6 million room nights booked every day, accommodation represents the largest share of our business to date. We are responsible for accommodation growth, with clear ownership of all marketing, product and supply related to accommodations. Our mission is to deliver the best customer experience and most varied selection of properties.

The Data Platform team contributes to our Tech Modernization efforts in Accommodations, by developing a set of services to manage the property description datasets. We are seeking a sharp, talented and energetic Technical Program Manager to help build out a set of data services that manage the property description datasets and drive the adoption of the services across the business.

Our ideal candidate will have a strong TPM background, with demonstrated experience leading large cross-organizational software development projects, and will have a deep technical background in product development and service oriented architecture.

.

B.responsible

Be the driving force that collaborates with business and technical teams across Booking to make sure your teams deliver world class solutions that are highly scalable, secure, and flexible - all the while maintaining a strong customer focus.
Interact with project sponsors, project stakeholders and multiple business and technical teams to define and deliver complex features
Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints
The ability to slice through ambiguity and drive clarity where confusion exists; leveraging technical expertise with strong business acumen
Maximize resources for the greater good of the organization, identify inefficient processes or waste and redirect resources as necessary
Identify, assess, track and mitigate issues and risks at multiple levels
Create, maintain and disseminate project information to stakeholders
Communicate project issues and status in a concise, accurate, and professional manner
Insatiable curiosity and ability to understand architectural and technical aspects of projects
Apply best practices to the software development lifecycle (SDLC) for projects based on experiences with a number of agile and blended approaches, as well effectively coordinating the implementations across teams using very different approaches
Build and maintain integrated project schedules that account for internal/external dependencies, differing SDLC approaches, numerous constraints and adequately factors in some contingency for some unplanned delays while still being aggressive
B.Skilled

Computer Science / Engineering Bachelor’s degree or related technical field
3-5 years minimum relevant work experience, including technical program management experience
Strong analytical and quantitative skills; Datadriven andresults-oriented
Knowledge of: service-oriented architecture, product development (including Java), agile project management, release schedules.
A proven track record of leading a visionary strategy to deliver global, company-wide platform services at enterprise large scale

B.Offered

Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide
Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture
Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com

We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

As a Master Planner at Argent Energy you work in an industrial B2B environment and you are part of an international Supply Chain team. The main purpose of the role is:

Anticipate, monitor, and maintain inventory levels across all production units and storage locations on mid/long term. Ensuring the efficient utilisation of resources across the Supply Chain, both internally and externally. Advising on strategic planning and provide excellent customer service to all stakeholders, ensuring that customer requirements are met. Accurately maintain data across all systems. Provide accurate, timely reporting. Support the developing use of Oracle within the business.

About the Job

Prepare mid/long term planning for all sites within the group in a strategic manner aligned with the commercial team.
Prepare and publish forecasting, delivery and production schedules across all sites, balancing customer demand with capacity restrictions.
Liaise with local supply chain planners on plans and support execution on local operations sites.
Planning and prioritizing operations to optimise performance.
Collaborate and effectively communicate within the Supply Chain to make key decisions and prioritise supply issues in a timely, cost effective manner.

About us


Argent Energy offers a solution for reducing greenhouse gas emissions and makes new natural raw materials and thus limits the use of fossil fuels. Upcycling natural raw materials such as frying fat and animal fats limits the use of fossil fuels. By producing biofuel, Argent Energy makes a direct contribution to climate change! Argent Energy has been part of the Swire Group since November 2018. John Swire & Sons Ltd. stems from a family business founded in 1816, which in 200 years has grown into a global company with various interests in aviation, maritime, food, trading and industry.

About you

Highly organised with an attention to detail and analytical approach.

To communicate in a clear, concise and timely manner to all key contacts.
To take appropriate and timely decisions that complement our customer’s requirements
Ability to multitask, prioritising tasks where appropriate.
Ability to work independently under pressure to meet deadlines, in a fast-paced environment.
Proactive and positive approach in the workplace.
Resilient attitude and a strong desire to learn.
Must have excellent written and oral communication skills.
Innovative thought process/out of the box thinker

Other qualifications :

HBO level (supply chain management).
Supply Chain experience gained in a manufacturing or FMCG environment.
Experience of working with Oracle or ERP systems.
Experience in Inventory management.
Experience of creating production plans
Experience of forecasting or demand management
Experience of using excel to advanced level.


What do we Offer?

Good primary and secondary employment conditions and an attractive pension scheme;
A social and dynamic working environment within a transparent organization with ample training opportunities;
More than 300 committed colleagues who use their experience and knowledge in the field of recycling organic residual flows, to minimize the burden and waste of the global scarcity of raw materials.

What's Next?

Apply now via “respond to this vacancy”. To respect the GDPR regulations, we cannot process your personal data without permission. That is why we strongly recommend that you apply directly through our careers website. Applications via e-mail will not be considered in this context.


Questions?

Please contact Richard Witte (HR Manager). Richard can be reached by phone on 020-2192930.

Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated.

About Circle Economy

At Circle Economy, we believe it is time for a new economic approach: the circular economy. Circle Economy is a social enterprise with an international team that supports businesses, cities and policymakers to find practical and scalable solutions to accelerate the adoption of the circular economy. We are growing rapidly both in the Netherlands and around the world through strategic partnerships with governments, cities, and businesses.
Circle Economy has dedicated programmes for cities, textiles, the built environment, finance, and circular design and have partnered on projects in many sectors such as agrifood, mobility, construction, healthcare, insurance, and waste. Circle Economy also conducts trailblazing research on topics such as climate change, circular jobs creation, and societal impact of the circular economy. Marketing and communications play a pivotal role within the organisation to inspire and teach businesses and governments around the world. Over the years Circle Economy has contributed to the growing community of circular economy frontrunners.


About the role

The Communications Team is responsible to 1) ensure visibility and increase the brand awareness of Circle Economy to a global relevant audience of businesses and governments on city and national levels and 2) ensure that relevant, inspirational, and engaging knowledge and information is distributed and contributes to accelerating the global adoption of the circular economy.

Within the Communications Team, you are responsible to support the development of inspirational and engaging content advocating the circular economy. You understand the power of digital communications and the importance of making research more accessible to facilitate knowledge-sharing. You are able to effectively translate complex ideas into engaging and attractive digital content, from short social media videos to audio tidbits and infographics.
You will report to the Communications Manager, work closely with the Communications and Design teams as well as our internal Business Units to transform learnings and knowledge into highly engaging and inspirational visual content for all our channels.



Who you are

You are an energetic self-starter, able to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment, and are a great team player. You can make decisions independently while at the same time ensuring alignment with internal and external stakeholders. You are an expert on digital communications and love to stay on top of recent developments and innovation within your field and have an interest and passion for the circular economy or the field of sustainability. When searching for content, you understand how to separate the wheat from the chaff and are able to translate highly complex topics and information into easy-to-digest and activating digital content for a specific target audience. You are eager to learn, are not afraid to experiment and implement changes when needed.

Key Responsibilities and Duties
1) Marketing and Communications
Support the development of communications and marketing materials for Circle Economy’s core offerings.
Coordinating and creating standardised templates for marketing materials (e.g. presentations, boilerplates, communications kit etc.), working closely with our design team to ensure adherence to visual guidelines
Developing new formats to disseminate Circle Economy content, from interactive essays and videos to podcast, Instagram stories and new webinar concepts
Assisting with the production of all content, from concept to distribution

2) Website management

Lead on the implementation of structural improvements to the website to keep in line with industry standards in collaboration with our in-house Design team,
support regular website content updates in collaboration with the Communications team and assisting other content editors to make relevant updates, as needed
Coordinate development work with external developers

3) Analytics and Tracking

Improve overall analytics and tracking of Circle Economy’s audience and marketing efforts, from SEO and SEA to social media analytics, in order to improve and optimise,
regularly reporting on analytics from our communications channels to inform our digital content strategy, including social media engagement and website traffic and conversions.
Keeping the communications analytics dashboard up to date and evolving it over time to provide new insights, as needed
Setting up Google Analytics events and conversion goals as needed to provide insights on launch campaigns

4) Project Communications
Support the communications team in developing communication materials for specific projects and thematic areas,
support the communications and design team with translating existing research and insights as well as new project results and findings into digital content, including: social media posts, webinars, videos, infographics, presentations and websites,
introduce new concepts to translate our research into engaging online formats and coordinating the content creation across business units.
Skills and Competencies

Essential

Bachelor or Master's degree in communications, marketing or business-related field
(Near) native English copywriting skills and a good eye for design
Minimum of 6 years experience in marketing communications, preferably in sustainability or social/environmental impact driven sector
You have proven experience developing and maintaining communications and marketing materials and online content
Strong business analytics, relationship management, strategy development, project management, problem-solving and change management skills
Experience working with CMS systems and website management
Experience working with Google Analytics, Social Media Analytics, SEO
The ability to adhere to deadlines and work within constraints
Project management skills in order to keep track of external and internal budgets
The ability to think outside the box to offer new solutions
Being proactive and autonomous
Desired
Excellent communicator with the ability to influence and persuade across all levels of the organisation.
Experience working with the Adobe Creative Suite, digital and/or print design
An affinity with the topics of sustainability and the circular economy
Experience working with Canva, Asana
Basic familiarity with Dutch is a plus

Kom bij Schneider Electric werken voor de volgende stap in jouw carriere
Ontdek de mogelijkheden om te werken voor een internationaal, dynamische en verantwoordelijke onder-neming dat de ontwikkeling van hun medewerkers wereldwijd continue bevordert. Iedere dag streven wij er naar dat onze medewerkers aan hun persoonlijke doelen werken en op deze manier hun carrière kunnen vormgeven. Wij zijn dan ook trots benoemd te zijn door Linkedin als top 25 ‘werkgever van keuze’. Ontdek hoe onze waarde en unieke positie jou laat kiezen voor Schneider Electric als (toekomstige) werkgever!

We zijn op zoek naar een Business Development Leader (v/m) voor het segment Water & Waste Water (WWW) opererend vanuit ons kantoor in Hoofddorp die gemotiveerd is om bij te dragen aan de groei van Schneider Electric. In deze functie ga je rapporteren aan de VP Strategic Segments.
Van de Business Development Leader wordt verwacht dat je als zelfstandige werkt en in teamverband doelen en doelstellingen realiseert. Je wordt ondersteund door de technische expertise van de organisatie.

Je gaat zowel op strategisch als tactisch niveau (werkvloer tot C-level) acteren en als leader deelnemen aan het ontwerpen van complexe voorstellen met een concrete waardepropositie om zo de WWW business te laten groeien.

Je voelt je thuis in een uitdagende en divers ingestelde werkomgeving met een no-nonsense mentaliteit en een klantgerichte focus.

Jouw verantwoordelijkheden
I.s.m. met het WWW team het opstellen en uitvoeren van het Industriële Automatisering businessplan en het bereiken van de verkoopdoelstelling.
Focus vanuit Industriële Automatisering op basis van onze EcoStruxure™ waarde propositie.
Het voorbereiden en leiden van contractonderhandelingen en afsluiten van orders in het industrie- segment WWW. Gebruikmakend van competitieve verkoopstrategie en uitvoeren van uitmuntende verkooptactieken.
Nauw samenwerken met de Schneider Electric Channel Manager om de betrokkenheid van onze partners op één lijn te brengen.
Nauw samenwerken met Industrie Marketeers om de Schneider Electric EcoStruxure™ WWW value propositie te verkondigen in de Nederlandse markt.
Nauw samenwerken met de verschillende Business Units van Schneider Electric vanuit een account- en projectstrategie.
Wat te verwachten @ Schneider Electric?
Je maakt deel uit van een vooraanstaande, wereldwijde speler die op een actieve manier meewerkt aan duurzaamheid en zorg voor de planeet.
Eindeloze ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden door het online learningaanbod van 10.000+ e-learnings over verschillende domeinen.
Een organisatie die zich hard maakt dat haar medewerkers worden gezien als de ‘beste erkende professionals’ van onze industrie.
Aandacht voor Wellbeing via trainingen en een Well-being Week.
De mogelijkheid om te zorgen voor een goede balans tussen werk en prive (bekijk onze global family leave Youtube video voor meer informatie).
Diversiteit staat bij ons hoog in het vaandel. Als organisatie voelen wij ons dan ook vereert om in 2018 zowel in de lijst van ‘Bloomberg Gender-Equality’ te zijn opgenomen en tevens de eerste plaats te hebben gehaald binnen de industriele sector van ‘Equileap Top 200 Gender Equality’.
Belangrijke vaardigheden in deze rol
Je bent een teamspeler en haalt het beste in mensen naar boven. Met zakelijk inzicht ben je in staat om georganiseerd en gedisciplineerd te werk te gaan. Tijdens je dagelijkse werkzaamheden hou je rekening met culturele gevoeligheid en blink je uit in presentatie vaardigheden. Luisteren is iets wat je constant kan en doet en interpersoonlijk ben je uitgekookt

Qualifications
De kwaliteiten en eigenschappen van de ideale kandidaat voor Business Development Leader
Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding in de richting van watermanagement met een zeer sterke affiniteit voor proces automatisering.
Ervaring in het sluiten van complexe oplossingsgedreven deals en begrijpen hoe stakeholder management werkt.
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden: van de shop-floor naar de top-floor.
Minimaal 5-10 jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare rol.
Je bent in staat om te werken in een sterk veranderlijke omgeving.
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift. Frans is een pre.
Customer First zit in je DNA en al je werkzaamheden zijn hierop gericht.
Ondernemerschap en het nemen van ownership is waar je in uitblinkt.
Competitie is waar je van houdt en verliezen is nooit een optie voor je.
Over Schneider Electric
Als specialist in digitale energiemanagement- en automatiseringsoplossingen staan efficiëntie en duurzaamheid voor ons centraal. Voor woningen, gebouwen, datacenters, infrastructuur en industrieën bieden wij toonaangevende technologieën, software en lifecycle services. Met ons open platform en geïntegreerde oplossingen helpen wij klanten bij het maximaliseren van beschikbaarheid, het versnellen van processen en het realiseren van energiebesparing.
De vraag naar energie zal naar verwachting in 2040 zijn verdubbeld. Bij Schneider Electric vinden we dat iedereen op de wereld recht heeft op toegang tot veilige en duurzame energie. Daarom zetten wij ons in voor energie-efficiëntie en duurzaamheid. Wij streven naar een innovatieve maatschappij en zijn betrokken, gepassioneerd en vastbesloten om onze ambities waar te maken. Dat noemen we ‘Life is On’.

De wereld om ons heen verandert. Steeds sneller en steeds fundamenteler. ManpowerGroup moet mee gaan in deze veranderende wereld (van werk). Daarbij hebben we 1 missie; het verbinden van het juiste talent aan organisaties.
Om dit zo goed mogelijk te kunnen doen hebben we de juiste inzichten nodig. Met die reden hebben we een nieuwe organisatie opgezet, namelijk CODE. CODE staat voor Centre Of Data & Engineering. Oftewel – de machinekamer van ManpowerGroup. Binnen CODE verbinden we processen, data, projecten en systemen aan elkaar. We definiëren kansen voor optimalisatie en borgen impact.
Onderdeel van CODE is de Proces & Projectorganisatie. In deze organisatie verbinden we data aan processen en zetten deze om in rendabele projecten en optimalisaties.
Als proces & projectmanager ben jij verantwoordelijk voor het coördineren van projecten bij grote en complexe klantvraagstukken, dit betreft zowel interne als externe klanten. De projecten kunnen uiteenlopen en zijn van zowel van tactische als strategische aard. Het is jouw kracht om het projectplan gedegen in te richten, stakeholders aan te sturen, timelines te bewaken en als een gedegen gesprekspartner naar alle stakeholders op te treden. Je handelt op basis van data en analyses en bent succesvol als het project onder jouw regie tot een succesvolle implementatie leidt. Gedurende een project weet je alle milestones en resultaten voor ogen te houden om tenslotte tot een excellent resultaat te komen.
Je kunt gedurende de uitrol van een project zowel de risks als commerciële kansen herkennen en weet hoe je dit het beste kunt adresseren en aanpakken. Omdat de samenwerking binnen onze internationale organisatie steeds nauwer wordt, zal je ook te maken krijgen met multidisciplinaire projecten die over landsgrenzen en de labels van de organisatie heen gaan.
Het procesgedeelte van deze functie komt voort uit de diverse performance data die we doorlopend analyseren. Op deze manier kunnen we patronen herkennen en in geval van afwijkingen proactief anticiperen. Hierbij is het doel om optimalisatie in de end to end processen door te voeren en de zogenaamde ' waste' er uit te halen. In jouw rol als proces & projectmanager ga je de op basis van deze analyses doe je verbetervoorstellen aan de organisatie om zo, in geval van een positieve business case, aan de slag te gaan met het implementatieproject.
Naast de projecten die voortkomen uit data analyse behoren klantimplementaties en projecten die voortkomen uit wet en regelgeving of markvraag ook tot je takenpakket.

Een proces & projectmanager die data gedreven is! Je hebt gedegen kennis van projectmanagement methodieken en weet als geen ander hoe je processen moet structureren en standaardiseren.
Graag zien wij ook het volgende in jouw profiel terug:HBO/ WO werk -en denkniveau;Certificering en/ of ervaring met Agile, Lean Six Sigma of Prince-II is absoluut een pré;uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden zowel in de Nederlandse als Engelse taal;excellent stakeholdermanagement op verschillende niveaus;meerdere projecten tegelijkertijd kunnen begeleiden/ coördineren;data kunnen vertalen in kansen met meetbare benefits, milestones, budgetten en timelines.

De kans om bij te dragen aan de opbouw en het succes van CODE en ManpowerGroup. Een combinatierol tussen proces en projectmanagement met een enorm palet aan diversiteit. Binnen deze rol kun je significante en structurele verbeteringen met impact realiseren. Je kunt deze rol als medior of als senior invullen en in beide gevallen zijn er doorgroeimogelijkheden.
Dit is wat wij nog meer bieden:een marktconform salaris;lease auto;ManpowerGroup performance bonus ;additioneel Benefit Budget met verschillende fiscale voordelen, waaronder de mogelijkheid tot het aankopen van extra vakantiedagen;mobiele telefoon en laptop ;pensioenregeling;(online) workshops en trainingen.

Ben je op de hoogte van de ontwikkelingen en trends op het gebied van recycling, weet jij kansen te identificeren en strategisch te benutten en nieuwe orders binnen te halen dankzij je commerciële kracht? Beheersing van de Duitse en/of Franse taal is een pré.Gelukkig, we hebben nog steeds je aandacht!De thuisbasis voor deze functie is Heerhugowaard. Wij ontwerpen, bouwen, installeren en onderhouden machines en installaties voor het verwerken, sorteren en scheiden van verschillende afvalstromen. Je werkt in een enthousiast team met mensen op wie je kunt rekenen. Mensen die graag hun kennis en passie voor techniek met je delen. Met al onze medewerkers werken we iedere dag hard aan de beste concepten, uitdagende projecten en duurzame oplossingen voor onze klanten. Geen dag is hetzelfde.Is dit jouw droombaan?Dan ontvangen wij graag een korte motivatie met cv t.a.v. Annique Grooff, Corporate Recruiter. Heb je eerst nog wat vragen, neem dan telefonisch contact op (072 5716688) of stuur ons een mailtje! The opportunity where you will make an impact:

As our Creative Strategist & Copywriting Manager, you will be responsible for developing and executing creative digital concepts, campaigns and copywriting. You are skilled and experienced within the digital environment, understand the different channels and touchpoints and are able to craft and plan 360 creative campaigns. With your team of copywriters (currently 1 Digital Content Specialist) and in collaboration with the rest of the brand team, you will ensure creative excellence, consistency of tone of voice and effective copywriting for all channels according to brand guidelines, big idea, campaign concepts and business objectives. Your role is to create campaigns and content that deeply connects with our audience and to constantly find new ways to engage and delight our “Fit” community. You will challenge perceptions, educate and inspire our audience to turn Body&Fit into a love brand and a community that everyone wants to be a part of.
The ideal candidate is a skilled copywriter, a creative mind and a visionary strategist. You are a gifted storyteller, with the ability to concept creative ideas with brand objectives and target consumer in mind. You are incredibly creative and have an appetite for learning and thinking outside the box.

Full-time · Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Accountable for copywriting, concepting and campaign development/planning

Write/Lead development of appealing copy/campaigns that attracts, inspires and engages our consumers throughout their entire fit journey by helping them achieve their goal and ambitions through fitness and nutrition
Lead creative brainstorms to develop campaigns that will propel the Body&Fit brand among our target audience and place us as a loved brand
Outline campaigns across channels in collaboration with the different channel managers
Develop content and propositions that help educate consumers about sports nutrition, usage of products and purpose of our brand
Be a catalyst for growth by showing the power that creativity, inspirational campaigns and content can have on business success
Work closely with the design team to align visual direction and tone of voice as one consistent and strong brand direction
Develop a process and alignment for content input with nutritionists and product teams
Partner with trade and performance to develop a structured and clear way of tracking and measuring impact
Work closely with consumer research for insights
Navigate short deadlines and feasibility of ideas
Manage and develop the content team

What you will bring to Body & Fit:

A minimum of 4 to 7 years’ experience preferably in creative agencies focused on campaign development and creative copy

A skilled copywriter with strong experience in the digital space
Strong understanding of the different channels, the role they play and how to best develop the right copy specifically designed for each
Experience in working with insights to craft ideas starting from deep insights, human truths and consumer research
An individual with business acumen with understanding of business priorities and how to develop campaigns with a clear business goal
Experience in working for a global brand across multiple markets with localised content
Experience with tracking and measuring impact of copy/content/creative campaigns
Fluency in English

What we would like to offer you:

The opportunity to shape your career in our global organisation that is championing the healthy lifestyle movement!

Create your own nutrition formula with a discount on our products!


Are we the right fit for you?

Life is way too short to waste anyone’s time so there are a few things that we would like to be upfront about:

Politics, intrigue, gossip. We’re just way too busy for all that stuff!
Slow moving, corporate environment. We move pretty quickly here so we don’t have room for passengers.
Hiding in the background. If we’re to grow together we want you to step up and tell us how to do it. We need your voice!

So, we are looking for like-minded people to join our team.To keep the team spirit during the Corona times, we have team meetings at least once a week and once a month we organize Sapient Days with fun activities both online and offline in order to welcome new Padawans and to strengthen our sense of belonging.Contact informationIf this sounds appealing to you please send your CV and motivation letter to our email address (all documents must be in English). About PVH Corp.
PVH is one of the most admired fashion and lifestyle companies in the world. We power brands that drive fashion forward – for good. Our brand portfolio includes the iconic CALVIN KLEIN, TOMMY HILFIGER, Van Heusen, IZOD, ARROW, Warner’s, Olga and Geoffrey Beene brands, as well as the digital-centric True&Co. intimates brand. We market a variety of goods under these and other nationally and internationally known owned and licensed brands. PVH has over 40,000 associates operating in over 40 countries and $9.9 billion in annual revenues. That's the Power of Us. That’s the Power of PVH.
The Team – STITCH
STITCH (stitch3d.com) is a Software as a Service (SaaS) startup on the journey to launching a commercial product. We’re on a mission to provide a 3D workflow that inspires fashion brands to spend more time on product while removing waste. We do this through our HUB digital asset library, STITCH Academy education platform, & Transformation services.
Pushing this vision is a close-knit, multicultural mix of people with experiences ranging from pure fashion business to infrastructure coding. Our product is constantly evolving. Nonetheless, here is a run-down of our latest tech setup:
Backend and asynchronous pipelines: Python and Django with Celery
Frontend: Vue, Konva, Jest
Infrastructure: AWS built with Terraform, deployed in containers on ECS and EC2s, frontends hosted with Cloudfront, all managed with CI/CD pipelines built with CircleCI
Process: Project-based work in a cross-functional team, led by product management
The Role & Key Responsibilities:
Translates the company’s commercial & product ambitions into the technology strategy and roadmap. Keeping a sharp eye on any technical risks that can affect the company’s goals.
Evangelises the possibilities of technology to unlock surprising solutions for our customers’ and users’ needs. Collaborate as one team with the Head of Product.
Challenges our talented engineering team to develop high-performing, reliable, secure and - most importantly - scalable solutions.
Always keeps an eye out for opportunities externally that could help achieve STITCH’s goals. Whether it’s experimenting with new technologies, levering your network in search of potential partnerships or uncovering new technology talent.
Sets the engineering principles; championing engineering best practices and driving the STITCH engineering culture. The aim is to ensure a good balance between code quality, the team’s productivity and long term stability/scalability of the product.
Defines the long-term tech talent strategy for STITCH. Team organization, recruitment and talent management are the important aspects of the role. You will be responsible for evolving the team’s organizational structure, driving high performance, collaboration and stimulating our engineers’ professional growth.
Is a member of the STITCH leadership team and will proactively contribute to the short- and long-term plans & vision for STITCH.
In short; this role sets the overall long-term technology direction while always leaving ample room for the engineers to contribute and grow. What do you think?
The Ideal Candidate:
You are a technologist at heart. You’re passionate about the space and can leverage this passion to motivate your team.
You have experience with both product development as well as system design.
You’re able to balance strategy with a hands-on approach, always willing to step up (hands on keyboard) when times require.
Strategic thinking and strong communication skills are essential for this role. You are able to translate the company strategy into a compelling story for the engineering team to rally them around STITCH’s mission. You’re also able to represent the voice of engineering with internal and external stakeholders.
You have a solid understanding of all disciplines of software development, which you use to constructively challenge the team to get better.
You understand how engineering impacts the bottom line of the company and are able to leverage financial metrics to drive improvement initiatives.
You have at least 2 years experience leading and scaling an engineering team. We are looking for a real team builder, someone who is highly collaborative, who gives constructive feedback and is always looking for ways to help the engineering team grow and learn.
Being a start-up, it’s critical that you are able to think on your feet, think in solutions (current and future) and are pragmatic by nature.
You’re excited by the challenge of taking on a successful product and maturing it into a commercial SAAS solution.
What You Can Expect from Us:
A beautiful state-of-the-art Campus, complete with our very own People's Place Gym and People's Place Cafés
A company culture that fosters development, offering training and learning opportunities through our very own PVH University
An international environment which respects diversity, equality, and individuality
A smart work program that empowers our associates to work at their preferred location within a flexible schedule
A chance to unwind with weekly social activities
PVH Europe and our brands, TOMMY HILFIGER and CALVIN KLEIN, are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. We believe we are bettered by all forms of diversity, and take pride in working with top talent from every walk of life and corner of the world. In the spirit of inclusivity, qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation.

Do you have consulting and/or industry experience in the Utilities industry and are you looking for a next step in your career? Do you have strong analytical skills and are you interested in helping our client’s transition to the new energy landscape? In that case the position of Consultant/Manager will be the challenge you are looking for!

Your job
At Accenture Strategy & Consulting you find solutions on the intersection of business and technology. You offer insights and advice to the customer and support them creating and executing the business strategy. Also, you think about their most important questions and initiatives, such as digital disruption, industry convergence, growth and innovation, operating models, sustainable cost management, business transformations and more. You will be orchestrating expertise from across Accenture — strategy, consulting, interactive, technology and operations, and have the ambition to continuously develop your market relevant knowledge, your advisory and commercial skills, and are expected and challenged to do so.

With our Utilities practice we provide functional and industry consulting services to Utilities companies. We are industry experts with the insights and capabilities to transform leading Utilities organizations and help them navigate ever-changing landscape they operate in.

As Consultant/Manager you will be part of the Utilities Industry Practice. With this practice we help large clients in Generation, Transmission & Distribution, Energy Retail, E-mobility infrastructure and Water & Waste. You help our clients with a broad range of services such as (digital) strategies, process-led transformations and post-merger integrations. You will act as project manager and/or workstream lead and serve as a linking pin to the project responsible at the client side. You will lead with insight: use of advanced analytics and human-centric design to co-create and implement technology-enabled, disruptive strategies and solutions that win competitive advantage, unlock value and drive growth for clients. You have the ambition to continuously develop your market relevant knowledge, your advisory and commercial skills, and are expected and challenged to do so.

Your team
The everchanging pace of market developments will only continue to accelerate in the future – and many organizations struggle to challenge new innovative competition within the market. How do different innovations influence the market, what are the results and how can companies adapt themselves to remain agile in the future?

Accenture Strategy & Consulting is the driving force in helping companies answer such questions. You will advise C-level management in their strategic blueprints – based on data analysis, experience, expertise and an innovative approach. Together with a diverse team of experts, you will challenge current industry obstacles and find the key solution for clients in their current markets: Surpassing the disruption through our end-to-end services, consolidating future success for organizations.

Your background
Completed Master's degree program in a technical, business or economic direction;
3-7 years of consulting experience and/or relevant industry experience in Energy or Utilities Industry;
Experience and interest in the energy transition
Affinity with technology and digitalization
Excellent communication skills in Dutch and English;
You have excellent quantitative and analytical skills;
You are a hard worker and able to work independently;
You are a team player with a “can-do” mentality who can think outside the box

For manager level, the following additional qualifications are preferred:
Experience in sales and proposal development;
Experience in leading small teams.

Our offer
Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re really proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we take an agile approach, provide end-to-end services and maintain a realistic mindset. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So, you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.
Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:
A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card)
An expense allowance
Discount on Accenture shares
The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week

Interested?
Are you ready to join Accenture for a career where you can be yourself and do what you love? Apply now and change the world around you.
Questions? Connect with Inge Neuteboom through inge.neuteboom@accenture.com.

eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with ten brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.
About the business:
Classifieds is shaping the future of local commerce by bringing people together through an enriched online experience that allows them to reach out to the community around them. We are comprised of more than 1,000 people who are passionate for local trade and maintaining the customer-centric nature of the Group, while exploring growth opportunities in both the countries where eCG already has a presence and in prospective markets.
About the team
Trust & Customer Experience is eCG Global operations team working across different platforms (Marktplaats, Gumtree, Kijiji and more) in 6+ countries. We’re responsible for Trust and Safety, Customer Support, and we’re the voice of the customer for the local and global teams. As Analytics & Insights Lead you’ll be a trusted partner with a global impact, generating high-value analytical insights and driving metrics definition and reporting.
Every day you will work closely with a team of experienced Data analysts and Data scientists focusing on multiple Product, Users and Experimentation related questions. Join us!
ResponsibilitiesBuild subject matter expertise on Trust and Safety and Customer Experience with data informed insights.Proactively discuss learning opportunities with our partners, leading to research projects and eventually resulting in insights delivery to enhance our users understanding and increase Trust CX initiatives relevance and efficiency.Influence Trust & CX Strategy identifying both global and markets specific trendsAnswer complex questions via ad-hoc SQL queries to enable critical decision makingDefine, instrument, and maintain new and existing Trust & CX metrics.Explore new ways to measure and communicate the impact of trust & customer service contacts on business.Build and maintain key Trust & CX dashboards in partnership with global areas or local teams: comfortable in translating operational metrics into dashboards.Ensure data integrity and work with global teams to alert of inconsistencies or address missing data enablers.
Preferred Qualifications:
Education:BA/BS in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related field)
Experience:5 year track record (or equivalent) in using data to facilitate business decisions: work experience in Product Analytics, Business Intelligence, Sales/Finance Analytics, and/or Strategy consulting.Professional experience in a global organization, preferably in digital native business.
Technical skills:Proficiency in at least one data querying language, preferably SQL, Hive or Hadoop.Efficient when working with a multitude of disparate data sources and tools; working out of a data warehouse or from smaller imperfect datasets.Familiar with Tableau, sophisticated spreadsheet and presentation software skills.Experience building intuitive and impactful dashboards and data visualizations.Experience with analytics/data science tool is a plus (for example R or Python).
Soft skills:Strong communication skills and a strategic problem solver with strong analytical and creative problem-solving skillsComfortable with ambiguity and defining business requirements related to large scale data warehousing projects.
- Stakeholder management skills - ability to build consensus by clearly communicating and presenting information.People oriented! Eager to build positive and productive relationships with international partners and draw upon their skills when needed.
Benefits:
Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs.
We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about our Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/

People are the heart of the eBay Classifieds business, and their health and well-being are our first priority.
We continue to monitor local government guidance and partner closely with medical advisors to determine the safest and best next steps for everyone. As a result, most teams are working remotely, with a few teams able to collaborate in person with enhanced safety procedures. We will discuss the particular case for your region during the interview process. As a general rule, interviews will be completed remotely over video calls.

The Senior Manager People Systems is End-to-End accountable for all the People Systems both at global as well as regional and local level. In this role you will ensure strategic alignment with our stakeholders within the People department and elsewhere within the organisation leveraging principles around Product Management, User Centricity and Design thinking to optimise an integrated E2E user journey around the total Employee life cycle.
The Senior Manager People Systems is responsible for an integrated, standardised and simple people systems landscape where we adopt as much as possible ‘out of the box’ technology solutions from our preferred vendors (first and foremost Workday). Leveraging practices around Operational Excellence and Offshoring, he/she ensures a maximum return on investments at best costs. The Senior Manager People Systems works closely with peers within the People department as well as with partners from other functional teams (IT Services, Procurement, Finance) to ensure our technology landscape, plans and practices are fully aligned and integrated with the overall Booking.com practices and standards.

Responsibilities

Strategy

Drives the overall strategy for all People related systems and ensures this is aligned and is supporting the overall People department strategy and plans. Ensure technology is leveraged to support the most effective People Service delivery model combining self services with state of the art technologies around digital assistants, knowledge base and case management tools.
Ensures that specific local and regional technology requirements are identified, prioritised, planned and executed as per agreed plans.
Ensures People systems strategy is aligned with other, non People related plans and priorities e.g. IT Services, Finance, Procurement, R&C.
Ensures End-to-End execution of agreed strategy and plans within budget.

Stakeholder Management

Is a partner to the business and works closely with senior managers and their teams within the People department (COE’s, Operations, HRA). As such, acts as a bridge between the Business/functional and the technology teams and ensures that understandable language is used to translate business/functional requirements into technology plans
Works closely with peers within the overall systems/technology environment to ensure the People systems plans are aligned and embedded into the overall technology plans and that IT (Security) standards are met and adhered to.
Ensures clear governance around communication applying the Single Point of Contact (SPOC) principle in order for the stakeholders we work with, clear communication and escalation channels.
Putting the End user at the centre of the People systems and technology design, ensures finding the right balance between the needs of the various stakeholders

Program and Project Management

Ensures that key technology and system investments are properly managed in line with Booking.com project management practices and standards.
Builds capabilities within the team on project and program management to ensure flawless execution of agreed programs and projects.

Operational Excellence

Ensures that the People systems team adopts the highest standards of Operational Excellence and has skills and capabilities to identify issues, address root causes, eliminates waste and drives continuous improvement
Is accountable for the overall RUN/Sustain strategy for the People Systems team to ensure potential issues are addressed within time in line with the agreed SLA’s. Ensures where appropriate that this is aligned with the overall IT Services support model.
Leverages offshore model where possible to minimise non value added work and associated costs.

Budget management

Is accountable for the total budget for People Systems and as such works closely with the Finance team to ensure budget/financial best practices and standards are met.
Ensures that all significant People systems projects and related investments are supported by solid business cases as per agreed standards, templates and timelines

Risk & Control

Ensures the Booking.com Risk and Control standards and practices are adhered to and that the people systems are meeting all related standards (Soxx, SOD)
Works closely with the legal team to ensure that we are compliant against Data privacy legislation (GDPR) and that the data of our candidates and employees is safe with us.

Vendor Management

Is overall accountable for the People Systems landscape and as such also accountable for managing the partnerships with our main technology vendors (Workday).
Works closely with the Procurement team to ensure the People systems team operates in line with agreed Procurement practices and thus ensuring maximum return of investment.
Through networking with other customers, ensures that technology roadmaps of our vendors are influenced to meet our long term technology and systems needs.

People Management

Is responsible for the various teams within the People Systems team: Architecture & integration, Application Management and Technology solutions.
Ensures regional People systems experts presence in APAC (Singapore) and the Americas (Grand rapids)
Provides direction and guidance on key practices around ways of working: E2E thinking, Product Management, Design Thinking, Offshore management, Project Management, SPOC concept
Ensures the right mix of people leveraging our locations, managing our costs and maximizing our partnerships with our technology vendors and our managed services partners.

Requirements

Very strategic: think 3-5 years ahead, understands dependencies
Strong stakeholder management skills operating at ELT level across multiple functions
Strong budget management skills and capabilities to ensure right level of investments and ensure agreed investments are managed properly
Strong People management skills leading a (growing) big team across 4 continents with potentially also a big offshore team.
Strong innovator. Curious in what technology can do to drive a more effective and costs efficient HR function

The opportunity
The new economy and changing consumer behaviour is changing the way retailers and brands are managing their products and inventory. Lots of profit is being burned because of inefficiencies in the supply chain, inventories and (online) stores.

This startup is solving these problems by providing a innovative, data-driven platform and is actually contributing to a world with less waste of consumer goods!
With a team of only 10 FTE, they have already been able to close Enterprises such as Levi's and Under Armour. They have a great reputation in Europe and demand for their state-of-the-art solution is growing rapidly.
Therefor, the phase of founder led sales is coming to an end, and it is time for a great Head of Sales to step in and lead this promising company through the next growth phase.

Your profile
At least 5-10 years of sales experience (SaaS)Hands-on mentality (deal closing) and strategic/tactical skillsBachelor and/or Master degree

The offer
Salary up/to €90k base + secondary benefitsMaking a serious impact on this company's growth trajectoryReporting directly into CEO

Next steps

bloomon is turning the flower industry on its head – for the better. How? By disrupting the traditional supply chain, where most florists operate offline and have done for decades. bloomon creates seasonal collections using unusual stems to deliver unique flower arrangements on repeat or as a unique gift. We always use field-fresh high-quality flowers straight from the grower and deliver to our customers through a high-tech and highly creative platform. Our e-commerce company launched in Amsterdam in 2014 and went from start-up to scale-up at hypersonic speed. We are already active in five countries: the Netherlands, Germany, Belgium, UK, and Denmark. Next step? To conquer Europe… and then the world. Our goal? To become the first global flower brand in the lifestyle segment, filling hearts and homes with happiness. One bouquet at a time.
Supply & Demand Planning at bloomon
bloomon has grown to its current size with a business model based around subscription customers - this means that we have been able to buy our flowers and produce our bouquets according to the direct order schedule of our customers, and did not have to do a lot of forecasting. Now, we are well underway expanding our on-demand offering, for which customer buying behaviour is much more volatile and harder to predict. And this is where our demand planning comes in.
The challenge? Perfectly forecasting the quantities of flowers needed to meet demand, but not have any waste. As you understand it is impossible to keep things on stock with our super fresh product… To do this we are looking for a talented demand planner to lead the development of our new and dynamic demand planning processes. To excel in this role you need a strong analytical mindset, great Excel skills, be driven by achieving clear tangible results and have proven communication expertise. If this sounds like you, keep on reading!
What will you do?
As demand planner, you will be part of the operations team, but you will collaborate as closely with the commercial team. You will hold a central position in which you will combine input from all relevant stakeholders to make informed decisions on the forecast. By gathering and analyzing data, challenging commercial assumptions and stretching supply chain capabilities you are striving to have an optimal result: maximum sales and minimum waste. The impact of your work is very significant: based on your forecast we make our buying decisions, with huge financial consequences. You will work on forecasting up to 6 months in advance, but also optimize for products that are on sale today and tomorrow to maximize results.


Your main responsibilities include:
Create, maintain and optimize the rolling demand forecast (1-200 days in advance) for our fresh and dry products (currently 10-20 SKU’s)
Determine forecast quantities per design/country/delivery day/color based on sales statistics, supply chain capacity, marketing and sales feedback
Incorporating inputs such as marketing campaigns, special commercial moments, seasonality and holiday changes into the forecast
Managing the meeting and process framework to ensure forecasts are constructively challenged to drive consensus and accuracy
Create and optimize KPI dashboard on forecast accuracy, waste and product availability, and strive to outperform these KPI’s
Coordinate supply chain planning around holidays and special commercial moments (Valentines, Easter, Mothers Day, Christmas, etc.)
Provide updated forecasts to meet the business-wide planning deadlines.
Further enhance bloomons’ business capabilities on forecasting and demand planning
Live gatekeeping of stock levels of all our products, across all countries and all delivery days, ensuring that where possible we are never sold out - in close collaboration with the junior demand planner
Requirements
Masters degree in business or related field
3-5 years experience in a supply chain environment and working with demand planning and forecasting
Highly advanced analytical skills and strong MS Excel/Google sheets knowledge
Great communication skills and experience in stakeholder management
Entrepreneurial and proactive mindset, ability to work on own initiative
You perform well under pressure
Commercial attitude: you want to win
You are fluent in English
Why bloomon?
Becoming part of bloomon means becoming a trendsetter. We make sure that we not only spread happiness amongst our customers, but also to our employees. We believe that different minds can create uniqueness. Our international team of highly talented people has different interests and hobbies and we support them all.

Current additional bloomon benefits:
Working in a young, flexible and entrepreneurial environmentHappiness days (4 extra days off per year for your personal “me-time”)Electrical Van Moof lease bike at your disposalAnd of course lots of beautiful fresh flowers!
Benefits when life goes back to normal:
Daily fresh and healthy lunch prepared by our lovely lunch chefA BBQ-worthy rooftop terraceFriday drinks and social events
We all love what we do – so if you like challenges, developing new skills, growing creatively and taking initiative, you’ll feel right at home as part of the bloomon family.

The opportunity where you will make an impact:

As our Software QA Manager, you will be accountable to develop and execute exploratory tests and as such validate user stories to ensure product quality of the core e-commerce platform “Hybris” to support the development of Body&Fit propositions. The aim of the QA manager should be to deliver new functionality to the business without any issues that impact the business as a result. You will work closely with stakeholders in the technology team, business teams and development partners to deliver the new functionality to the business.

Full-time · Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Plan and prioritise QA work for deployments of the Hybris e-commerce platform
Review, propose and implement testing strategy including tools, reporting and process
Define and execute (exploratory) test scripts for user stories to be delivered in a release
Define and execute regression packs to ensure product quality
Report on testing progress
Develop and grow the Body&Fit QA team
Knowledge transfer to the internal teams

What you will bring to Body & Fit:

A track record in software quality assurance in a fast-paced organisation

Experience as QA/Test Manager in e-commerce or related field
Understanding of automated test tools and process to deliver continuous improvements
Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes
A track record of managing stakeholders and strong examples of clear and concise communication
A good understanding of e-commerce platform ecosystems and technical development in complex IT projects
Good communication skills with stakeholders at all levels
A commitment to delivering releases with outstanding quality
Exceptional attention to detail
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
A passion for customers, retail, digital products & technology

What we would like to offer you:

The opportunity to shape your career in our global organisation that is championing the healthy lifestyle movement!

Create your own nutrition formula with a discount on our products!
Are we the right fit for you?

Life is way too short to waste anyone’s time so there are a few things that we would like to be upfront about:

Politics, intrigue, gossip. We’re just way too busy for all that stuff!
Slow moving, corporate environment. We move pretty quickly here so we don’t have room for passengers.
Hiding in the background. If we’re to grow together we want you to step up and tell us how to do it. We need your voice!


Please note: To be eligible for this position you need to have a valid working visa / permit to work in the Netherlands.

eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.About the business:Marktplaats, 2dehands and 2ememain are part of eBay and the eBay Classifieds Group (eCG). It combines the energy of a start-up with the resources of one of the leading technology companies in the world. We offer the top 500 advertisers relevant ways to connect and communicate with our 11 million monthly unique users, customized integrations and partnerships. Consumer and professional sellers offer a large and varied assortment of used and new products. But we want to go even further - we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. marketing plans and ROI driven investment strategies.The role will be based in Amsterdam and will report to the eCG Benelux CMO.Responsibilities:‘Go-to-person’ for the overall C2C Marketing strategy, activation & ROI for NL / BEDefine market priorities, strategies, activation calendars, integrated campaigns briefs, messaging, channel mix & investments recos in close collaboration with various internal teams.Work with Consumer Insights & Analytics stakeholders to develop market deep-dive analysis, define growth projections, audience understanding and required behavioural / mindset changesLead the development of Integrated Marketing briefs (for always on / adhoc campaigns) in close collaboration with content, precision, insights & analytics, PR, product…Work with the above in the development and execution of fully integrated campaignsRegularly report marketing and brand results against agreed KPIsLead recommendations of corrective actions to the plans during the year as neededUnderstand NL or BE market in-side-out from a business perspective, keeps a pulse on what's going in that market (in collaboration with the Insights / analytics team), recommends plans adjustments during the year as neededShare market learnings, further requirements and best practices across the wider eCG organizationRequirements:Entrepreneurial, strong sense of ownership to build leading brands in NL/BE, and a drive to exceed marketing and business goalsStrong influencer and collaborator who can work with a variety of marketing and business teams in co-developing marketing priorities, calendars, plans and budgetsAnalytical and data-driven to analyze category, competitive, consumer, product and brand data and identify the biggest marketing opportunities and goals for NL & BEStrong knowledge of full Marketing Mix (Communications, Offline/Online/Performance Marketing Channels, CRM, PR, Front-End, App) to co-develop best-in-class integrated campaigns with relevant marketing teamsStrong project management to oversee the flawless execution of integrated Paid, Earned & Owned channel campaignsBusiness results driven and financially savvy (ideally have had prior P&L or business results responsibility)Strong interpersonal skills and leadership presence with the ability to influence and motivate people at all levels of the organizationAble to work independently and Job Title: Senior Technical Program Manager - Order Platform
Job Description:
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.

In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.

Senior Technical Program Manager - Order Platform

Booking’s Horizontal Business Services department is seeking a smart, talented and energetic Senior Technical Program Manager to manage execution and delivery of the Order Platform roadmap that delivers against ambitious business objectives.

Our order platform is designed to be the authoritative data source of all reservation data which is then funnelled to relevant systems including finance, billing analytics etc. This role will need someone with a strong TPM background, with demonstrated experience leading large cross-organizational software development projects, with a deep technical background in data modelling. You will have experience with MySQL, Hadoop, Cassandra and Big Data platforms. You must be able to thrive and succeed in an entrepreneurial environment, and not be hindered by ambiguity or competing priorities. This means you are not only able to develop and drive high-level strategic initiatives, but can also roll up your sleeves, dig in and help drive change.

As a Senior TPM, you will anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance customer and business needs versus technical constraints. An ability to take large, complex projects and break them down into manageable pieces, develop functional specifications, then deliver them in a successful and timely manner is expected. We are looking for proactive, innovative individuals who thrive on solving tough problems. Well developed decision making and judgment, negotiation skills, the ability to influence, analytical ability and leadership are essential to success.

B.Responsible

Be the driving force that collaborates with business and technical teams across Booking to make sure your teams deliver world class solutions that are highly scalable, secure, and flexible - all the while maintaining a strong customer focus.
Interact with project sponsors, project stakeholders and multiple business and technical teams to define and deliver complex features
Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints
Plan and manage multiple parallel projects
The ability to slice through ambiguity and drive clarity where confusion exists; leveraging technical expertise with strong business acumen
Maximize resources for the greater good of the organization, identify inefficient processes or waste and redirect resources as necessary
Identify, assess, track and mitigate issues and risks at multiple levels
Create, maintain and disseminate project information to stakeholders
Communicate project issues and status in a concise, accurate, and professional manner
Insatiable curiosity and ability to understand architectural and technical aspects of projects
Apply best practices to the software development lifecycle (SDLC) for projects based on experiences with a number of agile and blended approaches, as well effectively coordinating the implementations across teams using very different approaches
Build and maintain integrated project schedules that account for internal/external dependencies, differing SDLC approaches, numerous constraints, and adequately factors in some contingency for some unplanned delays while still being aggressive

B.Skilled

7+ years relevant work experience, including technical program management experience
3 years+ engineering experience with relevant tech stack
Strong analytical and quantitative skills; Datadriven andresults-oriented
A proven track record of leading a visionary strategy to deliver global, company-wide platform services at enterprise large scales
Commercial understanding of scrum methodologies, agile project management and release (program increment) scheduling

B.offered

This position is open to candidates worldwide, we provide visa and relocation assistance.

Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world-renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work
Working in a fast-paced and performance-driven culture
Career advancement via online and on-the-job training, Hackathons, conferences and active community participation
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com

We value Diversity of all types and in an open, dynamic workplace. This has been a pillar at Booking.com since day one, and something we continue to strongly believe in and build today.

Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

ABOUT US
Proudfoot is the preeminent global operational consultancy. Our core philosophy is “transformation through people” – creating alignment, changing behavior, and transforming companies with people-first solutions to their operational challenges. Our unique approach links hard analysis with one-on-one coaching and boots-on-ground support to achieve dramatic business improvements, helping leaders tap into the energy and ideas of the people across their organization. With 70+ years of experience, we know that employees will engage and contribute when given information, tools, authority, and respect — and we know our clients achieve their highest aspirations through the commitment and hard work of their people.
More info here: https://www.proudfoot.com/
OPPORTUNITY
We are currently seeking Subject Matter Experts with Management Consulting experience to help our client to achieve levels of performance delivering results on a scale and at speed. We are looking for candidates with strong Procurement experience.
Our SME's assist with the thorough review and re-design of existing business practices and processes for all facets of a client’s business. We are delivering accelerated operational ramp-ups to ensure on time, on cost project completion and time-to-production; We reduce operational conflicts across the silos to ensure “best for project” decisions are implemented, while moving the complexity out of your daily operations. You work with people at all levels within an organization to gain valuable business experience
Our solutions are customized to our client workplace, designed specifically for the client need at hand, ultimately engaging the hearts and minds of people to establish buy-in and maintain their involvement throughout the Proudfoot experience and beyond, empathy and emotional intelligence ate important success factors.
