In this role you will be responsible for testing (and advice in the design/development of) and subsequent monitoring of the financial output of new and changed business (processes) that we implement at Hunkemöller. Furthermore, your input is required in optimizing existing processes to support our growth.
Formally you report to the Manager Financial Administrator but you will also have regular informal contact with other colleagues from the Finance Department, especially the Project Manager and other Hunkemöller Departments, in particular the E-Commerce (Omni-Channel), IT and other business Departments.
With the growth of our Omni-Channel and especially the related wholesale and concessions part, we like to professionalize and speed up the implementation of new businesses.
Your main responsibilities concern the following areas:
Translating business requirements (new contracts) into financial consequences and thus journal entries which amongst others, drive the development/set-up of new business in our commercial IT systems and consequently also in our accounting system
Monitoring that the financial input given is taking into account in the technical and functional set-up in the development phase. Ensuring issues are already tackled as soon as possible in the front-end development of the implementation process
Performing functional with main focus on the financial output testing in SAP
Coordinating/communicating with the several business departments in the design/development, testing and production phases
Monitoringg) the behavior of the implemented in production and come up with corrective actions/suggestions if needed
Participating in the functional testing of small ad-hoc projects
In order to be able to perform the role properly, we ask for the following:
Knowledge of SAP is a must
Knowledge of the English and Dutch language is a must
Can ‘talk' IT and Finance language and has strong affinity with IT related processes
At least 4 years of work experience in this field of expertise
Excellent Excel skills and knowledge of Microsoft Word
Is a good communicator as it also needs strong communication with E-commerce/rest of the business
Stable personality
Hands-on person with a ‘can do' mentality
At least higher education (equivalent HEAO, although on the job experience is just as important)
Hunkemöller strives to be a much loved, social & inclusive brand. A place where people love to work, are proud of the brand, and where we create true brand ambassadors. Working in a passionate, energetic, design-led and performance-driven environment where our key customer persona 'Shero' sits at the heart of everything we do. Hunkemöller is certified TOP EMPLOYER of the Netherlands 2020, which underlines our people initiatives and achievements.
Together Tomorrow – Join a Retailer that's on the move to be better for our planet, better for people, better together! From diversity & inclusion, reducing waste, to product care and how we work with our suppliers, our Together Tomorrow initiative reflects what we do and helps drive change across our business. Ready to help us achieving our ambitious goals? Where ever you'll start working with us, if in Stores or our HQs, you can contribute!
Apply now with your CV or LinkedIn profile only. For this role, we're not looking to work with external agencies.

Hunkemöller is looking for a talented and motivated Finance Tester to join! You are part of the Financial Administration Department at the International HQ of Hunkemöller in Hilversum.

IT Engineer
Amsterdam
30 days contract (potential to extend)
Start - ASAP
We have an urgent requirement for an IT Engineer to help with some IT Tasks in Amsterdam. Our client will need someone to help for 30 days with the option to extend another 30 days. The scope of work for the IT engineer will be:
Re-image, prepare and deploy 45 laptops for desktop replacement project.
Re-image, prepare and deploy laptop for new hires and break fix.
Carry out a full inventory (storage, leaver equipment, update asset management)
Work closely with IT manager and IT colleagues on any physical hands-on requirement/support etc.
Ensure there are enough spare components to swap out any failures for desktops outside of warranty quickly.
Help complete setup on local printer.
Process e-waste
Respond to local IT outages in emergencies.
Please apply with your up-to-date CV for immediate consideration.

The Senior Manager People Systems is End-to-End accountable for all the People Systems both at global as well as regional and local level. In this role you will ensure strategic alignment with our stakeholders within the People department and elsewhere within the organisation leveraging principles around Product Management, User Centricity and Design thinking to optimise an integrated E2E user journey around the total Employee life cycle.
The Senior Manager People Systems is responsible for an integrated, standardised and simple people systems landscape where we adopt as much as possible ‘out of the box’ technology solutions from our preferred vendors (first and foremost Workday). Leveraging practices around Operational Excellence and Offshoring, he/she ensures a maximum return on investments at best costs. The Senior Manager People Systems works closely with peers within the People department as well as with partners from other functional teams (IT Services, Procurement, Finance) to ensure our technology landscape, plans and practices are fully aligned and integrated with the overall Booking.com practices and standards.

Responsibilities

Strategy

Drives the overall strategy for all People related systems and ensures this is aligned and is supporting the overall People department strategy and plans. Ensure technology is leveraged to support the most effective People Service delivery model combining self services with state of the art technologies around digital assistants, knowledge base and case management tools.
Ensures that specific local and regional technology requirements are identified, prioritised, planned and executed as per agreed plans.
Ensures People systems strategy is aligned with other, non People related plans and priorities e.g. IT Services, Finance, Procurement, R&C.
Ensures End-to-End execution of agreed strategy and plans within budget.

Stakeholder Management

Is a partner to the business and works closely with senior managers and their teams within the People department (COE’s, Operations, HRA). As such, acts as a bridge between the Business/functional and the technology teams and ensures that understandable language is used to translate business/functional requirements into technology plans
Works closely with peers within the overall systems/technology environment to ensure the People systems plans are aligned and embedded into the overall technology plans and that IT (Security) standards are met and adhered to.
Ensures clear governance around communication applying the Single Point of Contact (SPOC) principle in order for the stakeholders we work with, clear communication and escalation channels.
Putting the End user at the centre of the People systems and technology design, ensures finding the right balance between the needs of the various stakeholders

Program and Project Management

Ensures that key technology and system investments are properly managed in line with Booking.com project management practices and standards.
Builds capabilities within the team on project and program management to ensure flawless execution of agreed programs and projects.

Operational Excellence

Ensures that the People systems team adopts the highest standards of Operational Excellence and has skills and capabilities to identify issues, address root causes, eliminates waste and drives continuous improvement
Is accountable for the overall RUN/Sustain strategy for the People Systems team to ensure potential issues are addressed within time in line with the agreed SLA’s. Ensures where appropriate that this is aligned with the overall IT Services support model.
Leverages offshore model where possible to minimise non value added work and associated costs.

Budget management

Is accountable for the total budget for People Systems and as such works closely with the Finance team to ensure budget/financial best practices and standards are met.
Ensures that all significant People systems projects and related investments are supported by solid business cases as per agreed standards, templates and timelines

Risk & Control

Ensures the Booking.com Risk and Control standards and practices are adhered to and that the people systems are meeting all related standards (Soxx, SOD)
Works closely with the legal team to ensure that we are compliant against Data privacy legislation (GDPR) and that the data of our candidates and employees is safe with us.

Vendor Management

Is overall accountable for the People Systems landscape and as such also accountable for managing the partnerships with our main technology vendors (Workday).
Works closely with the Procurement team to ensure the People systems team operates in line with agreed Procurement practices and thus ensuring maximum return of investment.
Through networking with other customers, ensures that technology roadmaps of our vendors are influenced to meet our long term technology and systems needs.

People Management

Is responsible for the various teams within the People Systems team: Architecture & integration, Application Management and Technology solutions.
Ensures regional People systems experts presence in APAC (Singapore) and the Americas (Grand rapids)
Provides direction and guidance on key practices around ways of working: E2E thinking, Product Management, Design Thinking, Offshore management, Project Management, SPOC concept
Ensures the right mix of people leveraging our locations, managing our costs and maximizing our partnerships with our technology vendors and our managed services partners.

Requirements

Very strategic: think 3-5 years ahead, understands dependencies
Strong stakeholder management skills operating at ELT level across multiple functions
Strong budget management skills and capabilities to ensure right level of investments and ensure agreed investments are managed properly
Strong People management skills leading a (growing) big team across 4 continents with potentially also a big offshore team.
Strong innovator. Curious in what technology can do to drive a more effective and costs efficient HR function

The opportunity where you will make an impact:

As our Customer Service Team Lead, you will have the opportunity to work closely with the Body&Fit Customer Service team. You will be part of the CS Leadership Team and act as the first point of contact for the CS agents. With your hands on mentality, you will keep a close eye on the targets and ensure the delivery of a balanced set of metrics which support great performance in line with an excellent customer experience at a team and department level.

Full-time · Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Responsible for day-to-day people management of customer service agents and supporting their overall professional development

Allocate work for the CS agents and manage their duty rotation, supported by Senior Level 1 CSRs
Gather key inputs from direct colleagues (on CSR performance) and the Reporting Analyst (on KPIs and workload)
Be the first point of contact for country managers and other departments for handling daily business
Attend and give input in weekly CS management meeting
Actively give input for The Voice of the Customer for TM management
Act as the first point of contact for the CS agents
Maintain the quality of the team and CS department by actively working with the other team leaders within the department
Manage communication with customers through multiple channels including phone, e-mail, chat and social media
Register queries in our customer service system Freshdesk
Increase customer engagement by making every customer feel unique
Actively identify trends and developments in the field of sport, diet, nutrition and healthy lifestyles
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our services and our communication to continuously increase our overall customer satisfaction

What you will bring to Body & Fit

A minimum of 3 years experience with a MBO+/HBO level of education

Proven track record of leadership capabilities
Fluency in Dutch and English
Fluency in any of these languages Russian, Swedish, Polish, Portuguese, Spanish, Italian, German or French would be advantageous
Customer-oriented with an enthusiastic attitude
The ability to multitask with the customer, phone and computer
The ability to be flexible in a dynamic environment
Strong attention to detail
The ability to work independently, but also have a great team spirit
A passion for fitness, nutrition and a healthy lifestyle

What we would like to offer you:

The opportunity to shape your career in our global organisation that is championing the healthy lifestyle movement!

Create your own nutrition formula with a discount on our products!

Are we the right fit for you?

Life is way too short to waste anyone’s time so there are a few things that we would like to be upfront about:

Politics, intrigue, gossip. We’re just way too busy for all that stuff!
Slow moving, corporate environment. We move pretty quickly here so we don’t have room for passengers.

Job Title: Field Application Engineer Internship - Electric Vehicle Charger Solutions

Delta Group is the world's largest provider of switching power supplies and a major source for power management solutions, components, visual displays, industrial automation, networking products, and renewable energy solutions. Established in 1971, Delta Group has sales offices worldwide and manufacturing plants in Taiwan, Thailand, China, Mexico and Europe.
As a global leader in power electronics, Delta is committed to environment protection and has implemented green, lead-free production and recycling and waste management programs for many years. Delta's mission continues to be: "To provide innovative energy-saving products for a better quality of life.”

For our Electric Vehicle Charging Solutions Team we are searching for an enthusiastic Field Application Engineer to help us grow our business from our Hoofddorp office location.

Job Title: Sr. Manager, Facilities (Dutch & English Fluency Required)
Job Description:
Company Description
Our Mission
At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

Job Description
Your Career
We are seeking a colleague who is shaping with us the future of our workplace! Think beyond the office. Redevelop how we make sure to support our colleagues to the best and create a great experience. If you enjoy working independently but collaboratively in a collegial team environment within a fast-paced and dynamic company, this is the right place for you.
Your role is to lead and drive the facilities operations programs and processes; maintaining our lab infrastructure and the office build-outs at our Amsterdam office also leading and driving other Places related projects. All ensuring timely delivery of clearly defined scope within budget. This with the goal to support the business to the best
Your Impact
Innovating and improving processes and scopes. Driving efficiencies and effectiveness
Coaching and development of the Facilities team in AMS
Working with ultimately every employee and translating company culture, values, and strategies into practical application for the workplace
Building year plans and objectives that support our company strategy and business needs
Driving the change in our AMS office towards FLEXWORK. Experience in implementing new office concepts
Partner effectively with key groups such as IT, SAS, Procurement, Finance, and the People team. Maintain regular communications with a variety of stakeholders to ensure that all concerned parties are well informed on relevant topics.
Sourcing local services and goods needed to perform day to day operations through 3rd party suppliers. This in strong cooperation with our US based procurement team
Executing professional supplier management
Responding appropriately to emergencies or urgent issues as they arise and dealing with the consequences. This job requires you to be reachable outside working hours for emergencies
Using performance management techniques to monitor and demonstrate achievement of agreed service levels and to lead on improvement
Planning best allocation and utilisation of space and resources. Short and mid term.
Implementing existing or new (global) processes/policies/procedures
Executing tenders. From preparing tender documents to signing off contracts in line with company policies and with involvement of right stakeholders and onboarding vendors
Having good knowledge of relevant Workplace Law and regulations
Developing and implementing sustainable ideas and solutions
Participating in or leading global project groups within the Places department
Understanding the impact you have on our carbon footprint and waste contribution, and knowing how to minimize this

Qualifications
Your Experience
Minimum of 10 years experience ensuring continuity of operations and maintenance /repairs in offices and lab spaces
Developing, directing, coordinating and planning essential central services such as maintenance/repairs, mail, shipping/receiving archiving, cleaning, food, waste disposal and recycling
Professional supplier management in a corporate/commercial environment
Responding appropriately to emergencies or urgent issues as they arise and dealing with the consequences. This job requires you to be reachable outside working hours for emergencies
Planning best allocation and utilisation of space, resources and office concepts. Short and mid term
Executing tenders. From preparing tender documents to signing off contracts in line with company policies and with involvement of right stakeholders and onboarding vendors
Project management (hard-, soft services and construction projects) and supervising and coordinating the work of contractors, ensure minimum disruption to core activities
Fluency in Dutch and English
Bachelor's Degree
Additional Information
The Team
The Places team constantly strives to make our work environment comfortable, effective, productive and appealing. The workplace has a direct impact on your happiness, productivity, and how we can accomplish our mission. As a team, we take care of the day to day facilities services throughout our organization. We own the build-out projects while maintaining a productive, innovative environment for the business to work in.
Our Commitment

We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.

Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

Are you looking for a sales management position within a high potential, start-up environment? Then you should check out this opportunity!

The opportunity
The new economy and changing consumer behaviour is changing the way retailers and brands are managing their products and inventory. Lots of profit is being burned because of inefficiencies in the supply chain, inventories and (online) stores.

This startup is solving these problems by providing a innovative, data-driven platform and is actually contributing to a world with less waste of consumer goods!
With a team of only 10 FTE, they have already been able to close Enterprises such as Levi's and Under Armour. They have a great reputation in Europe and demand for their state-of-the-art solution is growing rapidly.
Therefor, the phase of founder led sales is coming to an end, and it is time for a great Head of Sales to step in and lead this promising company through the next growth phase.

Your profile
At least 5-10 years of sales experience (SaaS)Hands-on mentality (deal closing) and strategic/tactical skillsBachelor and/or Master degree

The offer
Salary up/to €90k base + secondary benefitsMaking a serious impact on this company's growth trajectoryReporting directly into CEO

Next steps
Are you excited to learn more, or would you like to apply straight away? Then I encourage you to either email/call me or hit "apply now"!

Facilities Coordinator

The Company
This company is leading in the development of innovative cancer immunotherapies with a goal of providing rapid, long-term durable response and eliminating the burden of chronic care. In this position you will be joining a newly formed team in which people of all backgrounds and experiences are respected. While working together with a focus on saving lives by finding a cure for cancer. You’ll be reporting to the Senior Manager, Facilities.
Responsibilities
You’ll be part of building up the Engineering & Facilities organization and systems for the newly build manufacturing site in Hoofddorp. The Facilities Coordinator is responsible for one of the three following areas; Gowning & Cleaning, Waste Management & Pest Control, Catering & Hospitality. You will be one of three coordinators in the Facilities department. Performing all tasks associated with the manufacturing of clinical and commercial products following batch records and SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures)
Compile hourly user statistics and prepare staff reports, facility issues, participant concerns. Assisting in the development and optimization of SOPs and Batch records
Supervises facilities specialist
Schedules the daily activities of specialist in facilities operations
Work on routine assignments following established SOPs and GMP guidance
Coordinates the activities on site contractors undertaking facilities operations and services
Exercises judgement within generally defined practices and policies in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results

Requirements
Higher professional education (Facility Management, Hotelschool)
Good writing and speaking skills English language
Preferably experience in a process-driven pharmaceutical environment or other highly regulated industries

De rol
Beschik jij over de combinatie van procesmatig werken en verbinding maken met mensen? Heb je wat met duurzaamheid? En ben je wel in voor een uitdaging waarbij je jouw talenten, kennis en ervaring in kunt zetten en een flinke verbeterslag kunt maken binnen een toekomstgericht bedrijf? Lees snel verder!

Jouw rol
Je vervult een voor Blue Phoenix nieuwe rol waarin je verantwoordelijk bent voor het onderhoud voor de vestiging in Assendelft. In Assendelft staat de grootste bodemas wasinstallatie ter wereld waarbij 600.000 ton per jaar wordt verwerkt. De installatie is in 2019 gebouwd en sinds een klein jaar operationeel. Je krijgt uitgebreid de ruimte om je de specialistische processen eigen te maken en er zijn collega’s met veel kennis op wie je terug kunt vallen met vragen.
Jouw rol is in de volgende hoofdtaken te verdelen;
de dagelijkse aansturing van het onderhoudsteam,verantwoordelijk voor de onderhoudsplanning, inclusief aanschaf en beheer van onderdelen,het begeleiden van verbeterprojecten,het vastleggen en structureren van onderhoudsprocessen.
Je werkt nauw samen met de manager productie en de operators om processen optimaal op elkaar te laten aansluiten. Op de plant leg je verantwoording af aan de plantmanager.

Dagelijkse aansturing
Je geeft leiding en/of sturing aan twee vaste medewerkers en een ruime schil aan ingehuurde gespecialiseerde onderaannemers. Met veel van hen is een relatie opgebouwd die je warm krijgt overgedragen. Elke twee weken is er een onderhoudsdag, die jij coördineert en plant. Je zorgt dat de juiste onderaannemers aanwezig zijn, instrueert en begeleidt hen en zorgt dat ze de juiste werkzaamheden verrichten.

Onderhoudsplanning
Om de jaardoelstellingen te kunnen behalen dienen de installaties in een goede staat van onderhoud te verkeren en te blijven. Het planmatig organiseren en bewaken van het 1e en 2e lijns onderhoud is één van jouw hoofdtaken. Het systematisch beheren van de kritische spareparts en slijtdelen is hiervoor noodzakelijk.

Verbeterprojecten
Natuurlijk kan er nog van alles verbeterd worden aan deze vrij jonge installatie en hier ligt dan ook een grote uitdaging. Aan jou de taak om met voorstellen te komen hoe het proces stabieler (met minder storingen/downtime) kan operereren. Deze voorstellen kunnen leiden tot ombouwprojecten en mogelijk grote investeringen waarvan jij de trekker zal zijn. Zoals altijd moet er een goede balans zijn tussen de productie en het onderhoud. Aan jou de uitdaging om, op een plezierige doch strak georganiseerde wijze, de samenwerking met de productieafdeling op te zetten en in te vullen.

Vastleggen en structureren
Jij gaat aan de slag met het creëren van overzicht en duidelijkheid door structuren, processen en werkwijzen in kaart te brengen, te optimaliseren en vast te leggen. Onderhoudsprocessen maak je visueel, de administratieve handelingen meer gestructureerd en overzichtelijker en planningen worden geoptimaliseerd. Je zorgt dat je verbinding maakt met de medewerkers, hen betrekt bij de verbeterplannen en draagvlak creëert waarbij heldere communicatie voorop staat. Ook leg je scheidingen van taken en verantwoordelijkheden vast en begeleidt en coach je medewerkers bij hun werk.

Kortom: door jouw proactieve en gestructureerde manier van werken, ontstaat een goed georganiseerde onderhoudsorganisatie met overzicht en rust met als gevolg daarvan meer efficiëntie en werkplezier!

Standplaats: Assendelft
Wat ga je doen?
Vacature
Wat is vereist?
Afgeronde MTS / HTS-opleiding;
Ervaring met de toegepaste technieken zoals pompen, hydrocyclonage, natte zeeftechnieken, transportbanden, feeders, metaalterugwinning, indikkers, ontwateringstechnologie en fysisch/chemische waterzuivering;
Ervaring met het aansturen van een technische dienst;
Woonachtig in Noord Holland;

Persoonskenmerken
Je bent een people manager die met energie en enthousiasme anderen motiveert en tegelijkertijd structuur weet aan te brengen en helder communiceert. Je houdt van de combinatie van theorie en praktijk en staat zelf ook graag “met je voeten in de klei”.

Door je brede technische kennis ben je in staat de complexe processen binnen de installaties te doorgronden en eigen te maken. Na de uitgebreide inwerkperiode heb je de potentie en interesse uit te groeien tot de technisch expert van de installatie.

Over alle details, informatiestromen, betrokken partijen en belangen weet jij het overzicht te houden en kom je tot realistische planningen. Je bent in staat processen in te richten en te bewaken. Hierbij ben je proactief en zorg je dat zaken soepel verlopen waarbij ruimte is te anticiperen op onverwachte situaties.

Je maakt graag verbinding met mensen, weet het beste in anderen naar boven te halen, bent toegankelijk, betrouwbaar en voorspelbaar ‘omdat je zegt wat je doet en doet wat je zegt’. Je werkt graag samen met anderen en bent je ervan bewust dat je andere nodig hebt om ‘de klus te klaren’. Toch ben jij ook degene die de beslissingen neemt, want je weet waar het over gaat en bent in staat de lijnen uit te zetten.
Info
 Standplaats Assendelft
 40-urige werkweek
 Technisch Management
 Afgeronde MTS/HTS opleiding
 Ervaring aansturen technische dienst
Vacature
Werken bij Blue Phoenix Group
Dit is waar Blue Phoenix Group voor staat:

De as in ons bedrijf komt van energiebedrijven die afval verwerken. Deze zogenaamde waste-to-energy fabrieken doen er alles aan om zoveel mogelijk uit afval te halen. Ondanks dat blijft er uiteindelijk as over als residu. Als dit residu niet wordt gerecycled, wordt het meestal begraven op een stortplaats.

Bij Blue Phoenix Group, zien we stortplaatsen niet als de eindbestemming voor asresidu. Nee, we zien nieuwe kansen. We zien materialen om gebouwen mee te bouwen, snelwegen en bestrating aan te leggen. We zien metalen voor nieuwe auto’s, computers en mobiele telefoons. En we zien een toekomst waarin waste-to-energy volledig circulair is.

Bij Blue Phoenix Group zijn we ervan overtuigd dat er niet zoiets bestaat als afval. Met een gepassioneerd team helpen we wereldwijd waste-to-energy bedrijven om te recyclen wat onmogelijk te recyclen lijkt te zijn. We staan niet alleen in deze missie en bundelen krachten waar we dat kunnen. We werken nauw samen met fabrieken, makers van overheidsbeleid, toezichthouders, engineers en wetenschappers. Samen kunnen we een bijdrage leveren aan een meer duurzame wereld.

“We zijn Blue Phoenix werkend aan een duurzame toekomst.”
Pernis
 Gepassioneerd team
 Werken aan een duurzame toekomst!

Alkmaar Fulltime
Who is PALLAS?
PALLAS’s mission is to provide unique solutions for nuclear medicine and research.

Our vision is to build a safe, state-of-the-art facility to become the world’s leading producer of radioisotopes for nuclear medicines and to enable nuclear technology research. The PALLAS-reactor will be the first in the industry to be privately financed, owned and operated, and it will be built in Petten, Noord-Holland, on the site of the existing High Flux Reactor.

PALLAS aspires to become a high-reliability organisation with the skills and capability to deliver its mission and vision through its core values, whilst ensuring that its safety, security and quality objectives are always achieved. We apply our unique knowledge and experience to benefit society by taking interest in our stakeholders.

PALLAS is composed of colleagues coming from all over the world, bringing together a unique set of knowledge and experience. Everyone in PALLAS is required to take personal responsibility for the safety of themselves and of anyone who is directly or indirectly affected by their actions. A high safety culture is continuously built by the organisation.
Function
The main role of PALLAS is being the Intelligent Customer and this entails overseeing the use of specialised contractors and subcontractors responsible for the design, construction and operation of the PALLAS-reactor.

The PALLAS Reactor Process & Plant Systems Engineer, supports the PALLAS lead Reactor Process & Plant Systems Engineer to maintain oversight of the design. This means support in monitoring of the delegated Design Authority and support in ensuring the right design delivered by the contactors enabling the PALLAS-reactor’s mission. The right design includes a design that is constructible, commissionable, operable, maintainable and decommission-able as per the PALLAS drivers.

Oversight includes providing inputs to the design, assessing the design against the PALLAS technical requirements and inputs, guiding the designer to implement requirements in an integrated balanced way, coordinating external interfaces, interfacing with licensing on conventional permits as well as supporting Safety Demonstration, Licensing, Project Management Office, Quality, Procurement, and Licensing under the supervision of the lead reactor systems engineer.
Activities
As a Reactor Process & Plant Systems Engineer, your tasks will include:

Support Owner of requirements (Reactor Process and Plant Systems) by defining and/or understanding the systems requirements.
Support Owner of design (Reactor Process and Plant Systems) providing design inputs to the contractor, ensuring the contractor uses the correct inputs, and ensuring the design complies to the requirements, using engineering judgement to assess the methodology/design criteria/design approach, ensuring the preliminary safety analysis report (PSAR) is aligned with the design, overseeing external interfaces, ensuring the design is construct-able, commissionable, operable, maintainable and decommission-able.
Support Owner of Design Baseline (Reactor Process and Plant Systems) by reviewing and accepting the design baseline for Reactor Process and Plant systems.
Intelligent Customer Service (Reactor Process and Plant Systems) by reviewing and accepting the design baseline for reactor systems.
Support Owner External interface (casks for wet loading, secondary cooling) by understanding why the reactor is what it is, supporting in presenting the design to the Authority for Nuclear Safety & Radiation Protection (ANVS) and other authorities and act as Work Package Owner for Contractor led work packages.
Support Subject Matter Lead (Reactor Process and Plant Systems) by applying expert knowledge in review of the design, application of codes and standards (C&S) and identifying technical risks.

In your role you will have responsibilities in the area described below.

Right Design review: Support Lead in performing right design reviews on detailed design deliverables:
Procurement packages
Manufacturing packages
Construction packages
Test & inspection plans
Manuals
Selected design information
Monitoring performance of delegated design authority: Support Lead in monitoring the performance of the delegated design authority by conducting audits and checks on systems to identify risks associated or corrective actions with the system
Correct Design: Support Lead to use engineering judgement to perform correct designs reviews on a high level considering the following:
Correctness of design input used.
Correctness approach/methodology used.
Correctness of Verification & Validation (V&V) approach and outcome of the V&V process.
Correctness of design output.
Interfacing with PALLAS appointed third party reviewers.
Support work: Support the following streams:
Project Management Office (PMO)
Business Case
Safety Demonstration
Licensing (discussions with the Authority for Nuclear Safety & Radiation Protection -ANVS – and permitting)
Procurement
Commissioning and Operational Readiness
Construction
Quality

Your profile
We are looking for Subject Matter Experts, who is:

Knowledgeable in the requested field taking responsibility of your assigned tasks and systems.
Proactive and solution orientated.
Able to work in a team, work with stakeholders and do efficient reporting to her/his manager.
Worked with contractors before.

You have a degree in Process Engineering and at least 5 years of professional experience, including experience with systems engineering.

You have relevant experience (12 months or more) in one or more of the following projects:

Nuclear Research reactor in Argentina (RA-10), Brazil (RMB), Australia (OPAL), Germany (FRM) or Belgium (BR II).
NPP Reactor (preferably pressurized water reactor – PWR – type): design, manufacturing, construction, commissioning, operations.

Languages: English (spoken and written)

You have previous working experience for an “Intelligent customer” and are able to understand the position as an Owner or as a client.

You have also experience in the following technology:

Cooling systems
Purchase specifications for process equipment e.g. pumps, heat exchangers, piping etc.
Handling of radioactive waste
Thermo hydraulics
Interface management
System engineering principles

Desired skills
In your role you will oversee the design of mechanical components. You will not perform the design work but you will need to assess whether the design fulfil requirements.

As a result, a basic knowledge of the following Codes & Standards is preferred:

ASME BPVC Section VIII div. 1
ASME B31.1
ASME B31.3
ASME B73.1
PED

What we offer
PALLAS offers a very competitive salary ranging from € 3.500 – 4.500 gross per month plus holidays allowance (8%), to be discussed depending on your education and experience.

If you are moving from abroad, PALLAS offers a full relocation package.
Additional information
If you have questions about the position, please contact our HR department. You can send an e-mail to Maartje Hageman via hrm@pallasreactor.com or call +31 (0)88 20 24 024.

An AIVD screening (level B) is part of the selection process. More information about the screening can be found on: https://english.aivd.nl/.

Applications
You can apply via Recruitment Organisation Thomas Thor. You can apply directly on their website.

Ben jij ambitieus, sociaal en sta je open voor een nieuwe uitdaging? Wil je graag een eerste stap maken in de mode industrie en werken aan nieuwe projecten binnen een dynamisch merk? Dan heeft Michael & Giso dé perfecte stageplek voor je! Samen met een jong en energiek team ga jij je focussen op onze store in Breda.
Kleren maken de man. Wij geloven dat een maatpak de basis vormt van de moderne garderobe. Met een obsessie voor traditionele ambacht, unieke materialen en eigenzinnige design, ontwerpen wij bespoke wardrobe essentials, geïnspireerd op de identiteit van ieder individu. Hierin staat de relatie met de klant centraal. Slow Tailoring geeft ons volledige controle over het ontwerp en de pasvorm, zonder concessies te hoeven doen op kwaliteit of duurzaamheid. Hiermee bieden we een eerlijk, zero-waste alternatief op confectiekleding en zijn we toonaangevend binnen de Nederlandse mode industrie.

Wij zijn een jong en energiek team, met passie voor het vak. Van prachtige campagne shoots tot het lanceren van een exclusief magazine, we zijn continu in beweging. Met nieuwe winkels op de planning groeien we snel uit tot een internationaal merk. Kom jij ons team versterken?

Functiebeschrijving

Tijdens deze stage wordt jij het aanspreekpunt van onze winkel in Breda. Jij weet als geen ander wat er speelt, welke klanten er verwacht worden en of alles voor deze klanten goed geregeld is. Samen met de store manager houdt jij je bezig met het optimaliseren van de winkel en de ervaringen van de klant. Van het eerste contact met klanten, tot het organiseren van events jij voelt je als een vis in het water in de organisatie. Ook biedt je ondersteuning in operationele activiteiten zoals het verwerken van orders en het coördineren van leveranciers wereldwijd. Een uitdagende functie, waarbij je de vrijheid krijgt om je eigen strategie te bepalen en de fijne kneepjes van het vak te leren.

Your Key Responsibilites:
Structuring and standardization of content created by Master Service Engineer and Level 2 Support Specialists
Implementation and maintenance of technical content incl. manuals, legal and safety requirements in the Knowledge Management system
Implementation of workflows, checklists and decision trees in the Knowledge Management system
Alignment of new content with Master Service Engineer
Maintenance of FAQs
Content deletion of EOL products
Super user for Knowledge Management system incl. user administration

Qualifications

8+ Years of experience handling content for Knowledge Management systems
Excellent knowledge of Knowledge Management systems and functionality
Good technical understanding
Highly proficient in English - proficiency in German or French would be an advantage
Excellent communication and writing skills
Good MS Office knowledge
Experience with SharePoint, Photoshop and video editing software would be an advantage
Additional Information
Our Offer
As an innovative and global company, you are offered a friendly working atmosphere and a constructive working environment leaving much room for new possibilities and ideas. Use this opportunity and show us your motivation.

We’re looking for a seasoned contributor that can deliver excellent design for our web platform and native apps. Detail and data obsessed, you’ll be happy working in a high ambiguity environment and possess the skills to raise the design bar at Greetz.Reporting to the Head of Product Design, you’ll be working on some of our most high value features, pairing with engineers, researchers and Product Managers as necessary. You’ll have autonomy over strategy and execution with guidance from a high profile leadership team and peers across the Product team.You’ll get the best of startup culture at a household-name company which helps millions of people each year show that they care.Your activitiesHelp manage and maintain Breekz Design SystemDefining and delivering intuitive, efficient and delightful user experiences across our website and appsWorking collaboratively in a flexible way with other Designers, Product Managers, Researchers, Engineers and StakeholdersHelping define design team processes through thought leadership and your ability to operate strategically as well as at a pixel levelWork closely with Product Managers to help facilitate ideation process, support limiting development waste and drive ideas validationProduce concepts and prototypes knowing when to deliver pixel-perfect solutions and when to make low fidelity sketches and prototypesHelping Product Design become even closer to EngineeringYour profile5+ years of experience designing high quality interfaces in App and Web devicesA strong understanding of interaction design, visual design, design patterns and user experience standardsWide range of prototyping techniques at various speeds and levels of fidelityExperience with Figma prototyping toolComfortable working in an agile, fast-paced environment to deliver high-quality work consistently in an iterative mannerHands on experience with UX Research techniquesUnderstanding of front and back-end technologies and capabilitiesAbility to communicate and defend design decisions in front of senior stakeholdersAbility to leverage data and formulate a compelling business case for design initiativesGrowth mindsetWhat we offer?We offer an inspiring job at one of Netherlands’ leading E-commerce organisations. We have an informal culture, with short communication lines. It is good to know that the office personnel works from home due to the Covid restrictions. We will hopefully get back to the office in the new year. This role will initially be for a period for one year, but with the option to extend.Application procedureThe interview process is intensive and consists of several steps. You will speak with the Greetz Recruiter and the Head of Product Design. Besides that we ask you to speak to the Product Design team and after that you will have to run through whiteboard exercises with your (hopefully) future colleagues. We’ll make it a ride, are you ready!About GreetzWith over 160 colleagues we work together on the same mission, delivering that smile to our customers. All our 3 million customers return to our online platform to look for that special present to surprise someone or to let somebody know that they’re thinking of them. We have a wide variety of products. We started 15 years ago by selling real cards online but have grown into the online platform for personal surprises such as flowers, balloons, photo gifts and cards. Since 2018 we are part of the Moonpig Group.Contractduur 12 maandenSoort dienstverband: Fulltime, Bepaalde tijdSalaris: €5.000,00 - €6.000,00 per maandAanvullende betalingen:BonusregelingVakantiegeldArbeidsvoorwaarden:GezondheidsprogrammaPensioenPersoneelskortingReiskostenvergoedingTelefoonplanVrijdagmiddagborrelWerk vanuit huisWerkschema:ma-vr

Job Title: Field Application Engineer (FAE) - Electrical Vehicle Charging Solution
Job Description:
Company Description

Delta Group is the world's largest provider of switching power supplies and a major source for power management solutions, components, visual displays, industrial automation, networking products, and renewable energy solutions. Established in 1971, Delta Group has sales offices worldwide and manufacturing plants in Taiwan, Thailand, China, Mexico and Europe.
As a global leader in power electronics, Delta is committed to environment protection and has implemented green, lead-free production and recycling and waste management programs for many years. Delta's mission continues to be: "To provide innovative energy-saving products for a better quality of life.”

Job Description

For our Electrical Vehicle Charging Solution (EVCS) Team we are searching for an experienced Field Application Engineer (FAE) to help grow our business in France from our office location in Hoofddorp.
Main Job Responsibilities:
Offer technical support to sales and product marketing in an accurate and timely manner
Support the process of tender preparation by creating proposals and advising on solutions
Support the identification of new market opportunities
Handling service requests and support resolving technical problems
Occasional on-site support for complex technical issues
Support the relationship management and service delivery for business accounts
Demonstrate a deep understanding of our company product lines

Qualifications

Bachelor/Master Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent
3-5 years experience within Electric Vehicle Charging Solution, Energy Storage Systems or Power Conditioning Systems
Fluent English and French skills
Excellent technical knowledge and understanding of Electric Vehicle Charging Solutions and Energy Storage Systems.
Outstanding problem solving, critical thinking and troubleshooting skills
Capability to work independently and in international team
Customer focus, good communication and interpersonal skills
Possibility to travel occasionally
In passions of a driver’s license
Additional Information

Our Offer
As an innovative and global company, you are offered a friendly working atmosphere and a constructive working environment leaving much room for new possibilities and ideas. Use this opportunity and show us your motivation.

About Sapient: We are a social business catalysing sustainable environmental and social impact actions in our society, through multiple projects and collaborations. Sapient Social & Environmental Enterprises was established in 2016 and consists of a team of bright, young inspired individuals, from across the globe who dedicate themselves to stop food waste, renew democracy, provide local green energy solutions, and help other social businesses in their path to positive impact.Healthy and Affordable: H&Aff is an independent social business from Sapient whose aim is to reduce the amount of food being wasted in Amsterdam, starting from its collection and ending in its new market launch. The unwanted food is first collected from food suppliers then dehydrated, frozen and pickled. Our new product is then ready to be repackaged and finally put on the market again. All the profit that we earn from the product sales is invested back into the fight against food waste in Amsterdam.Graphic Designer: Do you enjoy web design? Are you an enthusiast of creating banners and playing around with different software? Would you like to apply your amazing talent and make the world a better place? Then search no more because we are looking for you!Your tasks will include: Making illustrations, editing images, designing and updating page layouts and web pages through Wix.Creating social media posts and collaborating with other departments and projects.Offline communication design such as banners, ads, logos, flyers, stickers, t-shirts etc.Meeting with clients to gain an understanding of their needs.2D animation and video editing.Do you fit our profile?Good communication skills,Excellent English speaking and writing skills,Open-minded and willing to learn and jump into projects,A software enthusiast (we generally work with the Adobe Suite so it would be ideal to know the basics of the most popular programs: Photoshop, Illustrator and Indesign),Some knowledge about visual communication in terms of how things relate to each other (text, images etc),Time management skills,Enjoys working in an international, challenging and social environment.What we offer: This is a non-paid internship. So what’s in it for you?A more in-depth understanding of social business and its social & environmental impact,The opportunity to participate in a dynamic, proactive and young environment,Autonomy and flexible working hours,The power to make a difference,The opportunity to acquire new skills, learn and grow,Amazing colleagues.Internship Details: Currently, we are looking for a new intern to join us from mid-march for a minimum of 3 months.Unfortunately, the internship is unpaid, however, you can choose the duration that suits you best (minimum of three months). Also, you can choose your own working hours as full-time or part-time as long as you strictly follow the program you set for yourself.Due to Corona restrictions, it is possible to work remotely for this position.About the team: Our interns are called Padawans who are highly motivated to make the world a better place. The Sapient team consists of people who are team-oriented, goal-driven, proactive, independent and open-minded. We work both in teams and individually. So, we are looking for like-minded people to join our team.To keep the team spirit during the Corona times, we have team meetings at least once a week and once a month we organize Sapient Days with fun online activities in order to welcome new Padawans and to strengthen our sense of belonging.Contact information: If this sounds appealing to you please send us your CV, motivation letter and portfolio (all documents must be in English). Make sure to include “Internship Application (position) MM.YY – MM.YY)” in the subject header with the position you are applying for and your dates of availability. We look forward to hearing from you!If you are applying from outside the EU and you do not have a working visa, please ensure that you sort out how you plan to arrange your stay in the Netherlands. We do not offer any assistance regarding visas and permits.Please, be aware that we review applications as we receive them. Therefore, we strongly suggest applying early to maximize your chances.Websites: https://www.sapientsee.com/https://sapientsee.wixsite.com/healthyandaffordableVerwachte startdatum: 15-3-2021Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, InternshipWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.About the business:Every month Marktplaats handles over 8 million unique visitors and 350.000 new advertisements each day making Marktplaats the largest online trading platform in the Netherlands. Consumer and professional sellers offer a large and varied assortment of used and new products. But we want to go even further - we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. We are a mix of Dutch and Silicon Valley cultures; like both, we are an international team of passionate people who share a common interest in solving problems using software and data. We invite you to join us!This role is located within our User Experience & Design team, where you are part of a group of Product designers, researchers and other UX specialists. Besides that, you also work in a cross-functional team that is focussed on creating the best experience in the field of advertising. Your goal is to create the most wonderful experience for our users by balancing their needs and the business needs of advertisers. In this team you will collaborate with a product manager, mobile/front-end developers, back-end developers, product analysts, data scientists, marketing, customer service and more.We’re looking for an experienced Product Designer that:Shows leadership in defining, communicating and executing a design vision & strategy in delivering strategic objectives.Applies strong partner leadership skills to balance user and business needs.Encourage and collaborate with people from other subject areas, like product managers, developers and data analysts.Owns and is accountable for all aspects of the design process.Is experienced in designing a multi-platform experience for Android, iOS and web.Knows how to apply modern Design Thinking methods. You are comfortable organising and leading Design sprints and/or workshops.Is comfortable in combining research and data insights to drive decision making in the designing and the solution exploration.Validates design solutions using both qualitative and quantitative methods.Is Proficient in English.Bonus points: experience in the e-commerce and/or advertising domain.What we offer you:The User Experience & Design team is a young and quickly evolving team that focuses on continuous improvement, for example through team training.Together we create an environment with a lot of opportunity to express yourself, share your ideas and collaborate to make it happen.Learning, education and personal development are key when you work at Marktplaats & 2dehands. You have influence in your growth path with your own education budget.The position you have as a designer in your cross-functional team gives you the opportunity to be part of defining and influence the direction of the critical initiatives of your team.Interested?From the moment that you join our team we aspire to make your employment experience an outstanding and engaging one. If you are enthusiastic and thrive in a collaborative and friendly environment, just apply!Benefits:Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs.We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel Marktplaats is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about our Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/Covid-19People are the heart of the eBay Classifieds business, and their health and well-being are our first priority.We continue to monitor local government guidance and partner closely with medical advisors to determine the safest and best next steps for everyone. As a result, most teams are working remotely, with a few teams able to collaborate in person with enhanced safety procedures. We will discuss the particular case for your region during the interview process. As a general rule, interviews will be completed remotely over video calls.eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.

Company Name: DoubleTree by Hilton Amsterdam Centraal Station
Job Description:
Demi Chef de Partie
Altijd al willen werken in het grootste hotel in het centrum van Amsterdam?

DoubleTree by Hilton Amsterdam Centraal Station biedt prachtige uitzichten, buitengewone service en bruisende food & beverage outlets.

In ons hotel vind je SkyLounge Amsterdam, award-winning rooftop terras, pop-up restaurant Eastwood Beer & Grill, onze eigen Starbucks® store en het meest gevarieerde ontbijtbuffet van de stad. Natuurlijk krijg jij in al onze outlets 50% korting! Daarnaast kun jij naast je baan onbeperkt fit blijven. Onze fitness is namelijk 24/7 beschikbaar voor jou!

Als Demi Chef de Partie ben je verantwoordelijk voor voedselvoorbereiding op hoog niveau op een specifike sectie en het tegelijktijdig assisteren van de Chef de Partie bij dagelijkse werkzaamheden.


Deel uitmaken van ons team als Demi Chef de Partie, betekent teamlid worden voor een van de beste werkgevers van Nederland. Met name omdat de zorg voor ons team een van onze topprioriteiten is! Met een jong team van ongeveer 35 chefs is er voor iedereen een plek. Chef-kok Paul Stoop is een gerenommeerde chef die de keuken al jaren verbetert. Jij zou de toevoeging kunnen zijn die we zoeken om het nog beter te maken!

Van Wagyu tot T-bone, ons Eastwood Beer & Grill restaurant staat bekend om kwaliteit steaks. Natuurlijk serveren wij onze andere gerechten ook met de hoogste kwaliteit van zorg en creativiteit. Naast ons Eastwood Beer & Grill restaurant ben je ook verantwoordelijk voor de gerechten in SkyLounge Amsterdam. Hier worden je organisatorische vaardigheden getest en kun je laten zien of je kunt presteren in een drukke, dynamische omgeving. Van zelfgemaakte sushi tot ijs, het staat allemaal op de kaart.

Je bent mede-verantwoordelijk voor een bepaalde sectie, dit in samenwerking met andere (Demi) Chef’s. Als Demi Chef de Partie zal je ook verantwoordelijkheid dragen voor de kostenbeheersing, afvalbeheer en bestellingen. Specifiek zal je verantwoordelijk zijn voor het uitvoeren van de volgende taken:
Zorg ervoor dat alle voedsel voorbereiding voldoet aan de normen
Houd alle werkruimtes schoon en netjes en zorg dat er geen kruisbesmetting kan plaatsvinden
Voorbereiden van alle mise en place voor de relevante menu's
Het ondersteunen van andere afdelingen waar nodig en onderhouden van goede werkrelaties
Verslag en beheer van het onderhoud, de hygiëne en de gevaren
Wees milieubewust

Als Chef de Partie die werkt met onze DoubleTree by Hilton-merkstandaarden, werk je altijd namens onze gasten. Om deze rol met succes te vervullen, is het belangrijk dat je de volgende vaardigheden bezit:
Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Demi Chef de Partie of een vergelijkbare rol
Een actuele, geldige en relevante commerciële kwalificatie op het gebied van koken (bewijs vereist)
Uitstekende kennis van voedsel
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, met name in het Engels
NVQ Niveau 2
Behaald Basis-Hygiëne Certificaat
Een positieve, proactieve en assertieve houding
Vermogen om te werken onder druk
Zowel zelfstandig als in teamverband kunnen werken

In deze functie is het een pré indien je kennis bezit over huidige eet-trends en Intermediate Food Hygiene kennis bezit.


En, voor wij het vergeten, naast de vele faciliteiten binnen ons hotel kun je zelf natuurlijk ook genieten van de Hilton service, wereldwijd en met korting!

Altijd al willen weten hoe het is om bij DoubleTree by Hilton Amsterdam Centraal Station te werken? Bekijk dan onze team member video: https://youtu.be/2BaXEjZfbTI Demi Chef de Partie
Always wanted to work in the largest hotel in the center of Amsterdam?

DoubleTree by Hilton Amsterdam Centraal Station offers amazing views, extraordinary service and lively food & beverage outlets.

Our hotel includes SkyLounge Amsterdam, an award-winning rooftop terrace, pop-up restaurant Eastwood Beer & Grill, our very own Starbucks® Store and Amsterdam’s most extended breakfast buffet. You will, of course, receive a 50% discount in all of our food & beverage outlets. Moreover, you can stay fit next to your job. Our fitness is available 24/7 for you!

A Demi Chef de Partie is responsible for ensuring high levels of food preparation on a specific section to deliver an excellent experience while assisting the Chef de Partie with all daily tasks. As an employee of DoubleTree by Hilton Amsterdam Centraal Station, you will be a part of one of the best employers in The Netherlands. Taking care of our team is one of our top priorities! With a young team of about 35 chefs, there is a place for everybody. Executive Chef Paul Stoop is a renowned chef who has been improving the kitchen for years. You could be the addition we are looking for to make it even better!

From Wagyu to T-bone, our Eastwood Beer & Grill restaurant is known to offer the best quality steaks. Likewise, our other dishes show the highest quality and creativity. Besides our Eastwood Beer & Grill restaurant, you will also be responsible for the dishes in SkyLounge Amsterdam. Here, your organisational skills are tested and you can show whether you are able to perform in a busy and dynamic environment. From homemade sushi to ice cream, we have it all!


You will be partly responsible for a specific partie and working with the other (Demi) Chef de Partie’s on your section. A Demi Chef de Partie will also be required to assist with food cost controls like waste control and inventory management. Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:
Ensuring all food preparation meets standards
Keeping all working areas clean and tidy and omitting cross contamination
Preparing all mise en place for all relevant menus
Assisting other departments wherever necessary and maintaining good working relationships
Reporting and controlling maintenance, hygiene and hazard issues
Being environmentally aware
A Demi chef de Parti working with DoubleTree by Hilton brand standards is always working on behalf of our Guests. To successfully fill this role, it is important that you have the following skills:
A minimum of 2 years of previous experience as a Demi Chef de Partie or a similar role
A current, valid, and relevant trade commercial cookery qualification (proof may be required)
Excellent knowledge of food
Great communication skills
NVQ Level 2
Achieved Basic Food Hygiene Certificate
Positive, proactive and assertive attitude
Ability to work under pressure
Ability to work on your own or in a team
Excellent English speaking skills
It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:
Intermediate Food Hygiene
Knowledge of current food trends

Before we forget: next to our own facilities, you can also enjoy our Hilton service, worldwide and with a discount.

Would you like to know what life as a team member at DoubleTree by Hilton Amsterdam Centraal Station looks like? Have a look at our team member impression video: https://youtu.be/2BaXEjZfbTI

Job Title: SaaS Account Executive - Nordic and Benelux
Job Description:
Accelerate your sales career with the best in the industry!


Every day, we help companies to make the world a better place. One of North America’s fastest-growing technology companies, our software empowers better corporate decision making. We do this by providing a window into an organization’s global supply chain and the factories in which their products are manufactured, to reduce compliance risks, environmental waste, and prevent human rights abuse.
As we continue to expand our European operations, we are looking to grow our team of high-performing Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) Account Executives. Our ideal candidates bring significant experience in developing relationships with senior executives and have a proven track record of success selling in a B2B, SaaS environment. We are specifically looking for individuals who are driven to succeed and thrive on the challenge that comes with taking a new product to market.


What you will do:

Prospect and sell to new logos
Establish and develop an account-based sales strategy to achieve sales quotas
Follow a systematic sales process to progress prospect sales campaigns
Win new customers through self-sourcing activities, research, responding to leads, and building exceptional internal and external relationships
Manage a complex sales-cycle to prospective senior executives and/or multiple constituencies within an organization (Manufacturing Operations, Demand Management, Finance, IT)
Partner with Business Development to grow and optimize your pipeline
Manage all sales activity and forecasting of revenue in Salesforce


Join us if you:

Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator with excellent written and verbal skills in English. Additional language capability would be viewed favourably
Have at least 5 years of progressive B2B SaaS sales experience
Have masterfully led SaaS sales cycles from end-to-end
Have demonstrable experience meeting and exceeding sales quotas up to $1M
Are skillful in penetrating accounts, developing relationships, and selling to executive-level decision-makers
Are able to identify existing and emerging client needs, and to articulate the corresponding benefits of Assent’s offerings
Are a tenacious, highly motivated, and persistent sales hunter
Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator and presenter
Have excellent questioning techniques, active listening skills, and analytical capabilities
Are highly capable and self-sufficient in the development and delivery of all sales cycle artifacts including presentations, proposals
Are energized by working in a start-up-like sales environment
Have experience working with CRM tools
Have a combination of education and experience that demonstrates the above


What’s in it for you?

At Assent, your contributions will be valued and have a bigger purpose - you will help make a real difference to our clients. Our team challenges each other to be better every day and we dig deep to build a culture of innovation and high-performance.
In addition to a competitive salary, you can expect to:

Love what you do as part of a fantastic culture and supportive team that really wants you to succeed
Accelerate greatness in a challenging position with high learning and development potential
Choose how you work best with a flexible work arrangement
Spend your days making a difference, not just working for a living. We help our customers all over the world by providing a real understanding of their supply chain data so they can protect their brands, remove market access barriers, and reduce operational and financial risk


All applicants will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check.
Reasonable Accommodations Statement: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the aforementioned duties and responsibilities satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.

eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.
About the business:
Every month Marktplaats handles over 8 million unique visitors and 350.000 new advertisements each day making Marktplaats the largest online trading platform in the Netherlands. Consumer and professional sellers offer a large and varied assortment of used and new products. But we want to go even further - we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. We are a mix of Dutch and Silicon Valley cultures; like both, we are an international team of passionate people who share a common interest in solving problems using software and data. We invite you to join us!
About the team:
From our Amsterdam office we serve not only Marktplaats.nl but also 2dehands.be/2ememain.be our Belgian counterpart.
This is a big responsibility; you will work on high-availability servers, improve customer experience through innovation, impact revenues and advance our team and technologies. In turn, we will work with you to grow your career.
Your growth will involve our highly-performant and high-traffic systems. During peak hours, our site's per-second throughput is OVER 1000 searches (which makes us the second most-used search engine in NL), 25K images and 4GB of data. On an average month, we get 140 million visits, which translates into 2.5 billion page views. But our users demand more, so we are constantly evolving our platform to deliver the experience our customers love.
What to expect from us?
An informal, international and energetic work environment with self-organized, multi-disciplinary agile/lean teams
Managers and teammates who are invested in your growth as a technologist and as a person
Access to tools and resources to do your job (best-in-class laptop, IDEs, Safari Online subscription, conferences and meetups, all the coffee and soda you can drink, and much more)
Work with cool modern technologies such as Java, Scala, Elasticsearch, Apache Kafka, Cassandra, Hashicorp Stack, Node.js, React, Swift and Play
Ability to join and participate in multiple internal interest groups in Marktplaats and across eCG in trending topics like DevOps, BigData, mobile development, and others.
What do we expect from you?
We are looking for a Lead QA Engineer who is passionate about testing and Quality Assurance and loves to work with cross-functional teams. You enjoy enabling your team members to deliver great functionalities with taking risk in mind. You have extensive experience in online or related areas, with at least 6+ years in the technology field. Furthermore, we need someone who lives and breathes Agile development, understands QA Strategy across a department and can focus on driving the QA strategy. The QA Lead wants to participate in continuously improving how we work, and has an interest in how we can do Quality Assurance in a world where we don't have the time to do the testing before a functionality goes live.
Requirements:
The ability to coach, train and guide your QA team in testing great products;
Define a QA Strategy that helps us drive QA excellence in our engineering teams;
You have started leading other QA engineers becoming QA
You have proven experience within the QA/Testing area, especially test prioritization based on risk level, test design and test techniques;
A creative approach;
Self-starting mentality;
Work with our Architects, Tech-Leaders to improve our Lead Time without compromising on quality aspects
Ability of Working in a highly interactive Agile delivery team;
Enthusiastically solving problems, suggesting process automation and improvements;
Advanced level of English (written and spoken);
Can lead without authority!
A huge plus would be:
Understanding the challenges of a high traffic platform;
An object oriented language like Java or functional language like Scala;
Experience with Goal setting frameworks around Quality aspects.
Benefits:
Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs.
We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel Marktplaats is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about our Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/
Covid-19
People are the heart of the eBay Classifieds business, and their health and well-being are our first priority.
We continue to monitor local government guidance and partner closely with medical advisors to determine the safest and best next steps for everyone. As a result, most teams are working remotely, with a few teams able to collaborate in person with enhanced safety procedures. We will discuss the particular case for your region during the interview process. As a general rule, interviews will be completed remotely over video calls.
eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.
For more information see: EEO is the Law Poster and EEO is the Law Poster Supplement

From our Amsterdam office we serve not only Marktplaats.nl but also 2dehands.be/2ememain.be our Belgian counterpart.
This is a big responsibility; you will work on high-availability servers, improve customer experience through innovation, impact revenues and advance our team and technologies. In turn, we will work with you to grow your career.
Your growth will involve our highly-performant and high-traffic systems. During peak hours, our site's per-second throughput is OVER 1000 searches (which makes us the second most-used search engine in NL), 25K images and 4GB of data. On an average month, we get 140 million visits, which translates into 2.5 billion page views. But our users demand more, so we are constantly evolving our platform to deliver the experience our customers love.
What to expect from us?
An informal, international and energetic work environment with self-organized, multi-disciplinary agile/lean teams
Managers and teammates who are invested in your growth as a technologist and as a person
Access to tools and resources to do your job (best-in-class laptop, IDEs, Safari Online subscription, conferences and meetups, all the coffee and soda you can drink, and much more)
Work with cool modern technologies such as Java, Scala, Elasticsearch, Apache Kafka, Cassandra, Hashicorp Stack, Node.js, React, Swift and Play
Ability to join and participate in multiple internal interest groups in Marktplaats and across eCG in trending topics like DevOps, BigData, mobile development, and others.
What do we expect from you?
We are looking for a Lead QA Engineer who is passionate about testing and Quality Assurance and loves to work with cross-functional teams. You enjoy enabling your team members to deliver great functionalities with taking risk in mind. You have extensive experience in online or related areas, with at least 6+ years in the technology field. Furthermore, we need someone who lives and breathes Agile development, understands QA Strategy across a department and can focus on driving the QA strategy. The QA Lead wants to participate in continuously improving how we work, and has an interest in how we can do Quality Assurance in a world where we don't have the time to do the testing before a functionality goes live.
Requirements:
The ability to coach, train and guide your QA team in testing great products;
Define a QA Strategy that helps us drive QA excellence in our engineering teams;
You have started leading other QA engineers becoming QA
You have proven experience within the QA/Testing area, especially test prioritization based on risk level, test design and test techniques;
A creative approach;
Self-starting mentality;
Work with our Architects, Tech-Leaders to improve our Lead Time without compromising on quality aspects
Ability of Working in a highly interactive Agile delivery team;
Enthusiastically solving problems, suggesting process automation and improvements;
Advanced level of English (written and spoken);
Can lead without authority!
A huge plus would be:
Understanding the challenges of a high traffic platform;
An object oriented language like Java or functional language like Scala;
Experience with Goal setting frameworks around Quality aspects.
Benefits:
