Responsibilities

Be the driving force that collaborates with business and technical teams across Booking to make sure your teams deliver world class solutions that are highly scalable, secure, and flexible - all the while maintaining a strong customer focus.
Interact with project sponsors, project stakeholders and multiple business and technical teams to define and deliver complex features
Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints
Plan and manage multiple parallel projects
The ability to slice through ambiguity and drive clarity where confusion exists; leveraging technical expertise with strong business acumen
Maximize resources for the greater good of the organization, identify inefficient processes or waste and redirect resources as necessary
Identify, assess, track and mitigate issues and risks at multiple levels
Create, maintain and disseminate project information to stakeholders
Communicate project issues and status in a concise, accurate, and professional manner
Insatiable curiosity and ability to understand architectural and technical aspects of projects
Apply best practices to the software development lifecycle (SDLC) for projects based on experiences with a number of agile and blended approaches, as well effectively coordinating the implementations across teams using very different approaches
Build and maintain integrated project schedules that account for internal/external dependencies, differing SDLC approaches, numerous constraints, and adequately factors in some contingency for some unplanned delays while still being aggressive

Qualifications

Computer Science / Engineering Bachelor’s degree or related technical field
10+ years relevant work experience, including technical program management experience in Financial Technology firms or Payments technology divisions
3+ years of experience as a People Manager
Experience managing an organization of program managers, including building and growing the team
Experience moving technical or engineering programs or products from inception to delivery, and experience articulating the impact using metrics, growth examples, return, etc
Experience structuring an organization that optimizes for execution, including attracting talent and building out gaps in the existing team

About PVH Corp.
PVH is one of the most admired fashion and lifestyle companies in the world. We power brands that drive fashion forward – for good. Our brand portfolio includes the iconic CALVIN KLEIN, TOMMY HILFIGER, Van Heusen, IZOD, ARROW, Warner’s, Olga and Geoffrey Beene brands, as well as the digital-centric True&Co. intimates brand. We market a variety of goods under these and other nationally and internationally known owned and licensed brands. PVH has over 40,000 associates operating in over 40 countries and $9.9 billion in annual revenues. That's the Power of Us. That’s the Power of PVH.
The Team – STITCH
STITCH (stitch3d.com) is a Software as a Service (SaaS) startup on the journey to launching a commercial product. We’re on a mission to provide a 3D workflow that inspires fashion brands to spend more time on product while removing waste. We do this through our HUB digital asset library, STITCH Academy education platform, & Transformation services.
Pushing this vision is a close-knit, multicultural mix of people with experiences ranging from pure fashion business to infrastructure coding. Our product is constantly evolving. Nonetheless, here is a run-down of our latest tech setup:
Backend and asynchronous pipelines: Python and Django with Celery
Frontend: Vue, Konva, Jest
Infrastructure: AWS built with Terraform, deployed in containers on ECS and EC2s, frontends hosted with Cloudfront, all managed with CI/CD pipelines built with CircleCI
Process: Project-based work in a cross-functional team, led by product management
The Role & Key Responsibilities:
Translates the company’s commercial & product ambitions into the technology strategy and roadmap. Keeping a sharp eye on any technical risks that can affect the company’s goals.
Evangelises the possibilities of technology to unlock surprising solutions for our customers’ and users’ needs. Collaborate as one team with the Head of Product.
Challenges our talented engineering team to develop high-performing, reliable, secure and - most importantly - scalable solutions.
Always keeps an eye out for opportunities externally that could help achieve STITCH’s goals. Whether it’s experimenting with new technologies, levering your network in search of potential partnerships or uncovering new technology talent.
Sets the engineering principles; championing engineering best practices and driving the STITCH engineering culture. The aim is to ensure a good balance between code quality, the team’s productivity and long term stability/scalability of the product.
Defines the long-term tech talent strategy for STITCH. Team organization, recruitment and talent management are the important aspects of the role. You will be responsible for evolving the team’s organizational structure, driving high performance, collaboration and stimulating our engineers’ professional growth.
Is a member of the STITCH leadership team and will proactively contribute to the short- and long-term plans & vision for STITCH.
In short; this role sets the overall long-term technology direction while always leaving ample room for the engineers to contribute and grow. What do you think?
The Ideal Candidate:
You are a technologist at heart. You’re passionate about the space and can leverage this passion to motivate your team.
You have experience with both product development as well as system design.
You’re able to balance strategy with a hands-on approach, always willing to step up (hands on keyboard) when times require.
Strategic thinking and strong communication skills are essential for this role. You are able to translate the company strategy into a compelling story for the engineering team to rally them around STITCH’s mission. You’re also able to represent the voice of engineering with internal and external stakeholders.
You have a solid understanding of all disciplines of software development, which you use to constructively challenge the team to get better.
You understand how engineering impacts the bottom line of the company and are able to leverage financial metrics to drive improvement initiatives.
You have at least 2 years experience leading and scaling an engineering team. We are looking for a real team builder, someone who is highly collaborative, who gives constructive feedback and is always looking for ways to help the engineering team grow and learn.
Being a start-up, it’s critical that you are able to think on your feet, think in solutions (current and future) and are pragmatic by nature.
You’re excited by the challenge of taking on a successful product and maturing it into a commercial SAAS solution.
What You Can Expect from Us:
A beautiful state-of-the-art Campus, complete with our very own People's Place Gym and People's Place Cafés
A company culture that fosters development, offering training and learning opportunities through our very own PVH University
An international environment which respects diversity, equality, and individuality
A smart work program that empowers our associates to work at their preferred location within a flexible schedule
A chance to unwind with weekly social activities
PVH Europe and our brands, TOMMY HILFIGER and CALVIN KLEIN, are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. We believe we are bettered by all forms of diversity, and take pride in working with top talent from every walk of life and corner of the world. In the spirit of inclusivity, qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation.

Do you have consulting and/or industry experience in the Utilities industry and are you looking for a next step in your career? Do you have strong analytical skills and are you interested in helping our client’s transition to the new energy landscape? In that case the position of Consultant/Manager will be the challenge you are looking for!

Your job
At Accenture Strategy & Consulting you find solutions on the intersection of business and technology. You offer insights and advice to the customer and support them creating and executing the business strategy. Also, you think about their most important questions and initiatives, such as digital disruption, industry convergence, growth and innovation, operating models, sustainable cost management, business transformations and more. You will be orchestrating expertise from across Accenture — strategy, consulting, interactive, technology and operations, and have the ambition to continuously develop your market relevant knowledge, your advisory and commercial skills, and are expected and challenged to do so.

With our Utilities practice we provide functional and industry consulting services to Utilities companies. We are industry experts with the insights and capabilities to transform leading Utilities organizations and help them navigate ever-changing landscape they operate in.

As Consultant/Manager you will be part of the Utilities Industry Practice. With this practice we help large clients in Generation, Transmission & Distribution, Energy Retail, E-mobility infrastructure and Water & Waste. You help our clients with a broad range of services such as (digital) strategies, process-led transformations and post-merger integrations. You will act as project manager and/or workstream lead and serve as a linking pin to the project responsible at the client side. You will lead with insight: use of advanced analytics and human-centric design to co-create and implement technology-enabled, disruptive strategies and solutions that win competitive advantage, unlock value and drive growth for clients. You have the ambition to continuously develop your market relevant knowledge, your advisory and commercial skills, and are expected and challenged to do so.

Your team
The everchanging pace of market developments will only continue to accelerate in the future – and many organizations struggle to challenge new innovative competition within the market. How do different innovations influence the market, what are the results and how can companies adapt themselves to remain agile in the future?

Accenture Strategy & Consulting is the driving force in helping companies answer such questions. You will advise C-level management in their strategic blueprints – based on data analysis, experience, expertise and an innovative approach. Together with a diverse team of experts, you will challenge current industry obstacles and find the key solution for clients in their current markets: Surpassing the disruption through our end-to-end services, consolidating future success for organizations.

Your background
Completed Master's degree program in a technical, business or economic direction;
3-7 years of consulting experience and/or relevant industry experience in Energy or Utilities Industry;
Experience and interest in the energy transition
Affinity with technology and digitalization
Excellent communication skills in Dutch and English;
You have excellent quantitative and analytical skills;
You are a hard worker and able to work independently;
You are a team player with a “can-do” mentality who can think outside the box

For manager level, the following additional qualifications are preferred:
Experience in sales and proposal development;
Experience in leading small teams.

Our offer
Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re really proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we take an agile approach, provide end-to-end services and maintain a realistic mindset. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So, you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.
Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:
A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card)
An expense allowance
Discount on Accenture shares
The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week

Interested?
Are you ready to join Accenture for a career where you can be yourself and do what you love? Apply now and change the world around you.
Questions? Connect with Inge Neuteboom through inge.neuteboom@accenture.com.

People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.

Classifieds is shaping the future of local commerce by bringing people together through an enriched online experience that allows them to reach out to the community around them. Technical skills:Proficiency in at least one data querying language, preferably SQL, Hive or Hadoop.Efficient when working with a multitude of disparate data sources and tools; working out of a data warehouse or from smaller imperfect datasets.Familiar with Tableau, sophisticated spreadsheet and presentation software skills.Experience building intuitive and impactful dashboards and data visualizations.Experience with analytics/data science tool is a plus (for example R or Python).

- Stakeholder management skills - ability to build consensus by clearly communicating and presenting information.People oriented! Eager to build positive and productive relationships with international partners and draw upon their skills when needed.

The Senior Manager People Systems is End-to-End accountable for all the People Systems both at global as well as regional and local level. In this role you will ensure strategic alignment with our stakeholders within the People department and elsewhere within the organisation leveraging principles around Product Management, User Centricity and Design thinking to optimise an integrated E2E user journey around the total Employee life cycle.
The Senior Manager People Systems is responsible for an integrated, standardised and simple people systems landscape where we adopt as much as possible ‘out of the box’ technology solutions from our preferred vendors (first and foremost Workday). Leveraging practices around Operational Excellence and Offshoring, he/she ensures a maximum return on investments at best costs. The Senior Manager People Systems works closely with peers within the People department as well as with partners from other functional teams (IT Services, Procurement, Finance) to ensure our technology landscape, plans and practices are fully aligned and integrated with the overall Booking.com practices and standards.

Responsibilities

Strategy

Drives the overall strategy for all People related systems and ensures this is aligned and is supporting the overall People department strategy and plans. Ensure technology is leveraged to support the most effective People Service delivery model combining self services with state of the art technologies around digital assistants, knowledge base and case management tools.
Ensures that specific local and regional technology requirements are identified, prioritised, planned and executed as per agreed plans.
Ensures People systems strategy is aligned with other, non People related plans and priorities e.g. IT Services, Finance, Procurement, R&C.
Ensures End-to-End execution of agreed strategy and plans within budget.

Stakeholder Management

Is a partner to the business and works closely with senior managers and their teams within the People department (COE’s, Operations, HRA). As such, acts as a bridge between the Business/functional and the technology teams and ensures that understandable language is used to translate business/functional requirements into technology plans
Works closely with peers within the overall systems/technology environment to ensure the People systems plans are aligned and embedded into the overall technology plans and that IT (Security) standards are met and adhered to.
Ensures clear governance around communication applying the Single Point of Contact (SPOC) principle in order for the stakeholders we work with, clear communication and escalation channels.
Putting the End user at the centre of the People systems and technology design, ensures finding the right balance between the needs of the various stakeholders

Program and Project Management

Ensures that key technology and system investments are properly managed in line with Booking.com project management practices and standards.
Builds capabilities within the team on project and program management to ensure flawless execution of agreed programs and projects.

Operational Excellence

Ensures that the People systems team adopts the highest standards of Operational Excellence and has skills and capabilities to identify issues, address root causes, eliminates waste and drives continuous improvement
Is accountable for the overall RUN/Sustain strategy for the People Systems team to ensure potential issues are addressed within time in line with the agreed SLA’s. Ensures where appropriate that this is aligned with the overall IT Services support model.
Leverages offshore model where possible to minimise non value added work and associated costs.

Budget management

Is accountable for the total budget for People Systems and as such works closely with the Finance team to ensure budget/financial best practices and standards are met.
Ensures that all significant People systems projects and related investments are supported by solid business cases as per agreed standards, templates and timelines

Risk & Control

Ensures the Booking.com Risk and Control standards and practices are adhered to and that the people systems are meeting all related standards (Soxx, SOD)
Works closely with the legal team to ensure that we are compliant against Data privacy legislation (GDPR) and that the data of our candidates and employees is safe with us.

Vendor Management

Is overall accountable for the People Systems landscape and as such also accountable for managing the partnerships with our main technology vendors (Workday).
Works closely with the Procurement team to ensure the People systems team operates in line with agreed Procurement practices and thus ensuring maximum return of investment.
Through networking with other customers, ensures that technology roadmaps of our vendors are influenced to meet our long term technology and systems needs.

People Management

Is responsible for the various teams within the People Systems team: Architecture & integration, Application Management and Technology solutions.
Ensures regional People systems experts presence in APAC (Singapore) and the Americas (Grand rapids)
Provides direction and guidance on key practices around ways of working: E2E thinking, Product Management, Design Thinking, Offshore management, Project Management, SPOC concept
Ensures the right mix of people leveraging our locations, managing our costs and maximizing our partnerships with our technology vendors and our managed services partners.

Requirements

Very strategic: think 3-5 years ahead, understands dependencies
Strong stakeholder management skills operating at ELT level across multiple functions
Strong budget management skills and capabilities to ensure right level of investments and ensure agreed investments are managed properly
Strong People management skills leading a (growing) big team across 4 continents with potentially also a big offshore team.
Strong innovator. Curious in what technology can do to drive a more effective and costs efficient HR function

Are you looking for a sales management position within a high potential, start-up environment? Then you should check out this opportunity!

The opportunity
The new economy and changing consumer behaviour is changing the way retailers and brands are managing their products and inventory. Lots of profit is being burned because of inefficiencies in the supply chain, inventories and (online) stores.

This startup is solving these problems by providing a innovative, data-driven platform and is actually contributing to a world with less waste of consumer goods!
With a team of only 10 FTE, they have already been able to close Enterprises such as Levi's and Under Armour. They have a great reputation in Europe and demand for their state-of-the-art solution is growing rapidly.
Therefor, the phase of founder led sales is coming to an end, and it is time for a great Head of Sales to step in and lead this promising company through the next growth phase.

Your profile
At least 5-10 years of sales experience (SaaS)Hands-on mentality (deal closing) and strategic/tactical skillsBachelor and/or Master degree

The offer
Salary up/to €90k base + secondary benefitsMaking a serious impact on this company's growth trajectoryReporting directly into CEO

Next steps
Are you excited to learn more, or would you like to apply straight away? Then I encourage you to either email/call me or hit "apply now"!

The opportunity where you will make an impact:

As our Software QA Manager, you will be accountable to develop and execute exploratory tests and as such validate user stories to ensure product quality of the core e-commerce platform “Hybris” to support the development of Body&Fit propositions. The aim of the QA manager should be to deliver new functionality to the business without any issues that impact the business as a result. You will work closely with stakeholders in the technology team, business teams and development partners to deliver the new functionality to the business.

Full-time · Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Plan and prioritise QA work for deployments of the Hybris e-commerce platform
Review, propose and implement testing strategy including tools, reporting and process
Define and execute (exploratory) test scripts for user stories to be delivered in a release
Define and execute regression packs to ensure product quality
Report on testing progress
Develop and grow the Body&Fit QA team
Knowledge transfer to the internal teams

What you will bring to Body & Fit:

A track record in software quality assurance in a fast-paced organisation

Experience as QA/Test Manager in e-commerce or related field
Understanding of automated test tools and process to deliver continuous improvements
Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes
A track record of managing stakeholders and strong examples of clear and concise communication
A good understanding of e-commerce platform ecosystems and technical development in complex IT projects
Good communication skills with stakeholders at all levels
A commitment to delivering releases with outstanding quality
Exceptional attention to detail
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
A passion for customers, retail, digital products & technology

What we would like to offer you:

The opportunity to shape your career in our global organisation that is championing the healthy lifestyle movement!

Create your own nutrition formula with a discount on our products!
Are we the right fit for you?

Life is way too short to waste anyone’s time so there are a few things that we would like to be upfront about:

Politics, intrigue, gossip. We’re just way too busy for all that stuff!
Slow moving, corporate environment. We move pretty quickly here so we don’t have room for passengers.
Hiding in the background. If we’re to grow together we want you to step up and tell us how to do it. We need your voice!


Please note: To be eligible for this position you need to have a valid working visa / permit to work in the Netherlands.

Job Title: Senior Technical Program Manager - Order Platform
Job Description:
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.

In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.

Senior Technical Program Manager - Order Platform

Booking’s Horizontal Business Services department is seeking a smart, talented and energetic Senior Technical Program Manager to manage execution and delivery of the Order Platform roadmap that delivers against ambitious business objectives.

Our order platform is designed to be the authoritative data source of all reservation data which is then funnelled to relevant systems including finance, billing analytics etc. This role will need someone with a strong TPM background, with demonstrated experience leading large cross-organizational software development projects, with a deep technical background in data modelling. You will have experience with MySQL, Hadoop, Cassandra and Big Data platforms. You must be able to thrive and succeed in an entrepreneurial environment, and not be hindered by ambiguity or competing priorities. This means you are not only able to develop and drive high-level strategic initiatives, but can also roll up your sleeves, dig in and help drive change.

As a Senior TPM, you will anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance customer and business needs versus technical constraints. An ability to take large, complex projects and break them down into manageable pieces, develop functional specifications, then deliver them in a successful and timely manner is expected. We are looking for proactive, innovative individuals who thrive on solving tough problems. Well developed decision making and judgment, negotiation skills, the ability to influence, analytical ability and leadership are essential to success.

B.Responsible

Be the driving force that collaborates with business and technical teams across Booking to make sure your teams deliver world class solutions that are highly scalable, secure, and flexible - all the while maintaining a strong customer focus.
Interact with project sponsors, project stakeholders and multiple business and technical teams to define and deliver complex features
Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints
Plan and manage multiple parallel projects
The ability to slice through ambiguity and drive clarity where confusion exists; leveraging technical expertise with strong business acumen
Maximize resources for the greater good of the organization, identify inefficient processes or waste and redirect resources as necessary
Identify, assess, track and mitigate issues and risks at multiple levels
Create, maintain and disseminate project information to stakeholders
Communicate project issues and status in a concise, accurate, and professional manner
Insatiable curiosity and ability to understand architectural and technical aspects of projects
Apply best practices to the software development lifecycle (SDLC) for projects based on experiences with a number of agile and blended approaches, as well effectively coordinating the implementations across teams using very different approaches
Build and maintain integrated project schedules that account for internal/external dependencies, differing SDLC approaches, numerous constraints, and adequately factors in some contingency for some unplanned delays while still being aggressive

B.Skilled

7+ years relevant work experience, including technical program management experience
3 years+ engineering experience with relevant tech stack
Strong analytical and quantitative skills; Datadriven andresults-oriented
A proven track record of leading a visionary strategy to deliver global, company-wide platform services at enterprise large scales
Commercial understanding of scrum methodologies, agile project management and release (program increment) scheduling

B.offered

This position is open to candidates worldwide, we provide visa and relocation assistance.

Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world-renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work
Working in a fast-paced and performance-driven culture
Career advancement via online and on-the-job training, Hackathons, conferences and active community participation
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com

We value Diversity of all types and in an open, dynamic workplace. This has been a pillar at Booking.com since day one, and something we continue to strongly believe in and build today.

Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

ABOUT US
Proudfoot is the preeminent global operational consultancy. Our core philosophy is “transformation through people” – creating alignment, changing behavior, and transforming companies with people-first solutions to their operational challenges. Our unique approach links hard analysis with one-on-one coaching and boots-on-ground support to achieve dramatic business improvements, helping leaders tap into the energy and ideas of the people across their organization. With 70+ years of experience, we know that employees will engage and contribute when given information, tools, authority, and respect — and we know our clients achieve their highest aspirations through the commitment and hard work of their people.
More info here: https://www.proudfoot.com/
OPPORTUNITY
We are currently seeking Subject Matter Experts with Management Consulting experience to help our client to achieve levels of performance delivering results on a scale and at speed. We are looking for candidates with strong Procurement experience.
Our SME's assist with the thorough review and re-design of existing business practices and processes for all facets of a client’s business. We are delivering accelerated operational ramp-ups to ensure on time, on cost project completion and time-to-production; We reduce operational conflicts across the silos to ensure “best for project” decisions are implemented, while moving the complexity out of your daily operations. You work with people at all levels within an organization to gain valuable business experience
Our solutions are customized to our client workplace, designed specifically for the client need at hand, ultimately engaging the hearts and minds of people to establish buy-in and maintain their involvement throughout the Proudfoot experience and beyond, empathy and emotional intelligence ate important success factors.

In this role you will be responsible for testing (and advice in the design/development of) and subsequent monitoring of the financial output of new and changed business (processes) that we implement at Hunkemöller. Furthermore, your input is required in optimizing existing processes to support our growth.
Formally you report to the Manager Financial Administrator but you will also have regular informal contact with other colleagues from the Finance Department, especially the Project Manager and other Hunkemöller Departments, in particular the E-Commerce (Omni-Channel), IT and other business Departments.
With the growth of our Omni-Channel and especially the related wholesale and concessions part, we like to professionalize and speed up the implementation of new businesses.
Your main responsibilities concern the following areas:
Translating business requirements (new contracts) into financial consequences and thus journal entries which amongst others, drive the development/set-up of new business in our commercial IT systems and consequently also in our accounting system
Monitoring that the financial input given is taking into account in the technical and functional set-up in the development phase. Ensuring issues are already tackled as soon as possible in the front-end development of the implementation process
Performing functional with main focus on the financial output testing in SAP
Coordinating/communicating with the several business departments in the design/development, testing and production phases
Monitoringg) the behavior of the implemented in production and come up with corrective actions/suggestions if needed
Participating in the functional testing of small ad-hoc projects
In order to be able to perform the role properly, we ask for the following:
Knowledge of SAP is a must
Knowledge of the English and Dutch language is a must
Can ‘talk' IT and Finance language and has strong affinity with IT related processes
At least 4 years of work experience in this field of expertise
Excellent Excel skills and knowledge of Microsoft Word
Is a good communicator as it also needs strong communication with E-commerce/rest of the business
Stable personality
Hands-on person with a ‘can do' mentality
At least higher education (equivalent HEAO, although on the job experience is just as important)
Hunkemöller strives to be a much loved, social & inclusive brand. A place where people love to work, are proud of the brand, and where we create true brand ambassadors. Working in a passionate, energetic, design-led and performance-driven environment where our key customer persona 'Shero' sits at the heart of everything we do. Hunkemöller is certified TOP EMPLOYER of the Netherlands 2020, which underlines our people initiatives and achievements.
Together Tomorrow – Join a Retailer that's on the move to be better for our planet, better for people, better together! From diversity & inclusion, reducing waste, to product care and how we work with our suppliers, our Together Tomorrow initiative reflects what we do and helps drive change across our business. Ready to help us achieving our ambitious goals? Where ever you'll start working with us, if in Stores or our HQs, you can contribute!
Apply now with your CV or LinkedIn profile only. For this role, we're not looking to work with external agencies.

Delta Group is the world's largest provider of switching power supplies and a major source for power management solutions, components, visual displays, industrial automation, networking products, and renewable energy solutions. As a global leader in power electronics, Delta is committed to environment protection and has implemented green, lead-free production and recycling and waste management programs for many years. Job Title: Sr. Manager, Facilities (Dutch & English Fluency Required)
Job Description:
Company Description
Our Mission
At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

Job Description
Your Career
We are seeking a colleague who is shaping with us the future of our workplace! Think beyond the office. Redevelop how we make sure to support our colleagues to the best and create a great experience. If you enjoy working independently but collaboratively in a collegial team environment within a fast-paced and dynamic company, this is the right place for you.
Your role is to lead and drive the facilities operations programs and processes; maintaining our lab infrastructure and the office build-outs at our Amsterdam office also leading and driving other Places related projects. All ensuring timely delivery of clearly defined scope within budget. This with the goal to support the business to the best
Your Impact
Innovating and improving processes and scopes. Driving efficiencies and effectiveness
Coaching and development of the Facilities team in AMS
Working with ultimately every employee and translating company culture, values, and strategies into practical application for the workplace
Building year plans and objectives that support our company strategy and business needs
Driving the change in our AMS office towards FLEXWORK. Experience in implementing new office concepts
Partner effectively with key groups such as IT, SAS, Procurement, Finance, and the People team. Maintain regular communications with a variety of stakeholders to ensure that all concerned parties are well informed on relevant topics.
Sourcing local services and goods needed to perform day to day operations through 3rd party suppliers. This in strong cooperation with our US based procurement team
Executing professional supplier management
Responding appropriately to emergencies or urgent issues as they arise and dealing with the consequences. This job requires you to be reachable outside working hours for emergencies
Using performance management techniques to monitor and demonstrate achievement of agreed service levels and to lead on improvement
Planning best allocation and utilisation of space and resources. Short and mid term.
Implementing existing or new (global) processes/policies/procedures
Executing tenders. From preparing tender documents to signing off contracts in line with company policies and with involvement of right stakeholders and onboarding vendors
Having good knowledge of relevant Workplace Law and regulations
Developing and implementing sustainable ideas and solutions
Participating in or leading global project groups within the Places department
Understanding the impact you have on our carbon footprint and waste contribution, and knowing how to minimize this

Qualifications
Your Experience
Minimum of 10 years experience ensuring continuity of operations and maintenance /repairs in offices and lab spaces
Developing, directing, coordinating and planning essential central services such as maintenance/repairs, mail, shipping/receiving archiving, cleaning, food, waste disposal and recycling
Professional supplier management in a corporate/commercial environment
Responding appropriately to emergencies or urgent issues as they arise and dealing with the consequences. This job requires you to be reachable outside working hours for emergencies
Planning best allocation and utilisation of space, resources and office concepts. Short and mid term
Executing tenders. From preparing tender documents to signing off contracts in line with company policies and with involvement of right stakeholders and onboarding vendors
Project management (hard-, soft services and construction projects) and supervising and coordinating the work of contractors, ensure minimum disruption to core activities
Fluency in Dutch and English
Bachelor's Degree
Additional Information
The Team
The Places team constantly strives to make our work environment comfortable, effective, productive and appealing. The workplace has a direct impact on your happiness, productivity, and how we can accomplish our mission. As a team, we take care of the day to day facilities services throughout our organization. We own the build-out projects while maintaining a productive, innovative environment for the business to work in.
Our Commitment

We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.

De rol
Beschik jij over de combinatie van procesmatig werken en verbinding maken met mensen? Heb je wat met duurzaamheid? En ben je wel in voor een uitdaging waarbij je jouw talenten, kennis en ervaring in kunt zetten en een flinke verbeterslag kunt maken binnen een toekomstgericht bedrijf? Lees snel verder!

Jouw rol
Je vervult een voor Blue Phoenix nieuwe rol waarin je verantwoordelijk bent voor het onderhoud voor de vestiging in Assendelft. In Assendelft staat de grootste bodemas wasinstallatie ter wereld waarbij 600.000 ton per jaar wordt verwerkt. De installatie is in 2019 gebouwd en sinds een klein jaar operationeel. Je krijgt uitgebreid de ruimte om je de specialistische processen eigen te maken en er zijn collega’s met veel kennis op wie je terug kunt vallen met vragen.
Jouw rol is in de volgende hoofdtaken te verdelen;
de dagelijkse aansturing van het onderhoudsteam,verantwoordelijk voor de onderhoudsplanning, inclusief aanschaf en beheer van onderdelen,het begeleiden van verbeterprojecten,het vastleggen en structureren van onderhoudsprocessen.
Je werkt nauw samen met de manager productie en de operators om processen optimaal op elkaar te laten aansluiten. Op de plant leg je verantwoording af aan de plantmanager.

Dagelijkse aansturing
Je geeft leiding en/of sturing aan twee vaste medewerkers en een ruime schil aan ingehuurde gespecialiseerde onderaannemers. Met veel van hen is een relatie opgebouwd die je warm krijgt overgedragen. Elke twee weken is er een onderhoudsdag, die jij coördineert en plant. Je zorgt dat de juiste onderaannemers aanwezig zijn, instrueert en begeleidt hen en zorgt dat ze de juiste werkzaamheden verrichten.

Onderhoudsplanning
Om de jaardoelstellingen te kunnen behalen dienen de installaties in een goede staat van onderhoud te verkeren en te blijven. Het planmatig organiseren en bewaken van het 1e en 2e lijns onderhoud is één van jouw hoofdtaken. Het systematisch beheren van de kritische spareparts en slijtdelen is hiervoor noodzakelijk.

Verbeterprojecten
Natuurlijk kan er nog van alles verbeterd worden aan deze vrij jonge installatie en hier ligt dan ook een grote uitdaging. Aan jou de taak om met voorstellen te komen hoe het proces stabieler (met minder storingen/downtime) kan operereren. Deze voorstellen kunnen leiden tot ombouwprojecten en mogelijk grote investeringen waarvan jij de trekker zal zijn. Zoals altijd moet er een goede balans zijn tussen de productie en het onderhoud. Aan jou de uitdaging om, op een plezierige doch strak georganiseerde wijze, de samenwerking met de productieafdeling op te zetten en in te vullen.

Vastleggen en structureren
Jij gaat aan de slag met het creëren van overzicht en duidelijkheid door structuren, processen en werkwijzen in kaart te brengen, te optimaliseren en vast te leggen. Onderhoudsprocessen maak je visueel, de administratieve handelingen meer gestructureerd en overzichtelijker en planningen worden geoptimaliseerd. Je zorgt dat je verbinding maakt met de medewerkers, hen betrekt bij de verbeterplannen en draagvlak creëert waarbij heldere communicatie voorop staat. Ook leg je scheidingen van taken en verantwoordelijkheden vast en begeleidt en coach je medewerkers bij hun werk.

Kortom: door jouw proactieve en gestructureerde manier van werken, ontstaat een goed georganiseerde onderhoudsorganisatie met overzicht en rust met als gevolg daarvan meer efficiëntie en werkplezier!

Standplaats: Assendelft
Wat ga je doen?
Vacature
Wat is vereist?
Afgeronde MTS / HTS-opleiding;
Ervaring met de toegepaste technieken zoals pompen, hydrocyclonage, natte zeeftechnieken, transportbanden, feeders, metaalterugwinning, indikkers, ontwateringstechnologie en fysisch/chemische waterzuivering;
Ervaring met het aansturen van een technische dienst;
Woonachtig in Noord Holland;

Persoonskenmerken
Je bent een people manager die met energie en enthousiasme anderen motiveert en tegelijkertijd structuur weet aan te brengen en helder communiceert. Je houdt van de combinatie van theorie en praktijk en staat zelf ook graag “met je voeten in de klei”.

Door je brede technische kennis ben je in staat de complexe processen binnen de installaties te doorgronden en eigen te maken. Na de uitgebreide inwerkperiode heb je de potentie en interesse uit te groeien tot de technisch expert van de installatie.

Over alle details, informatiestromen, betrokken partijen en belangen weet jij het overzicht te houden en kom je tot realistische planningen. Je bent in staat processen in te richten en te bewaken. Hierbij ben je proactief en zorg je dat zaken soepel verlopen waarbij ruimte is te anticiperen op onverwachte situaties.

Je maakt graag verbinding met mensen, weet het beste in anderen naar boven te halen, bent toegankelijk, betrouwbaar en voorspelbaar ‘omdat je zegt wat je doet en doet wat je zegt’. Je werkt graag samen met anderen en bent je ervan bewust dat je andere nodig hebt om ‘de klus te klaren’. Toch ben jij ook degene die de beslissingen neemt, want je weet waar het over gaat en bent in staat de lijnen uit te zetten.

 Standplaats Assendelft

 Technisch Management

Werken bij Blue Phoenix Group
Dit is waar Blue Phoenix Group voor staat:

De as in ons bedrijf komt van energiebedrijven die afval verwerken. Deze zogenaamde waste-to-energy fabrieken doen er alles aan om zoveel mogelijk uit afval te halen. Ondanks dat blijft er uiteindelijk as over als residu. Als dit residu niet wordt gerecycled, wordt het meestal begraven op een stortplaats.

Bij Blue Phoenix Group, zien we stortplaatsen niet als de eindbestemming voor asresidu. Nee, we zien nieuwe kansen. We zien materialen om gebouwen mee te bouwen, snelwegen en bestrating aan te leggen. We zien metalen voor nieuwe auto’s, computers en mobiele telefoons. En we zien een toekomst waarin waste-to-energy volledig circulair is.

Bij Blue Phoenix Group zijn we ervan overtuigd dat er niet zoiets bestaat als afval. Met een gepassioneerd team helpen we wereldwijd waste-to-energy bedrijven om te recyclen wat onmogelijk te recyclen lijkt te zijn. We staan niet alleen in deze missie en bundelen krachten waar we dat kunnen. We werken nauw samen met fabrieken, makers van overheidsbeleid, toezichthouders, engineers en wetenschappers. Samen kunnen we een bijdrage leveren aan een meer duurzame wereld.

“We zijn Blue Phoenix werkend aan een duurzame toekomst.”
Pernis
 Gepassioneerd team

eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.
About the business:
Every month Marktplaats handles over 8 million unique visitors and 350.000 new advertisements each day making Marktplaats the largest online trading platform in the Netherlands. Consumer and professional sellers offer a large and varied assortment of used and new products. But we want to go even further - we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. We are a mix of Dutch and Silicon Valley cultures; like both, we are an international team of passionate people who share a common interest in solving problems using software and data. We invite you to join us!
About the team:
From our Amsterdam office we serve not only Marktplaats.nl but also 2dehands.be/2ememain.be our Belgian counterpart.
This is a big responsibility; you will work on high-availability servers, improve customer experience through innovation, impact revenues and advance our team and technologies. In turn, we will work with you to grow your career.
Your growth will involve our highly-performant and high-traffic systems. During peak hours, our site's per-second throughput is OVER 1000 searches (which makes us the second most-used search engine in NL), 25K images and 4GB of data. On an average month, we get 140 million visits, which translates into 2.5 billion page views. But our users demand more, so we are constantly evolving our platform to deliver the experience our customers love.
What to expect from us?
An informal, international and energetic work environment with self-organized, multi-disciplinary agile/lean teams
Managers and teammates who are invested in your growth as a technologist and as a person
Access to tools and resources to do your job (best-in-class laptop, IDEs, Safari Online subscription, conferences and meetups, all the coffee and soda you can drink, and much more)
Work with cool modern technologies such as Java, Scala, Elasticsearch, Apache Kafka, Cassandra, Hashicorp Stack, Node.js, React, Swift and Play
Ability to join and participate in multiple internal interest groups in Marktplaats and across eCG in trending topics like DevOps, BigData, mobile development, and others.
What do we expect from you?
We are looking for a Lead QA Engineer who is passionate about testing and Quality Assurance and loves to work with cross-functional teams. You enjoy enabling your team members to deliver great functionalities with taking risk in mind. You have extensive experience in online or related areas, with at least 6+ years in the technology field. Furthermore, we need someone who lives and breathes Agile development, understands QA Strategy across a department and can focus on driving the QA strategy. The QA Lead wants to participate in continuously improving how we work, and has an interest in how we can do Quality Assurance in a world where we don't have the time to do the testing before a functionality goes live.
Requirements:
The ability to coach, train and guide your QA team in testing great products;
Define a QA Strategy that helps us drive QA excellence in our engineering teams;
You have started leading other QA engineers becoming QA
You have proven experience within the QA/Testing area, especially test prioritization based on risk level, test design and test techniques;
A creative approach;
Self-starting mentality;
Work with our Architects, Tech-Leaders to improve our Lead Time without compromising on quality aspects
Ability of Working in a highly interactive Agile delivery team;
Enthusiastically solving problems, suggesting process automation and improvements;
Advanced level of English (written and spoken);
Can lead without authority!
A huge plus would be:
Understanding the challenges of a high traffic platform;
An object oriented language like Java or functional language like Scala;
Experience with Goal setting frameworks around Quality aspects.

Alkmaar Fulltime
Who is PALLAS?
PALLAS’s mission is to provide unique solutions for nuclear medicine and research.

Our vision is to build a safe, state-of-the-art facility to become the world’s leading producer of radioisotopes for nuclear medicines and to enable nuclear technology research. The PALLAS-reactor will be the first in the industry to be privately financed, owned and operated, and it will be built in Petten, Noord-Holland, on the site of the existing High Flux Reactor.

PALLAS aspires to become a high-reliability organisation with the skills and capability to deliver its mission and vision through its core values, whilst ensuring that its safety, security and quality objectives are always achieved. We apply our unique knowledge and experience to benefit society by taking interest in our stakeholders.

PALLAS is composed of colleagues coming from all over the world, bringing together a unique set of knowledge and experience. Everyone in PALLAS is required to take personal responsibility for the safety of themselves and of anyone who is directly or indirectly affected by their actions. A high safety culture is continuously built by the organisation.
Function
The main role of PALLAS is being the Intelligent Customer and this entails overseeing the use of specialised contractors and subcontractors responsible for the design, construction and operation of the PALLAS-reactor.

The PALLAS Reactor Process & Plant Systems Engineer, supports the PALLAS lead Reactor Process & Plant Systems Engineer to maintain oversight of the design. This means support in monitoring of the delegated Design Authority and support in ensuring the right design delivered by the contactors enabling the PALLAS-reactor’s mission. The right design includes a design that is constructible, commissionable, operable, maintainable and decommission-able as per the PALLAS drivers.

Oversight includes providing inputs to the design, assessing the design against the PALLAS technical requirements and inputs, guiding the designer to implement requirements in an integrated balanced way, coordinating external interfaces, interfacing with licensing on conventional permits as well as supporting Safety Demonstration, Licensing, Project Management Office, Quality, Procurement, and Licensing under the supervision of the lead reactor systems engineer.
Activities
As a Reactor Process & Plant Systems Engineer, your tasks will include:

Support Owner of requirements (Reactor Process and Plant Systems) by defining and/or understanding the systems requirements.
Support Owner of design (Reactor Process and Plant Systems) providing design inputs to the contractor, ensuring the contractor uses the correct inputs, and ensuring the design complies to the requirements, using engineering judgement to assess the methodology/design criteria/design approach, ensuring the preliminary safety analysis report (PSAR) is aligned with the design, overseeing external interfaces, ensuring the design is construct-able, commissionable, operable, maintainable and decommission-able.
Support Owner of Design Baseline (Reactor Process and Plant Systems) by reviewing and accepting the design baseline for Reactor Process and Plant systems.
Intelligent Customer Service (Reactor Process and Plant Systems) by reviewing and accepting the design baseline for reactor systems.
Support Owner External interface (casks for wet loading, secondary cooling) by understanding why the reactor is what it is, supporting in presenting the design to the Authority for Nuclear Safety & Radiation Protection (ANVS) and other authorities and act as Work Package Owner for Contractor led work packages.
Support Subject Matter Lead (Reactor Process and Plant Systems) by applying expert knowledge in review of the design, application of codes and standards (C&S) and identifying technical risks.

In your role you will have responsibilities in the area described below.

Right Design review: Support Lead in performing right design reviews on detailed design deliverables:
Procurement packages
Manufacturing packages
Construction packages
Test & inspection plans
Manuals
Selected design information
Monitoring performance of delegated design authority: Support Lead in monitoring the performance of the delegated design authority by conducting audits and checks on systems to identify risks associated or corrective actions with the system
Correct Design: Support Lead to use engineering judgement to perform correct designs reviews on a high level considering the following:
Correctness of design input used.
Correctness approach/methodology used.
Correctness of Verification & Validation (V&V) approach and outcome of the V&V process.
Correctness of design output.
Interfacing with PALLAS appointed third party reviewers.
Support work: Support the following streams:
Project Management Office (PMO)
Business Case
Safety Demonstration
Licensing (discussions with the Authority for Nuclear Safety & Radiation Protection -ANVS – and permitting)
Procurement
Commissioning and Operational Readiness
Construction
Quality

Your profile
We are looking for Subject Matter Experts, who is:

Knowledgeable in the requested field taking responsibility of your assigned tasks and systems.
Proactive and solution orientated.
Able to work in a team, work with stakeholders and do efficient reporting to her/his manager.
Worked with contractors before.

You have a degree in Process Engineering and at least 5 years of professional experience, including experience with systems engineering.

You have relevant experience (12 months or more) in one or more of the following projects:

Nuclear Research reactor in Argentina (RA-10), Brazil (RMB), Australia (OPAL), Germany (FRM) or Belgium (BR II).
NPP Reactor (preferably pressurized water reactor – PWR – type): design, manufacturing, construction, commissioning, operations.

Languages: English (spoken and written)

You have previous working experience for an “Intelligent customer” and are able to understand the position as an Owner or as a client.

You have also experience in the following technology:

Cooling systems
Purchase specifications for process equipment e.g. pumps, heat exchangers, piping etc.
Handling of radioactive waste
Thermo hydraulics
Interface management
System engineering principles

Desired skills
In your role you will oversee the design of mechanical components. You will not perform the design work but you will need to assess whether the design fulfil requirements.

As a result, a basic knowledge of the following Codes & Standards is preferred:

ASME BPVC Section VIII div. 1
ASME B31.1
ASME B31.3
ASME B73.1
PED

What we offer
PALLAS offers a very competitive salary ranging from € 3.500 – 4.500 gross per month plus holidays allowance (8%), to be discussed depending on your education and experience.

If you are moving from abroad, PALLAS offers a full relocation package.
Additional information
If you have questions about the position, please contact our HR department. You can send an e-mail to Maartje Hageman via hrm@pallasreactor.com or call +31 (0)88 20 24 024.

An AIVD screening (level B) is part of the selection process. More information about the screening can be found on: https://english.aivd.nl/.

Applications
You can apply via Recruitment Organisation Thomas Thor. You can apply directly on their website.

Job Title: Global Digital and Automation Manufacturing Leader
Job Description:
Kraft Heinz, The Company
As one of the world’s largest food and beverage companies, we are proud to spark joy around mealtimes with a global portfolio of more than 200 brands. Some are iconic brands like Philadelphia Cream Cheese, Kraft Peanut Butter, Kraft Dinner and Heinz Ketchup. Others are fast growing new sensations that defy status quo like CRAVE. No matter the brand, we are united under one vision To Be the Best Food Company, Growing a Better World . Bringing this vision to life are our 36,000+ teammates around the world, making food people love.
Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership and commitment with Rise Against Hunger. And we also stand committed to sustainability, and the health of our planet and its people.
Every day, we are transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you’re passionate like us - and ready to create the future, build on a storied legacy, and participate as a conscientious global citizen - there’s one thing to do join us.


Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration


We’re not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. It all comes down to the way we empower our people to own their work. It’s true Our employees are our competitive advantage.
As part of the Kraft Heinz family you’re supported to grow and achieve. You’re recognized and rewarded for outstanding performance at every level. You’re given the opportunity to leave your mark and build legacies. But you won’t do it alone. This is where our values and teamwork thrives and collaborative spirit fuels every day.
Job Description
Global Digital and Automation Manufacturing Leader

About the Position
We have an excellent opportunity available for an experienced Digital and Automation Manufacturing Lead to make a difference at Kraft Heinz. The function lies within Global Manufacturing team in the Global Center of Excellence. You’ll be working in a high performing team, alongside peers always trying to reach the next level. Get ready for a lot of exposure to internal senior stakeholders. You’re constantly looking for improvement activities within Global Operations to help develop, promote and implement different supply chain strategies to achieve effective business processes.
In brief, you will be responsible for:
How to Deploy Manufacturing Process Management for Digital Manufacturing
Transform digital strategies involve adopting Industries 4.0
Optimize and modernize IT practices and portfolios. Use this research to learn the best practices, case studies and roadmaps to leverage and scale the technology portfolio
Organize the Data Lake and provide the capabilities to use the outputs
Approaches to introduce artificial intelligence (AI) to our manufacturing organization with relatable use cases to stimulate thinking of ideas where AI can influence efficiency and reduce waste.
Implement Machine Learnings Tools
Coordinate the Automation Roadmap:
Assess the operational landscape
Identify the right parameters
Evaluate the business process
Recommend level of automation
Land at the winning automation formula
Qualifications

Hard Skills

Please kindly note that you need to have an EU Working Permit (Orientation Year Visa not included) in order to proceed for this position.
Master’s degree in automation engineering mandatory
MBA
Work Experience: Had coordinated a Digital and Automation Road Map
Fluent in English
Advanced level in MS Excel and PowerPoint
Advanced level in PLCs knowledge
Programming skills (JavaScript, Python, Java, C#, PHP)
Coding and Scripting Expertise
Strong knowledge in Tableau or Power BI
Configuration Management (CM) Software Experience.
Experience to support executives in making complex decisions: ability to simplify, prioritize, structure and articulate the many decision criteria to enable the decision for the Company
Strong analytical skills to model manufacturing and logistics networks and operations. Ability to define the most effective way to model, understand which assumptions matter
Project management skills: knowledge and experience with best practices in project management, ability to interact with operations and commercial functions to understand priorities, get assumptions and buy-in
Professional Attributes
Resilience
You’re able to bounce back after a disappointment or set back, big or small. And always continue to move onward & upward.
Ability to Simplify
We like to keep it simple. And to execute fast. Your ability to simplify will be highly appreciated, when you provide simple solutions dealing with complex challenges.
Commercial Sense
You don’t only want to win ; you hate to lose . You’re always seeking for opportunities to expand your business and create more savings, while over delivering your targets.
Result driven
You don’t only focus on your own results, but always do what’s best for the company.
Empathy – listening to the customer
You’re known for your empathy. You listen more and talk less, and therefore truly understand your customer. With that mindset you create commercial chances to optimize the customer experience.
What we offer you
An ambitious employer; we only want to the best for you;
A fast career track like only few other companies can match;
International and multicultural environment;
A competitive salary and excellent bonus structure (above market);
Permanent contract; for we believe in doing big bets on people;
Always room for new ideas; if you have an excellent idea, please let us know and we can set it in action!

Amsterdam

eBay Classifieds Group is an innovative leader in online classifieds with ten brands that span the globe. Elasticsearch knowledge is beneficialFamiliarity with microservice design patterns, continuous integration workflows, and continuous delivery conceptsFamiliarity with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Terraform)Knowledge of web services ecosystem including: REST, JSON, and HTTP(S)Comfortable providing and receiving constructive feedback, particularly while participating in code reviewsFamiliar working in Agile teams and crafting software using Agile methodologies.Be a technical sparring partner for the organisation to help the business build efficient and effective requirementsBenefits:Flexible working patterns and occasional work-from-home supportedPension schemeLife and disability insurance.Excellent parental leave policy available!Covid-19People are the heart of the eBay Classifieds business, and their health and well-being are our first priority.
