You will therefore need to have both the judgement to decide on priorities and the dynamic hunger to deliver against them.

You would report to Deliveroo's global policy and communications team in London. You would also work closely with Deliveroo's General Manager in the Netherlands, as well as other senior figures in both Amsterdam and London.

As part of your job, you would ensure:

that Deliveroo is generating a stream of proactive and creative media opportunities in the Netherlands;
That the business responds to risks and opportunities arising from public affairs and regulatory issues in market;
the company is proactive in dealing with challenges, in communicating our business model and policy positions, and in demonstrating our commitment to the communities in which we operate;

Important competencies for the successful candidate will include:

Several years experience in fields relating to Dutch media and politics - a combination of both would be highly valued;
Strong pre-existing relationships and network that could be used for both corporate communications and public affairs;
An understanding of the policy and regulatory issues facing companies in the gig economy.

A proactive attitude and a desire to learn about and help make decisions right across the business, including commercial and operational decisions.

A desire to work in a close-knit team and across multiple teams in a growing organisation, in particular policy, legal, finance and operations.

An excellent verbal and written communicator with the ability to prioritise.
Fluency in both Dutch and English.


Life at Deliveroo

We are a growing team, with very large impact, seeking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, we're always looking for new ideas and we're very transparent about the decisions we make and why we make them.

There are so many questions we need to answer and plenty more we haven't even encountered. How do data and technology help restaurants to grow as consumer habits change? How can we predict what someone wants to order for dinner long before the idea has even crossed their mind? At Deliveroo these are just some of the tough problems we are solving - and there is no challenge that cannot be yours. No solution is owned by a particular team, which means the scope for growth and personal impact is enormous.


Benefits and Diversity

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including health, family, finance, community, convenience, growth, time away and relocation.

In 2018 we announced our decision to give every employee equity in the company. We did this because we wanted all of our employees, regardless of location, level or role to be owners and because we believe that this is the right thing to do. We believe this helps build a culture where everyone is committed and able to share in the company's success.

We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing start-up's around

Why Deliveroo?

Our mission is to be the definitive food company. We are transforming the way the world eats by making food more convenient and accessible. We give people the opportunity to eat what they want, when and where they want it.

Our journey began with our founder Will, arriving in London and finding it almost impossible to order great food, despite living in one of the world's best cities for food. In 2013 he got on his bike and founded Deliveroo.

Fast forward to today and Deliveroo can be found in 12 markets, with over 110,000 riders delivering orders from over 140,000 restaurants and grocery stores serving millions of customers in 800 worldwide.

Delivering great food from restaurants is how we started, but isn't our only offering. We pioneered the delivery-only kitchen model, Deliveroo Editions, where we use data to identify gaps in the market and bring new brands and cuisines to new areas, giving people more choice in their local neighbourhood. And using our network and technology we provide a growing on-demand grocery service, which has not only brought incredible levels of convenience to our customers but has been a lifeline to so many during COVID.

We operate one of the most complex three sided marketplaces, and we do this in real-time. Millions of customers and thousands of restaurants and riders rely on us to match them within milliseconds, and the algorithms behind our marketplace are the secret sauce that allow us to deliver our orders in under 30 minutes.

There are so many questions we are working on and plenty more we haven't even encountered. How do we give low income families access to affordable healthy meals? How do we tackle waste? How can we scale our network to tens of millions of orders a day? What does a future layout of a restaurant look like? How do data and technology help restaurants to grow as consumer habits change? How can we take what we know about a customer and offer a truly personalised selection?

At Deliveroo these are just some of the tough problems we are solving - and there is no challenge that cannot be yours. No solution is owned by a particular team, which means the scope for growth and personal impact is enormous. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, seeking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

The size of the opportunity ahead of us is immense. Only 3% of the global food market is online. Contrast that with the digital disruption of other industries, such as from travel (45%) and retail (10%), and it is clear we are at the very beginning of our journey. Despite being one of the world's fastest growing multi-billion dollar companies, we're only just getting started.

We hope you're as excited about the scale of the opportunity as we are and, if you share our ambition, that you'll join us and be part of this incredible story.

Job Title: Director of Environment, Health & Safety and Environmental, Social and Governance )( EHS & ESG
Job Description:
Will you be our next TIP colleague?
Are you looking for a challenging workplace where you can work with professional and energetic colleagues? Who are passionate about what they do, and who are committed to deliver excellence every day? All in a work environment where safety and wellbeing in the workplace is our primary care, team spirit is fostered and integrity is at the core of our business. With operations throughout Europe and Canada we provide many opportunities for your professional growth!
Job Description
This is an exciting opportunity be part of shaping the future of sustainable transport and logistics globally. The organisation is looking for a progressive and innovative leader to revitalise the businesses approach to sustainability and EHS. This key hire will help set the sustainability strategy and drive the implementation of a strengthened market leading ESG framework including group-wide improvements, development of governance systems, development of appropriate ESG KPIs, continuous improvement plans and overall cultural approach to EHS matters.
The role responsibilities include:
Creating, executing and monitoring TIP’s global ESG sustainability strategy
Creating an ESG framework
Develop ESG KPIs including in partnership with TIP leadership for lenders
Manage sustainability reporting including UN Global Compact reporting and other ESG reporting to our stakeholder and the market
Manage compliance with ESG KPIs (UN, lenders, Shareholders etc.), including but not limited to, define baselines for energy & waste consumption and ambitions targets to reduce over the coming 5 years.
Develop short and midterm reporting for the ESG framework manually and/or with an automated system. Work with a diverse range of stakeholders including senior leadership and local teams across the TIP group.
Management of a global EHS team
The role would be reporting to the COO and managing the global EHS team.
Accountabilities include amongst others:
Creation and implementation of the global TIP ESG strategic plan in partnership with leadership with targets and deliverables set short-mid-long term.
Social impact program design, oversight, and implementation leveraging internal and external stakeholders.
Stakeholder sustainability reporting including but not limited to annual reporting to the UN Global Compact and wider reports via the TIP Sustainability Report and independent reports.
Coordinate with social impact and green initiative partners for program implementation and reporting.
Establishing data-driven ESG goals, milestones and metrics, create business cases, manage budgets, support the development and resourcing of impact initiatives.
Lead climate change mitigation project to drive CO2 reduction and recyclables. Develop “the GREEN location of the future”, design efficient energy consumption model linked to renewable solutions and a strict waste management policy including processes to support these policies. Complete the necessary proof of concept and cost benefit analysis to prepare 5-year implementation plan.
Develop, monitor and report on KPIs linked with “Green funding” finance programs.
Maintain awareness of global ESG trends and tools, metrics, KPIs, prepare internal communications in partnership with marketing, and share updates and implications with broader team.
Serve as TIP’s global 'go to' expert for sustainability and environmental topics, communicating and educating others in-line with company strategy.
Represent TIP as a sustainability expert at market events and other strategic initiatives to position TIPs sustainability credentials.
Interacting with public stakeholders on the topic of sustainability including exploring collaboration opportunities and grant funding possibilities for R&D projects. Maintain a working knowledge of EU Green finance taxonomy and other relevant sustainability regulation globally.
Interact with external private stakeholders and wider market participants on the topics of sustainability including ESG/EHS. Further to the extent relevant explore strategic sustainability collaboration opportunities with wider market.
Leading the EHS team and responsible to ensure our employees are well trained & equipped to lead safety compliance and keep themselves safe.
Leads the vision, develops strategic direction, projects & execution of all our environmental & safety programs.
Prepare and deliver annual EHS strategy, project plans & training programs. Identify EHS requirement and possible risk. Prepare budgets for Region.
Leadership of ESG and EHS TIP policies, procedures, and compliance within all countries within the region and in accordance with the local legal. Requirements. Preparing and providing policies in accordance with TIP procedures and format.
Manage EHS governance systems.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Transportation, Logistics, Sustainability, Engineering, Operations, Supply Chain, or related field from an accredited university.
Several years relevant experience and a proven track record in implementing corporate sustainability programs on a global scale.
Strong leadership skills including; energetic, ambitious, authentic, process driven, clear vision.
Demonstrable experience in business and operational transformations.
In-depth knowledge of the regulatory landscape in Europe and North America around sustainability, energy and carbon reduction. Working knowledge of carbon footprint inventory and accounting preferred.
Analytical skills to assess and interpret large volumes of data.
A collaborative approach and experience working with cross-functional teams. You know how to work with and get buy in from diverse stakeholders, and ideally, have already done so in an international company.
Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with extreme discretion.
A resilience mindset, the ability to find creative solutions to problems and challenges.
Excellent communication skills. You can communicate up and down the organisation and with external stakeholders. Your English is fluent, and an additional language is an advantage.
TIP is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce, encouraging applications from all qualified individuals.
Hiring is subject to a satisfactory reference check.

The role would be reporting to the COO and managing the global EHS team.

Creation and implementation of the global TIP ESG strategic plan in partnership with leadership with targets and deliverables set short-mid-long term.

Marley Spoon is the new way to cook. Bringing delightful, market-fresh, and easy cooking back to the people while building a sustainable supply chain for a waste-free world.
We deliver top quality fresh ingredients, in the exact quantities required, with chef-designed easy-to-cook recipes, to thousands of households across the globe. We currently service the US, EU, and Australia with three brands - Marley Spoon, Martha & Marley Spoon, and Dinnerly. Marley Spoon simplifies weeknight cooking and helps busy people skip the supermarket.
But in the end, it's simple: We started Marley Spoon because we love cooking and we love eating!
We are searching for a Purchasing Specialist.
Responsibilities
Generate, track, and manage Purchase Orders in Marley Spoon’s ERP, ensuring accurate quantities and timely delivery.
Manage daily supplier relations to ensure the timely delivery of the product; resolve shipping issues, manage purchase order changes, and review monthly scorecards to implement necessary corrective action plans (e.g. delivery times or quality improvements)
Support Strategic Sourcing in preparing periodical supplier performance reviews and internal meetings
Maintain a daily inbound receiving schedule and coordinate with vendors and/or carriers to make sure purchase orders are delivering on desired dates, communicating any issues to the organization.
Maintain adequate replenishment inventory to support daily fulfillment while achieving the desired turns and minimum inventory number
Review, track, reconcile, and approve invoices in conformity with received product.
Responsible for commenting on waste reasons from purchasing actions.
Coordinate with the warehouse supervisors to ensure the product is received and available for production.
Collaborate with Category Managers to resolve item and vendor issues where stock and service levels are not being met against established inventory plans.
Check and approve invoices
Available to be on call on Saturday mornings
Requirements
Associate or Bachelor’s Degree;
Previous experience in a Supply Chain/Purchasing/Operations related role;
Several years of experience in a related field;
Good analytical skills and intermediate user of Google Sheets/Excel;
Previous experience with any kind of ERP software;
Process and information flow understanding;
Driven to achieve the highest quality in daily work;
Strong problem solving & multitasking skills with great attention to detail. Team player and good communication skills with a passion to always learn more and share your knowledge with others;
Availability to work on Saturdays.
Benefits
Free Marley Spoon boxes
Awesome team events, such as company pub quiz nights and TGIF beers
Test kitchen in the office - you get to try our recipes first!
True ownership, real responsibilities, and strong opportunities for growth

Love the sound of the position, but don’t think you’re the ideal candidate? Please apply! At Marley Spoon, we value learning and growth.
We have worked hard to build a diverse team of inspiring and passionate people. We encourage people of all genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientation to apply!

Generate, track, and manage Purchase Orders in Marley Spoon’s ERP, ensuring accurate quantities and timely delivery.
Manage daily supplier relations to ensure the timely delivery of the product; resolve shipping issues, manage purchase order changes, and review monthly scorecards to implement necessary corrective action plans (e.g. delivery times or quality improvements)
Support Strategic Sourcing in preparing periodical supplier performance reviews and internal meetings
Maintain a daily inbound receiving schedule and coordinate with vendors and/or carriers to make sure purchase orders are delivering on desired dates, communicating any issues to the organization.
Maintain adequate replenishment inventory to support daily fulfillment while achieving the desired turns and minimum inventory number
Review, track, reconcile, and approve invoices in conformity with received product.
Responsible for commenting on waste reasons from purchasing actions.
Coordinate with the warehouse supervisors to ensure the product is received and available for production.
Collaborate with Category Managers to resolve item and vendor issues where stock and service levels are not being met against established inventory plans.
Check and approve invoices
Available to be on call on Saturday mornings
Requirements
Associate or Bachelor’s Degree;
Previous experience in a Supply Chain/Purchasing/Operations related role;
Several years of experience in a related field;
Good analytical skills and intermediate user of Google Sheets/Excel;
Previous experience with any kind of ERP software;
Process and information flow understanding;
Driven to achieve the highest quality in daily work;
Strong problem solving & multitasking skills with great attention to detail. Team player and good communication skills with a passion to always learn more and share your knowledge with others;
Availability to work on Saturdays.
Benefits
Free Marley Spoon boxes
Awesome team events, such as company pub quiz nights and TGIF beers
Test kitchen in the office - you get to try our recipes first!
True ownership, real responsibilities, and strong opportunities for growth

Job Title: Senior Campaigner on Diets and Climate
Company Name: Feedback legally registered as Global Feedback Ltd
Job Description: How to applyPlease apply at https://feedbackglobal.org/job/senior-campaigner-netherlands-diets-and-climate-change/ where you are asked to submit, in Word or PDF format, a CV / resume and cover letter (no more than 2 sides of A4 each), explaining how you meet the person specification and why you would like to work at Feedback. Please include one paragraph in your cover letter in Dutch .For a short background chat about the role, please arrange for a call with Karen Luyckx at Feedback.Closing date for applications is Tuesday 26th January at midnight.Shortlisted candidates will be notified on Friday 29th January.Interviews will be held online via Zoom on Thursday 4th and Monday 8th February and will include a short, written task to be carried out the day of the interview.Company descriptionFeedback is an environmental campaigning charity working to regenerate nature by transforming the food system. We are mainly based in London but are launching a new office in the Netherlands in 2021.Vacancy textKey informationJob title : Senior CampaignerReporting to:  Head of Policy and MediaSalary : 3,500-4,500 euros per month pro rata, according to experienceContract : 4 days per week (30 hours), with a high degree of flexibility over working hours (core hours 10-4). 25 days annual leave, pro rataDuration : 6 month initial contract, subject to extension to 12 months. The successful candidate will initially be employed by our ally Stichting Changing Markets for the first six months, but line managed by Feedback through a secondment arrangement. The 1 month probationary period of this first phase will count as full probationary period and would not need to be repeated when the contract is switched to Feedback. Feedback is currently in the process of formalizing its presence as a registered charity (Stichting) in the Netherlands.Start date : Flexible - ideally February 2021Location : Location flexible within the Netherlands. A desk in a co-working space will be provided, however the candidate will also have the possibility to work from home, according to preference and Dutch government guidance and regulation in response to Coronavirus.Note: We regrettably cannot offer visa sponsorship for this position. You must possess the right to work in the EU.About UsFeedback is a London-based environmental campaign group. We work to regenerate nature by transforming our food system. Food production is the single greatest impact humans have on the environment. From mountains of food waste, to habitat destruction to grow animal feed for factory farms, to soil depletion leaving future harvests at risk: the food system needs to change. Founded in 2013, we combine investigative research, campaigns, community outreach and on-the-ground pilot projects for a better food system.About the roleThis is an exciting and unique opportunity to bring Feedback's pioneering campaigning on sustainable diets and supermarkets to a new European context. We are seeking a senior campaigner to manage our program of work on meat, diets and climate change in the Netherlands. Based in Amsterdam, or another location in the Netherlands, subject to discussion, the successful candidate will also be Feedback's first EU-based employee, building on our history of campaigning across the EU and in Member States on food and environment issues.We're looking for a self-starter who is able to work independently and take the initiative, to work closely with Feedback's existing staff in London, to launch and manage a program of campaigning to ensure that the private sector, in particular supermarkets, play a central role in halving public meat and dairy consumption by 2030. Your role will involve building relationships and coalitions in the Netherlands, at EU level and in Member States, drawing learning from Feedback's UK campaigning on meat, diets and supermarkets, and developing and implementing a campaign plan for the Dutch context. For the right candidate, there will be significant opportunities for development and leadership of Feedback's work in Europe. Feedback is in the process of setting up a foundation in the Netherlands as our long-term EU base. The successful candidate will initially be employed by our ally Stichting Changing Markets for the first six months, but line managed by Feedback through a secondment arrangement. The 1 month probationary period of this first phase will count as full probationary period and would not need to be repeated when the contract is switched to Feedback. Feedback is currently in the process of formalizing its presence as a registered charity (Stichting) in the NetherlandsIn the short-term, while this process is underway, the successful candidate will be contracted by Changing Markets Foundation, close allies of Feedback. After the initial 6-month contract via Changing Markets, the employee will transfer to a contract with Feedback.To be successful in this role, you will need to be passionate about addressing head-on the damage that our food system causes to our climate, ecology and biodiversity. You will be an experienced campaigner, with a strong understanding of the environmental and climate sector in the Netherlands and a good grasp of the interactions between food systems and environmental issues. You will be keen to demonstrate your creativity and initiative in establishing Feedback's campaign in a new location and will have excellent skills in identifying and developing new relationships and communicating with colleagues in a remote setting. You will be able to demonstrate your strong campaign instincts and sound political judgment in creating and implementing campaign plans. We look forward to welcoming you to our team.Job DescriptionThe main responsibilities of this role are:To manage Feedback's campaign activity on diets and climate change in the Netherlands (approx. 80% of time)To facilitate the development, and to implement, a campaign strategy to catalyse supermarket and food business action on 'less and better' meat and dairy in the Netherlands, aiming at a long-term reduction of 50% in meat and dairy sales.To build on Feedback's existing reports and research to develop indicators to assess and rank Dutch food businesses against the campaign goals.To create media stories and digital content and use social media and other tools to achieve campaign goals.To develop and embed relationships with relevant contacts in business, civil society and public policy in the Netherlands and at EU-level.To recruit and manage external contractors (such as media consultants or designers) as required.To support and implement a plan to monitor and evaluate this campaign work.Contribute to campaign and policy strategy development, fundraising and other core parts of Feedback's work (approx. 20% of time)To scope and research potential campaign angles on Feedback's issues in the Netherlands and more broadly across the EU.To develop EU-wide relationships on environment and food issues and develop future partnerships.To ensure high standards of project management, including reporting to funders and managing a budget.To contribute to future fundraising bids in support of this role and Feedback's wider ambitions in the EU.To undertake some administrative tasks in support of this role, as required.To play a part in the wider Feedback team, contributing to problem solving, content and strategy development.Person specificationTo deliver in this role you will need to have:A passion for creating environmental and climate change through campaigning, and at least 5 years' experience achieving corporate and policy change on environmental issues.A good understanding of EU policy processes.Proven interest in, and knowledge of, environmental issues and / or food systems acquired through qualifications, professional or volunteer experience.Flexibility and resilience - the ability to manage multiple priorities and to pivot rapidly to take advantage of emerging opportunities.Excellent communication skills - persuasive writing skills and fluent spoken and written English and Dutch, as well as experience presenting and facilitating.Strong IT skills / literacy (Word, Excel, email management, social media).Ideally, experience working in remote teams and maintaining strong working relationships with remote colleagues.A self-starter with a can-do attitude, flexibility and adaptability, willing to pitch in on delivery and help colleagues across the team, recognizing that Feedback is a small, nimble organization with fast-changing priorities.A commitment to Feedback's values - we are bold, collaborative, impact-driven, celebratory and inspiring - and to our goal of ecological regeneration through changing the food system.This job is open to everyone, regardless of their background. We acknowledge that the environmental sector is less open to people from under-represented backgrounds and we are strongly committed to doing what we can to correct this. We especially want to hear from you if you feel that opportunities like this are less available to you.Contract duration 6-12 monthsPart-time hours: 30 per weekApplication deadline: 26-1-2021Soort dienstverband: Parttime, Bepaalde tijdSalaris: €3.500,00 - €4.500,00 per maandArbeidsvoorwaarden:Flexibele werkurenWerk vanuit huisWerkschema:ma-vrMaatregelen tegen het coronavirus:Location flexible within the Netherlands. A desk in a co-working space will be discussed, however the candidate will have the possibility to work from home, according to preference and Dutch government guidance and regulation in response to CoronaviruTaal:English (Vereist)Dutch (Vereist)Sollicitatievraag:Do you have the right to work in the EU? Please note that we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this position.Thuiswerken:Tijdelijk vanwege COVID-19

The opportunity where you will make an impact:

As our Head of Program management, you will bring the project structure and a framework to the business to ensure business teams are focused on the operational readiness to support the launch of new territories, application capability and functions. You will be responsible for implementing a change management team within the business to support the adoption of projects into BAU activities.

Full-time · Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Accounting for project costs, time and budget

Building business cases for future capital investment and working with teams to create ROI plans
Organising programs and activities in accordance with the mission and goals
Managing the risk register across the in-flight projects
Developing a budget and operating plan for the program
Developing an evaluation method to assess program strengths and identify areas for improvement
Writing program funding proposals to guarantee uninterrupted delivery of services
Managing a team with a diverse array of talents and responsibilities
Ensuring goals are met in areas including customer satisfaction, safety, quality and team member performance
Implementing and managing the change program and interventions to ensure project goals are achieved
Meeting with stakeholders to make communication easy and transparent regarding project issues and decisions on services
Producing accurate and timely reporting of program status throughout its life cycle
Analysing program risks
Working on strategy with the marketing team
Activating new sites on time with required functionality and capability.

Regular clear and accurate reporting across the program to ensure management and stakeholders are aware of the status

Maintaining program velocity throughout


What you will bring to Body & Fit

A minimum of 3 to 5 years experience in leading multi stream projects in a retail setup or e-commerce business

Proven track record of delivering complex projects

Proven ability to manage stakeholders
Strong knowledge of project governance and frameworks
Ability to identify team resource challenges through project velocity or identifying bottlenecks and shortfalls with clear reporting to management
Fluency in English
Certification in project management

What we would like to offer you:

The opportunity to shape your career in our global organisation that is championing the healthy lifestyle movement!

Create your own nutrition formula with a discount on our products!

Are we the right fit for you?

Life is way too short to waste anyone’s time so there are a few things that we would like to be upfront about:

Politics, intrigue, gossip. We’re just way too busy for all that stuff!
Slow moving, corporate environment. We move pretty quickly here so we don’t have room for passengers.
Hiding in the background. If we’re to grow together we want you to step up and tell us how to do it. We need your voice!


Please note: To be eligible for this position you need to have a valid working visa / permit to work in the Netherlands.

DescriptionDo you want to be part of an exhilarating project, in the charming city of Amsterdam, alongside an international team of passionate change-makers, all the while you help us march toward future-proof social and ecological sustainability? If you answered yes, then we have the perfect internship for you.About usWe are a social business dealing with environmental and social issues through different projects and collaborations. Sapient Social & Environmental Enterprises was established in 2016 and consists of a team of young inspired individuals, from all over the world who dedicate themselves to stop food waste, renew democracy, provide local green energy solutions, and help other social businesses in their path to positive impact.SapientNRGThis is the engineering projects branch of Sapient. Here we strive for sustainability mainly by tackling the issue of renewable energy. The damage the world has endured over the past century is not irreversible; we want to change the momentum towards a clean high-tech world.Our ProductMagneticGen is the product we are currently developing. A levitating magnet with its own electro-magnetic elasticity comparable to a normal gravity pendulum. It can harness the vibrations deflected onto it to transform this mechanical energy to an electrical one. Its field of use is wide, from ground and wall vibrations to body ones, it will be an asset to the Dutch renewable energy empire.Job DescriptionWe at SapientNRG acquire a lot of knowledge about the different issues we are facing and trying to solve regarding sustainable energy and internal team dynamics. We also acquire knowledge about the way we work that needs to be captured, and these learnings have to be organized to improve the processes in the company. We are looking for an innovative Knowledge Coordinator intern to join our team to help us optimize the process of sharing, editing and saving knowledge.Your tasks will include:Coaching, guiding and training employees.Organizing, collecting and updating knowledge and information in a clear, accessible way and putting it together to be available for everyone in the team.Understanding and communicating Sapient's missions and values in a clear and accessible way for everyone.Establishing an information architecture for multiple user groups, in a knowledge sharing environment.Locating and archiving institutional knowledge.RequirementsDo you fit our profile?Excellent communication skills,Professional proficiency in English,Information management and organizing skills,Solid problem-solving and decision-making skills with quality focus,Data-collecting, analysis and research skills,Enjoys working in an international, challenging and social environment.What we offerThis is a non-paid internship. So what's in it for you?A more in-depth understanding of social business and its social & environmental impact,The opportunity to participate in a dynamic, proactive and young environment where creative freedom is encouraged.Autonomy and flexible working hours,The power to make a difference,The opportunity to acquire new skills, learn and grow,Amazing colleagues.Internship DetailsCurrently we are looking for a new intern to join us as soon as possible for a minimum of 3 months (Longer internship periods are preferred)The internship is unremuneratedDue to Corona restrictions, it is possible to work remotely for certain positions. It's also possible to work from our office Ferdinand Huyckstraat 62, 1061 HW Amsterdam.HOW TO APPLY!If this position sounds appealing to you please send your CV and motivational letter to sapientnrg @ gmail .com (all documents must be in english and in PDF). Make sure to include “Internship Application Knowledge Coordinator MM.YY - MM.YY)” in the subject header with your dates of availability.If you plan to move to Amsterdam and you are applying from outside the EU without a working visa, please ensure that you sort out how you plan to arrange your stay in the Netherlands. We do not offer any assistance regarding visas and permits, this includes sponsorship letters.We look forward to hearing from you!Websites: https://www.sapientsee.com/https://www.foodcirclenl.com/https://sapientsee.wixsite.com/healthyandaffordablehttps://www.f6s.com/sapientnrg#!Job Type: InternshipLanguage:English (Required)Work Remotely:Yes

A minimum of 2 years’ of experience within e-commerce

BOCCA Coffee Kerkstraat is looking for aStore Manager (38hr)For our flagship store in Amsterdam, we are looking for an experienced manager who’s to lead the location with success by taking ownership of the location and maintaining an organized and efficient process for regular operations. Do you want to learn everything about sustainability, and would you like to work in an international company on an unique department within a hospitality concept? We want you!


Your mission, if you choose to accept it...


TSH is serious about sustainability and impact (our Corporate Social Responsibility). We aim to drive innovations and projects that stimulate planet-proof behaviour, and consequently enable our community of changemakers to do good.
With our new long-term sustainability strategy that focuses on key projects such as waste, energy, and flying, and data monitoring through Science Based Targets and other certification schemes we’re looking to take our ambitions to the next level.

To help us get there, we’re looking for an Impact Intern to support the Sustainability Team! You will join the team at our headquarters in Amsterdam for a period of 6 months, starting in March 2021.

In case you don’t know who we are (ahem)...
TSH is a game-changer. Our unique hotel concept offers student accommodation as well as long and short stay options for students-at-heart, together with epic facilities and exciting co-working spaces.
Currently located in Amsterdam, The Hague, Eindhoven, Maastricht, Groningen, Dresden, Berlin, Florence, Barcelona, Vienna and with Delft and Bologna just joined the family, The Student Hotel is a truly new hospitality concept in the hearth of Europe.

What You'll Do to make it happen:

You’ll support the Sustainability Team with managing the different projects

You’ll act as a point-of-contact internally for questions and comments related to sustainability
You’ll setup sustainability related (online) events
You’ll create content about the different projects that can be shared both internally and externally
You’ll do research on waste, energy & water management, as well as on impact measurements.

Who You Are

You believe that people, planet and profit go hand-in-hand and you’re excited to use your knowledge and skills for a more sustainable world. You have a go-getter mentality, can enthuse others to support your projects and know how to write an engaging story. You’re flexible, can handle multiple tasks at once and are not afraid to share own insights or ideas that could make the projects even better.

Currently studying Sustainable Business, Future Planet Studies, Environmental Science, Development Studies or something similar
Affinity with sustainability and (social) impact
Strong communication skills
Eagerness to develop yourself in project management in an operational environment
A strong entrepreneurial spirit and an ability to address challenges and opportunities
Problem solving capabilities to resolve issues that face a growing company
Care for guests/partners experiencing TSH and a true passion for the TSH mission
Fluent in English (written and spoken), other European languages are a bonus
Available for minimum of 6 month and legally permitted to work and live in the Netherlands / European Union

What We Offer

A Full-time internship for 40 hours per week with monthly compensation for your internship.
An amazing work environment with a fantastic vibe and lots of positive energy.
Time carved out for you to work on your own research-project
On the job coaching and guidance
The opportunity to work at a dynamic, young, international organization; we’re a real game changer in the hospitality industry

We’re curious, conscious, and we celebrate all. We bring people together and are committed to providing the best space, experience and workplace for our entire connected community - no matter what age, gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, national origin and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and makes you you.


Join The Student Hotel

Ben jij de pragmatische, slimme projectmanager die ons gaat helpen het historisch radioactief afval af te voeren?Projectmanager radioactive waste managementFunctieAls projectmanager zorg je voor de inrichting en besturing van projecten. De projecten betreffen het afvoeren van radioactief afval. Je stemt met alle betrokkenen af op welke wijze het afval wordt gekarakteriseerd, verwerkt, verpakt en afgevoerd, en leidt daarna de uitvoering. In de projecten zorg je o.a. voor het uitvoeren van veiligheidsstudies, de ontwikkeling van verpakkingen, het aanvragen van vergunningen en het aanpassen van installaties of hulpmiddelen. De multidisciplinaire projecten zijn een complex samenspel van diverse interne en externe betrokkenen. Met jouw gedegen technische kennis kun jij vanuit de inhoud deze belangen bij elkaar brengen en richting aan de projecten geven.Een greep uit de kerntaken:- Bewaakt de planning, kwaliteit, voortgang, besteding van budgetten, en de operationele besluitvorming;- Stuurt op de uitvoering en kwaliteit van projectresultaten;- Treedt op als opdrachtgever naar onderaannemers;- Adviseert over oplossingen voor knelpunten in de ontwikkeling en uitvoering van projecten;- Signaleert ontwikkelingen in het vakgebied, adviseert in investeringsbeslissingen en projectvoorbereiding en bedenkt op welke wijze technische mogelijkheden toe te passen zijn binnen projecten;- Ziet toe op de naleving van veiligheids- en milieuvoorschriften.- Bevordert een duidelijke communicatie en informatievoorziening tussen de betrokkenen binnen en buiten de organisatie.Wat staat jou als projectmanager te wachten:- Je krijgt verschillende projecten met een grote eigen verantwoordelijkheid;- Je gaat op operationeel, tactisch en strategisch niveau aan de slag;- Je stuurt de experts uit het veld aan.ProfielBij NRG hechten wij veel waarde aan de kerncompetenties van onze medewerkers. Wij verwachten van jou dat veiligheid altijd prioriteit heeft en je op een prettige manier met anderen samenwerkt. Je bent de specialist in jouw vakgebied en je hebt een proactieve en ondernemende instelling.Specifieke eisen:- Een afgeronde technische WO master;- Een afgeronde opleiding op het gebied van nucleaire technologie of stralingsbescherming, of aantoonbare werkervaring in een nucleaire werkomgeving;- Ervaring met het leiden van projecten;- Je toont initiatief en neemt verantwoordelijkheid;- Je bent resultaatgericht en toont doorzettingsvermogen;- Je bent een kei in samenwerken;- Je beheerst Nederlands op zakelijk niveau, of bent bereid dat snel te leren.TeamJe komt te werken in het RMWP Projectmanagement team, bestaande uit 8 collega's.ArbeidsvoorwaardenNaast een interessante functie en betekenisvol werk biedt NRG je ook goede arbeidsvoorwaarden.Modern en marktconform arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket- Een goed salaris met doorgroeimogelijkheden;- 27 vakantiedagen en 12 dagen flextijd (bij een fulltime dienstverband;- 6,3% eindejaarsuitkering en 8% vakantietoeslag;- Pensioen bij het ABP; NRG betaalt 74% van de premie;- Een reiskostenvergoeding.Persoonlijke ontwikkeling- Een digitale onboarding voor iedereen nieuw in dienst;- Een jaarlijks opleidingsbudget en ruimte voor je eigen wensen.Flexibiliteit en balans werk-privé- Mogelijkheid tot overnachting als je ver weg woont;- Mogelijkheid tot verlof kopen.Leuke activiteiten- Een actieve personeelsvereniging.Informatie & sollicitatieMeer weten over deze functie of ons bedrijf, neem dan contact op met onze corporate recruiter Nancy Roggeveen via 06-15590245. Voor meer informatie over ons bedrijf, bekijk onze corporate bedrijfspagina www.nrg.eu of solliciteer direct via www.werkenbijnrg.nl.Een veiligheidsonderzoek (Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag) maakt onderdeel uit van de selectieprocedure. eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.
About the business:
Marktplaats, 2dehands and 2ememain are part of eBay and the eBay Classifieds Group (eCG). It combines the energy of a start-up with the resources of one of the leading technology companies in the world. We offer the top 500 advertisers relevant ways to connect and communicate with our 11 million monthly unique users, customized integrations and partnerships. Consumer and professional sellers offer a large and varied assortment of used and new products. But we want to go even further - we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. We invite you to join us!


Every month Marktplaats handles over 8 million unique visitors and 350.000 new advertisements every single day making Marktplaats the largest online trading platform in the Netherlands. Consumer and professional sellers offer a large and varied assortment of used and new products. We go even further - we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. We are a mix of Dutch and Silicon Valley cultures; like both, we are an international team of passionate people who share a common interest in solving problems using software and data. We invite you to join us!
About the team:
Classifieds is crafting the future of local commerce by bringing people together through an enriched online experience that allows them to work closely with the community around them. We are comprised of more than 1,000 people who are passionate for local trade and maintaining the customer-centric nature of the Group, while exploring growth opportunities in both the countries where eBay Classifieds Group already has a presence and in prospective markets.
We are looking for an experienced CRM Specialist to join the team, who will accelerate our CRM efforts on our Automotive business. You will join the Benelux CRM team (part of the central marketing team) with a focus on driving customer success and value in our Dutch and Belgian markets.
For this, you improve the experience and impact in all stages of the customer journey, from acquisition through retention to win-back. Our focus is on connecting buyers and sellers and encourage many relevant trade moments for all parties.
The CRM team takes the lead in defining the overall customer approach with regards to 1:1 customer communications. To bring the strategies to life, the team has a range of owned channels at its disposal, such as email, (push) notifications, and direct mail. Deployment of other channels such as performance advertising and in-product messaging are aligned with the respective channel teams.
Within the marketing team you will work with our integrated marketing manager, the content manager and the performance advertising manager. Outside of marketing your reach extends to the business & product teams as well as analytics and tech development.
Key responsibilities:
As our new CRM Specialist you are responsible for ideation and execution of CRM programs for multi-channel journeys.
Understanding customer journeys and finding opportunities for growth of our professional dealer base and private cars customers.

Creation of strategic and tactical plans to increase the activity and size of our customer base.

Development of campaign strategies, and drive execution through to completion with partners in the marketing and product teams utilizing both internal and external platforms and tools

Measuring the impact of CRM initiatives on campaign KPI’s and contribution to annual objectives, and develop ways to optimize and scale them

Working cross-functionally with business teams, product, engineering, and analytics to meet ambitious growth targets

Drive all campaign retrospectives to continue iterating and improving processes

What we expect from you:
3-5 years “hands-on” campaign execution of owned 1:1 marketing channels (e.g. email, notifications, direct mail, outreach)

Ability to understand our customer’s needs and translate them into compelling marketing propositions and assets

Data-savviness: Ability to process, analyse and interpret data

Strong stakeholder managing skills to ensure other teams internally and externally are aligned.

Project management: you will be developing and managing multiple campaigns at the same time. You are a structured multi-tasker.

Experience and/or affinity with marketplaces connecting (professional) sellers and buyers.

High technical aptitude

Experience in the Automotive business is preferred.

Hands-on experience with Adobe Campaign Manager is preferred

Strong passion to learn and grow and takes initiative to succeed

What you can expect from us:
An informal, international and energetic work environment in a fast paced company

Work with cool modern technologies, processes and consumer facing products

Teammates who will challenge you to give your best!

What we offer:
Dynamic, international teams with skilled personalities, ambition, integrity and a good sense of humor

A competitive salary, phenomenal benefits and an excellent working environment

Benefits:
Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs.
We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work.

Facilities Specialist -210001JI

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English

Preferred Qualifications
We are looking for an Facility Specialist to to work in Amsterdam, but can be working on projects in the other offices in The Netherlands. Operational responsibility for preserving facilities is safe and well functioning.
The ideal candidate will be well-organized, efficient, communication skills, speaking languages Dutch and English are needed.
Working on
The goal is to ensure our business’s accommodation is problem-free and safe so that employees can work under the best conditions.
Responsibilities
Plan and coordinate internal moves, internal meetings, coordinate.
Working together with EHS to make sure equipment and supplies are met health and safety standards
Inspect work floors to determine the need for repairs or renovations
Review utilities consumption and strive to minimize costs, and keep admin.
Supervise all custodians, technicians, groundskeepers etc and external contractors
Control activities like parking space allocation, waste disposal, building security etc.
Handle work plans and service contracts
Keep financial and non-financial records
Perform analysis and forecasting for budgets
Requirements
Some experience Facility Assistant or relevant position
Working technical/ operations and facilities management best practices
Knowledge of basic finance principles
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent organizational skills
Good analytical/critical thinking
Schooling facility management or relevant field
Working in Procurement
Handling operational external contracts, cleaning, reception, catering etc
Working in small team
Detailed Description and Job Requirements

Provide building and office management services for economy of operation and maximum usage of facilities and equipment. Work with external vendors to develop and implement facilities plans. Review vendor contracts, onsite vendor performance, timely work order completion, and construction related activities. Participate in collaborative space planning efforts with internal resources and user groups. Prepare and monitor annual property budget and other related costs in facility planning. This position will interface with both senior management as well as individual contributors.

As a member of our Real Estate and Facilities team, you will assist the building or office manager in all aspects of daily operations. This may include managing Oracle's office space and equipment. Ensure adherence to company guidelines, processes and building and safety codes. Obtain, review and estimate design costs including equipment, installation, labor, materials, and preparation. Prepare annual budget. Conduct benchmarking.

Work involves some problem solving with assistance and guidance in understanding and applying company policies and procedures. Excellent communication and decision making skills. Familiarity with email and MS Office applications is essential. Willing to function as after- hours contact for facilities emergencies. May be required to be accessible via phone or pager. Degree, relevant certification or equivalent with 0 - 2 years prior facilities or property assistant experience preferred.

As part of Oracle's employment process candidates will be required to successfully complete a pre-employment screening process. This will involve identity and employment verification, professional references, education verification and professional qualifications and memberships (if applicable).

Technical coordinator
Richemont
Amsterdam, NH, NL
Fixed Term
Richemont owns some of the world’s leading luxury goods Maisons, with particular strengths in jewellery, fine watches and premium accessories. Each Maison represents a proud tradition of style, quality and craftsmanship and Richemont seeks to preserve the heritage and identity of each of its Maisons. At the same time, we are committed to innovation and designing new products which are in keeping with our Maisons’ values, through a process of continuous creativity.
RLG Europe B.V., Amsterdam, is home to Richemont regional functions and 8 Richemont brands (including Cartier) that work to support retail and wholesale, marketing and communication for the BeNeLux and Scandinavian region. The offices also provide a platform for European E-commerce and a Customer Relations Center.

In the role of Technical coordinator, you will be in charge of coordination of all mechanical electrical plumbing, civil engineering works and maintenance for the offices and boutiques in the Benelux and Scandinavia.
This position is for three days a week, starting as soon as possible.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Management of long term maintenance plans
You will be creating the maintenance strategy and the long term maintenance plan. You will be managing the implementation based on NEN2767 inspection & completion and handover of recent investment and project scope. You will need to get full understanding of the scope of work per item & priorities.
Coordination of works
You will be planning, coordinating, supervising & handling the administration of works related to mechanical electrical plumbing & civil engineering works. This includes reviewing offers, and approval of work orders, advice on next steps and additional works. Also, quality control of all works will be done by you.
CSR-Sustainable development
Our monumental office building in Amsterdam is BREEAM certified and our ambition is to continue the certification to other buildings & our boutiques. In our building operations we would like to minimize waste and reduce electricity, water and gas consumption.

Contracts management
You will be in charge of managing approximately 15 technical contracts. This includes review of offers and contract agreements, organizing and holding KPI/ SLA review meetings.
Project management
The coordination of everything will be done as a project; based on space planning make sure there is enough power, data, AC, fresh air etc. for all workstations, meeting rooms and other spaces.
Budget management
Budget preparation of the long term maintenance plan and project plan. The monitoring of this budget will be done by you also.
Utility consumption
Review & analyse utilities consumption and strive to minimize cost.
Telephony & MDF
Multi-function device (Ricoh) & iPhones- contracts management, monitor consumption, reporting.

HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

Required experience and education:
Minimum 3 years’ experience in similar role.
MBO or HBO level
NEN 2767 certified
BREEAM expert

Technical skills and abilities:
Ability to read, write & speak English fluently. Dutch is a plus.
Good knowledge of MS Word, MS Excel and MS PowerPoint
You are customer focused and have a solutions oriented way of approaching problems and challenges
You are creative & innovative. You have no problem in taking initiative, and you are proactive
You enjoy working in a team, and working together towards a goal.
Good time management and pragmatic approach to things is needed in this role

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

We offer you a great international environment with strong professionals in the field. Grow and develop your knowledge.

We also offer a competitive salary to reward your efforts and a supportive environment.

YOUR JOURNEY WITH US:

If your application is selected, we will get back to you very soon. The first step will be an interview with our HR team, followed (if successful) by an interview with the Client Director.
In the interview process with us, we always ensure you have complete insight and transparency. If this sounds stimulating to you, we are happy to hear from you and hopefully welcome you to our team.

Richemont is an equal opportunity employer.

Too Good To Go is the world's number 1 app for fighting food waste. Why do we need to do that? Because 1/3 of the food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, 8% of greenhouse gas emissions come from food waste!

Our app has more than 32 million users across Europe, but we're more than an app. Our mission is to inspire and empower everyone to take action against food waste, so we're doing all we can to create educational tools, make our knowledge as accessible as possible, find new business solutions and even change legislation to reduce food waste. We're growing fast with 15 active countries currently and more to come and we are a certified B Corporation. But here's what really matters: through our app, we've saved more than 60 million meals from the bin - and it's only the beginning!

We're proud of what we've achieved so far, but did we mention the issue is huge? We are looking for a Key Account Manager to help us tackle this issue even faster and accelerate our growth!

Your mission:

We are looking for an experienced, dedicated and self-driven Key Account Manager with a passion for tackling food waste in a commercial way. Reporting directly to the Head of Sales, you will be pivotal in driving acquisition and development of partnerships with supermarkets. You will use your key account experience to continue raising the bar with our key accounts in the Netherlands by managing your own portfolio. You will be part of the Global Sales team where best practices and learnings will be shared across borders with our tribe of 750 waste warriors around the globe.

Your role:

Account management for key chains and partners from lead generation to roll out; autonomy in managing these Key Accounts and ensuring the relationship is strong and business KPIs are met.
Onboarding and training new stores in an efficient and scalable way, working with store-level contacts and senior stakeholders.
Identifying new and innovative opportunities to improve existing accounts to help them save more meals. Inputting into the Dutch strategy and assisting with international cooperation across global key chain opportunities.
Finding new business and opportunities, as well as mapping an account's organizational hierarchy to create an account stakeholder matrix.
Pitching, creating and delivering high quality and professional presentations to potential new partners, and confidently speaking about the business and food waste proposition.
Winning new businesses and growing existing accounts to achieve business targets set. Proving the business case with pilots and working with the client to define success metrics with the objective of rolling out.
Researching the market and identifying potential target stores especially within larger chains.
Taking a proactive approach to partner excellence and account management to ensure the highest quality service delivery.
Arranging meetings with chain HQ and individual stores and carrying out product demonstrations.
Using our systems to effectively manage your leads and upload sign-ups quickly and easily onto our app.
Working to weekly and monthly sales targets and KPIs.
Undertaking ad-hoc tasks to improve the Too Good To Go service offering and other ad hoc tasks connected to the Key Account activities.

Requirements:

You have strong experience working in sales and account management (at least 5 years) and a proven track record of acquiring new key accounts in the food sector. A background in FMCG is a strong plus.
You are business and performance driven with previous experience in a Key Account Manager role.
You're a negotiator by nature but with an eye for relationship building and have the ability to lead negotiations and create and deliver high impact pitches with excellent commercial acumen.
You have the ability to work cross-functionally to develop strategies to win key accounts.
You are a fast learner and can handle working on multiple tasks as you enjoy high performance and fast changing environments. You possess a high degree of self-motivation, proactiveness, forward thinking and assertiveness in order to manage expectations from leads as well as driving internal collaboration.
You have experience with project management and are able to create implementation plans for large roll-outs across complex organizations.
You are experienced in using a CRM/Sales tool.
You speak Dutch fluently and are a top of the class English speaker. You have the ability to speak to stakeholders at varying levels in an organization, tailoring your key message and being able to listen to the needs of their business.
You are a make-it-happen person who doesn't hesitate to roll up your sleeves – but you also think about the long-term business implications and requirements.
You have a true passion for sustainability - you understand the urgency of action for the planet.
You have a proven network within the Food & Beverages Industry and/or Food Retail.

What we have to offer:

A unique opportunity to work in a social impact organization (and certified B Corporation) where you get to wake up every day knowing you're achieving positive change.
The experience of being part of an international company with 750+ enthusiastic and highly talented waste warriors across 15 countries (and counting) – always ready to share knowledge and support.
Strong personal as well as professional development in an intense and high growth scale-up environment.
An open company culture where you have the independence and room to unleash your potential and contribute to our local Key Account Strategy.
A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together.
A competitive salary package.

Our values:

We fight together: food waste is a big beast to fight. We can do it if we fight together as Waste Warriors with no ego. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: we always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: we're proud of the change we're driving.
We care: we always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.

How to apply?

Do you want to be part of something huge and do you recognize yourself in the above description? We look forward to hearing from you. Deadline for application is March 21st. A video screening and case assessment will be part of our recruitment process.

We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above including our requirements. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go. We only accept applications coming through our platform: no resume or cover letter will be accepted by email or Linkedin direct messaging.

Too Good To Go is an equal opportunity employer.

Acquisition based on this vacancy is not appreciated.
A Movement for Everyone
We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it's only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we're allowed to be ourselves, and we're committed to a culture where all of us belong.
We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Picnic is de snelst groeiende online supermarkt van Nederland. Met onze app willen wij onze klanten iedere week helpen en inspireren bij het boodschappen doen. Daarom is onze app geen week hetzelfde: iedere week zijn er nieuwe acties, nieuwe producten en inspiratie die passen bij het moment van het jaar in de app. Lijkt het jou leuk om ervoor te zorgen dat acties, thema's en nieuwe producten elke dag opnieuw het beste onder de aandacht worden gebracht? Dan kunnen we jouw hulp goed gebruiken!

Wat ga je doen?

Onze app is iedere week anders. Er zijn verschillende onderdelen die wekelijks wisselen, zoals de actiepagina, de themapagina en de nieuwspagina. Daarnaast wordt er iedere week een email verstuurd aan al onze klanten. Al deze pagina's en informatie moet netjes en tijdig in het systeem worden ingevoerd zodat onze klanten altijd het juiste zien.

Elk onderdeel heeft een eigen dynamiek. De actiepagina moet klanten wekelijks interessante aanbiedingen bieden. De themapagina moet inspireren en verrassen op relevante momenten, zoals moederdag, BBQ en Kerst. De nieuwspagina laat klanten voortdurend mooie nieuwe producten zien en de Picnic e-mail zorgt dat klanten de highlights van de actiepagina, themapagina en ander nieuws wekelijks ontvangen.

Hiervoor doe jij de volgende dingen:

Productselectie en indeling per pagina
Configureren van ongeveer 100 promoties op weekbasis
Configureren van themapagina en nieuwspagina
Classificeren van type promoties voor reporting
Inzichten halen uit tools en dashboards om in te grijpen op unavailability en waste
Schakelen met een groeiend aantal leveranciers voorafgaand en tijdens de promoties
Schakelen met Inkoop om de afgesproken afspraken goed na te komen
Afstemmen klantcommunicatie rondom promoties en thema's
Aanspreekpunt voor meerdere teams (van logistiek tot category management tot inkoop)

Klopt er ergens iets niet? Dan zit je er bovenop en zorg je dat het meteen wordt aangepast! Elke verandering die jij doorvoert is namelijk direct zichtbaar voor onze klanten. Je ziet dus direct de impact van je werk, hoe gaaf is dat?!

Wie ben jij?
Enthousiast: je bent positief ingesteld en barst van de energie
Organisator: je kunt goed ordenen en voelt je verantwoordelijk voor je werk
Leergierig: je bent handig met computers en hebt een systeem snel onder de knie
Nauwkeurig: je werkt netjes en hebt oog voor de kleinste details
Commercieel: je begrijpt wat klanten willen, hoe je hen kunt helpen en inspireren bij het doen van online boodschappen.
Teamspeler: je vindt het leuk om zelfstandig te werken, maar je kunt ook goed samenwerken met collega's.
Communicatief sterk: je kunt makkelijk schakelen met verschillende mensen, van leverancier tot collega die niet altijd hetzelfde belang hebben als jij
Flexibel en hands-on: als zich problemen voordoen, schiet jij niet in de stress, je pakt het direct op om te zoeken naar een oplossing

Wat heb je nodig?
Je hebt minimaal een HBO-diploma
Je hebt affiniteit met de supermarktwereld, vindt het leuk om te volgen wat er in de markt gebeurt
Je hebt een neus voor commercie, jij snapt klanten en kan hierop inspelen
Je bent administratief sterk
Je spreekt en schrijft foutloos Nederlands
Je bent fulltime beschikbaar

Wat bieden wij?

Een fijne baan in één van de leukste teams van Picnic, al zeggen we het zelf ;) Je gaat werken op het hoofdkantoor in Amsterdam en komt terecht in een jonge en ambitieuze groep mensen. We werken hard, maar vinden het ook belangrijk om samen leuke dingen te doen. Dagelijks is er een heerlijke lunch en elke vrijdag (buiten corona tijden) sluiten we de week af met een gezellige borrel. Maar belangrijker nog: samen zetten we de supermarktwereld op z'n kop!

Job Title: SaaS Account Executive - Nordic and Benelux
Job Description:
Accelerate your sales career with the best in the industry!


Every day, we help companies to make the world a better place. One of North America’s fastest-growing technology companies, our software empowers better corporate decision making. We do this by providing a window into an organization’s global supply chain and the factories in which their products are manufactured, to reduce compliance risks, environmental waste, and prevent human rights abuse.
As we continue to expand our European operations, we are looking to grow our team of high-performing Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) Account Executives. Our ideal candidates bring significant experience in developing relationships with senior executives and have a proven track record of success selling in a B2B, SaaS environment. We are specifically looking for individuals who are driven to succeed and thrive on the challenge that comes with taking a new product to market.


What you will do:

Prospect and sell to new logos
Establish and develop an account-based sales strategy to achieve sales quotas
Follow a systematic sales process to progress prospect sales campaigns
Win new customers through self-sourcing activities, research, responding to leads, and building exceptional internal and external relationships
Manage a complex sales-cycle to prospective senior executives and/or multiple constituencies within an organization (Manufacturing Operations, Demand Management, Finance, IT)
Partner with Business Development to grow and optimize your pipeline
Manage all sales activity and forecasting of revenue in Salesforce


Join us if you:

Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator with excellent written and verbal skills in English. Additional language capability would be viewed favourably
Have at least 5 years of progressive B2B SaaS sales experience
Have masterfully led SaaS sales cycles from end-to-end
Have demonstrable experience meeting and exceeding sales quotas up to $1M
Are skillful in penetrating accounts, developing relationships, and selling to executive-level decision-makers
Are able to identify existing and emerging client needs, and to articulate the corresponding benefits of Assent’s offerings
Are a tenacious, highly motivated, and persistent sales hunter
Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator and presenter
Have excellent questioning techniques, active listening skills, and analytical capabilities
Are highly capable and self-sufficient in the development and delivery of all sales cycle artifacts including presentations, proposals
Are energized by working in a start-up-like sales environment
Have experience working with CRM tools
Have a combination of education and experience that demonstrates the above


What’s in it for you?

At Assent, your contributions will be valued and have a bigger purpose - you will help make a real difference to our clients. Our team challenges each other to be better every day and we dig deep to build a culture of innovation and high-performance.
In addition to a competitive salary, you can expect to:

Love what you do as part of a fantastic culture and supportive team that really wants you to succeed
Accelerate greatness in a challenging position with high learning and development potential
Choose how you work best with a flexible work arrangement
Spend your days making a difference, not just working for a living. We help our customers all over the world by providing a real understanding of their supply chain data so they can protect their brands, remove market access barriers, and reduce operational and financial risk


All applicants will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check.
Reasonable Accommodations Statement: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the aforementioned duties and responsibilities satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.

Are you looking for a hands-on internship focused on CSR practices? Want to grow your experience in a fast-growing global business? Then we're looking for you!
Our story (the bitesize version)
We've grown from a small attic company to become a global food delivery business. As Just Eat Takeaway.com, we're active in 24 countries across 5 continents, taking millions of orders every day.
But what drives us isn't food, it's people. From sales to sustainability and apps to analytics, our talented teams ensure we lead the way in a competitive, fast-paced industry.
All about the role
As our Intern: CSR/Sustainability, you support the manager for Corporate Social Responsibility on daily tasks and long-term projects. That includes anything from business admin to overseeing local initiatives and helping implement CSR components across the company.
Communication is a key ingredient in this position. Whether you're undertaking research alongside colleagues from our international offices or supporting relevant business cases and proposals, you're a key contact point for colleagues across the organization.
In this hands-on internship, you'll also have the opportunity to:
Get an in-depth understanding of sustainability topics inside and outside the organization
Develop your own initiatives and own them from start-to-end
Research of internal and external data and regulations
Be responsible for the CSR inbox: distributing information to responsible stakeholders
Be the contact for internal comms and support in the creation of internal CSR updates
Manage external stakeholders such as charity partners and agencies
Support on sustainability proposals and projects: business cases, slide deck creation, internal comms & stakeholder briefings
Be part of a larger sustainability project
Can you deliver…
Want to take on this exciting CSR internship? Here's what we need from you:
A University Degree (completed or ongoing), preferably in Business Administration, Sustainability, Marketing or another relevant field
Working experience in sustainability is an advantage: e.g. emissions, packaging, or food waste
Preferably some experience in one of our core countries: Germany, Netherlands, United Kingdom
Passionate about CSR and looking to boost your knowledge
Fluent English (written & spoken). An additional language is a plus
Strong communication skills
Well-organized, team player and an enthusiastic outlook
Able to create internal & external reports based on research
Hands-on mentality and a flexible skillset, from analytical to business-related topics
Available full-time for a period of 6 months
Here is our offer
Like the best food pairings, your skills and our great rewards belong together:
Competitive compensation of €650 per month
A varied, hands-on internship in a fast-growing global business with a strong position in major markets
Opportunities for personal and professional growth as part of a new department
A dynamic, friendly workplace in the heart of Amsterdam (close to Central Station!)
Office perks: Delicious tea & coffee, ping pong, our famous Friday drinks…and more!
Contribution to travel expenses (After Covid-19)
Ready to take on this exciting internship? Click Apply Now and send us your CV!

eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with ten brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.About the business:Classifieds is shaping the future of local commerce by bringing people together through an enriched online experience that allows them to reach out to the community around them. We are comprised of more than 1,000 people who are passionate for local trade and maintaining the customer-centric nature of the Group, while exploring growth opportunities in both the countries where eCG already has a presence and in prospective markets.About the team:The Central Analytics team is responsible for Global Analytics and building Analytics capabilities across all Business Units."We make decisions based on data, by providing high-value data, deep insights, and addictive tools."About the role:We are looking for a gifted analytics professional to join our Central Commercial & Advertising Analytics team. Join us!Your main focus will be to contribute to the development of our Advertising platforms and tools from an Analytics data-driven perspective, working in close contact with both our Advertising Center of Excellence, and our Product & Technology team.As a member of the global analytics team, you will be proficient with data tools and sources, thrive on solving highly analytical problems, and turn data into impactful insights. This global role comes with the challenge of understanding and contributing to many facets of the business, including advertising operations, product, finance and data management.You are data and analytically intensive!
