The opportunity where you will make an impact:

As our CRM Coordinator you will be part of the CRM team and support the execution of the Body&Fit and Optimum Nutrition CRM / E-mail strategy. You will, together with other channel leads, including our CRM manager and our Head of Performance, drive incremental growth in existing markets as well as roll-out and ramp-up in new markets.

Full-time · Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Analyse customer data and campaigns in order to enrich Body&Fit’s understanding of its client base as well as to initiate new data-driven marketing campaigns;

Utilize customer behavioural, demographic, lifestyle and transactional data to deliver custom marketing messages with the aim of increasing CLV;
Optimize the segmentation & personalization strategy of the E-mail marketing team;
Support on implementation of targeted, timely customer retention programs that will increase loyalty, retention and encourage segment;
Brief, create and deliver email marketing campaigns in sync with the trade calendar for all markets
Taking concepts, stories and content from the creative team and making data driven decisions
Agile test email send-outs and incrementally improve performance
Create daily, weekly, monthly & quarterly reporting stack to ensure both operational excellence as well as optimal channel visibility within the business
Support the E-mail marketing manager is meeting the set targets
Deliver channel incremental growth, while positively impacting CLV, retention and engagement metrics

What you will bring to Body & Fit

2-3 years experience in CRM and an e-commerce environment;
Experience with Clang, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Adobe or other similar products
Experience in data infrastructure (AMZ) & visualization (PowerBI/Tableau-etc.) knowledge would be advantageous
Tech savvy with A/B testing, personalization and segmentation experience in a B2C e-commerce setting
Familiarity with the technical flow involved in CRM campaigns execution
Proficiency with Google Analytics, Excel and number crunching
Strong experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams to achieve business outcomes
Great team-player, a hands-on mentality and a sense of fun.

What we would like to offer you:

The opportunity to shape your career in our global organisation that is championing the healthy lifestyle movement!

Create your own nutrition formula with a discount on our products!

Are we the right fit for you?

Life is way too short to waste anyone’s time so there are a few things that we would like to be upfront about:

Politics, intrigue, gossip. We’re just way too busy for all that stuff!
Slow moving, corporate environment. We move pretty quickly here so we don’t have room for passengers.
Hiding in the background. If we’re to grow together we want you to step up and tell us how to do it. We need your voice!


Please note: To be eligible for this position you need to have a valid working visa / permit to work in the Netherlands.

bloomon is turning the flower industry on its head – for the better. How? By disrupting the traditional supply chain, where most florists operate offline and have done for decades. bloomon creates seasonal collections using unusual stems to deliver unique flower arrangements on repeat or as a unique gift. We always use field-fresh high-quality flowers straight from the grower and deliver to our customers through a high-tech and highly creative platform. Our e-commerce company launched in Amsterdam in 2014 and went from start-up to scale-up at hypersonic speed. We are already active in five countries: the Netherlands, Germany, Belgium, UK, and Denmark. Next step? To conquer Europe… and then the world. Our goal? To become the first global flower brand in the lifestyle segment, filling hearts and homes with happiness. One bouquet at a time.
Supply & Demand Planning at bloomon
bloomon has grown to its current size with a business model based around subscription customers - this means that we have been able to buy our flowers and produce our bouquets according to the direct order schedule of our customers, and did not have to do a lot of forecasting. Now, we are well underway expanding our on-demand offering, for which customer buying behaviour is much more volatile and harder to predict. And this is where our demand planning comes in.
The challenge? Perfectly forecasting the quantities of flowers needed to meet demand, but not have any waste. As you understand it is impossible to keep things on stock with our super fresh product… To do this we are looking for a talented demand planner to lead the development of our new and dynamic demand planning processes. To excel in this role you need a strong analytical mindset, great Excel skills, be driven by achieving clear tangible results and have proven communication expertise. If this sounds like you, keep on reading!
What will you do?
As demand planner, you will be part of the operations team, but you will collaborate as closely with the commercial team. You will hold a central position in which you will combine input from all relevant stakeholders to make informed decisions on the forecast. By gathering and analyzing data, challenging commercial assumptions and stretching supply chain capabilities you are striving to have an optimal result: maximum sales and minimum waste. The impact of your work is very significant: based on your forecast we make our buying decisions, with huge financial consequences. You will work on forecasting up to 6 months in advance, but also optimize for products that are on sale today and tomorrow to maximize results.


Your main responsibilities include:
Create, maintain and optimize the rolling demand forecast (1-200 days in advance) for our fresh and dry products (currently 10-20 SKU’s)
Determine forecast quantities per design/country/delivery day/color based on sales statistics, supply chain capacity, marketing and sales feedback
Incorporating inputs such as marketing campaigns, special commercial moments, seasonality and holiday changes into the forecast
Managing the meeting and process framework to ensure forecasts are constructively challenged to drive consensus and accuracy
Create and optimize KPI dashboard on forecast accuracy, waste and product availability, and strive to outperform these KPI’s
Coordinate supply chain planning around holidays and special commercial moments (Valentines, Easter, Mothers Day, Christmas, etc.)
Provide updated forecasts to meet the business-wide planning deadlines.
Further enhance bloomons’ business capabilities on forecasting and demand planning
Live gatekeeping of stock levels of all our products, across all countries and all delivery days, ensuring that where possible we are never sold out - in close collaboration with the junior demand planner
Requirements
Masters degree in business or related field
3-5 years experience in a supply chain environment and working with demand planning and forecasting
Highly advanced analytical skills and strong MS Excel/Google sheets knowledge
Great communication skills and experience in stakeholder management
Entrepreneurial and proactive mindset, ability to work on own initiative
You perform well under pressure
Commercial attitude: you want to win
You are fluent in English
Why bloomon?
Becoming part of bloomon means becoming a trendsetter. We make sure that we not only spread happiness amongst our customers, but also to our employees. We believe that different minds can create uniqueness. Our international team of highly talented people has different interests and hobbies and we support them all.

Current additional bloomon benefits:
Working in a young, flexible and entrepreneurial environmentHappiness days (4 extra days off per year for your personal “me-time”)Electrical Van Moof lease bike at your disposalAnd of course lots of beautiful fresh flowers!
Benefits when life goes back to normal:
Daily fresh and healthy lunch prepared by our lovely lunch chefA BBQ-worthy rooftop terraceFriday drinks and social events
We all love what we do – so if you like challenges, developing new skills, growing creatively and taking initiative, you’ll feel right at home as part of the bloomon family.

Excellent planning and organizational skills

Budget ownership

Team player, able to liaise and collaborate with different departments (IT, sales, merchandising, online, communications)

Hunkemöller strives to be a much loved, social & inclusive brand. A place where people love to work, are proud of the brand, and where we create true brand ambassadors. COMPANY DESCRIPTIONShoplogix is a fast-growing and highly innovative organization focused on delivering smart, could-based, software solutions that improve production performance for manufacturers worldwide. We have customers in 32 countries and direct representation in 11 countries. Shoplogix is an autonomous company under Constellation Software, the largest software group and the most successful technology stock in Canada over the last 10 years [TSX: CSU]. Shoplogix is in a unique position as it has the long-term and full backing of Constellation Software including access to their best practices and career opportunities. At the same time, Shoplogix has a highly entrepreneurial and dynamic culture given it operates as a fully autonomous company.PRODUCT DESCRIPTIONShoplogix is an advanced IIoT software platform that increases efficiency, boosts productivity and improves performance in manufacturing. We offer an innovative web-based solution that transforms the way we see, analyze and interpret data to drive machine and process efficiency on the plant-floor. Our cloud-based performance management solution delivers real-time visual tracking and analysis of production and automatically highlights the opportunity cost of downtime in a highly visual and intuitive reporting interface. Shoplogix integrates data visualization with powerful analytics to expose hidden losses, eliminate waste and accelerate continuous improvement and operational excellence.JOB SUMMARYWe are looking to hire a Customer Success Specialist to provide customer support for our suite of hardware and software products. We are looking for the best people: self-motivated and driven professionals with very high ethical standards. You will be responsible for ensuring customer satisfaction by means of quick response to maintenance support requests, general help desk type requests and being very proactive with our quickly evolving product offering. You will be accountable for ensuring that existing customers continue to gain business value from our solution and maximize adoption. Fluency in French is a requirement. Best fits for this role tend to come from Engineering, Operations and Consulting backgrounds. If the candidate has a programming background,Your role will grow as you gain experience - in time, you could become involved with Customer Advocacy, Pre and Post-Sales Support, Customer and Partner Training and Field Services.What you'll be doing: Help Desk:  Manage customer support cases on a day-to-day basis, including monitoring of the incoming queue, answering the support phone line, and escalate cases appropriately and in a timely manner.Support:  Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues, including account setup and configuration. Determine the cause and solutions or workarounds to an issue. You will need to work with senior team members while learning how to effectively diagnose issues, but should become very self-sufficient, eventually providing ideas and feedback as to how we can enhance our product to avoid these issues in the future.Adoption:  Present and discuss new features with the customer, perform the changes, then review and validate with the customer.Communication : Communicate with Customers about software features, provide training and assist with implementation.Process Improvement:  Help build our Knowledge Base and engage in continuous improvement by creating written materials which can be shared amongst the team as well as with our partner community and customers.Advocacy:  Engage and support Continuous Improvement initiatives by assisting customers with improvement insightsWe are looking for candidates with: Technical Diploma or Certification in Engineering, Computer ScienceExcellent problem solving and communication skills. Fluency in French is a requirementAbility to self-manage and be proactive when your tasks are complete.Knowledge of Electrical Wiring, PLC programming are advantages.Experience working in manufacturing environments and good understanding of manufacturing practices and Operational Excellence are valuedExperience working directly with customersGood organization and time management skills an absolute must.Customer Service experience and experience working with cross functional teamsAbility to apply theoretical concepts to practical applications and installations.WHY SHOPLOGIX? Entrepreneurial and fast-growing software company, both through organic growth and acquisitionsAccess to best practices and growth opportunities through our owner Constellation SoftwareCompetitive compensation, flex hours and a comprehensive benefits packageWe take great pride in our first-class team and family like culture. “Open-door” communicationThe premium and most progressive product on the marketThis is a full-time and permanent position.Job Types: Full-time, Contract, PermanentLanguage:English and French, any other European language is a Plus (Required)Work Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Kom bij Schneider Electric werken voor de volgende stap in jouw carriere
Ontdek de mogelijkheden om te werken voor een internationaal, dynamische en verantwoordelijke onder-neming dat de ontwikkeling van hun medewerkers wereldwijd continue bevordert. Iedere dag streven wij er naar dat onze medewerkers aan hun persoonlijke doelen werken en op deze manier hun carrière kunnen vormgeven. Wij zijn dan ook trots benoemd te zijn door Linkedin als top 25 ‘werkgever van keuze’. Ontdek hoe onze waarde en unieke positie jou laat kiezen voor Schneider Electric als (toekomstige) werkgever!

We zijn op zoek naar een Business Development Leader (v/m) voor het segment Water & Waste Water (WWW) opererend vanuit ons kantoor in Hoofddorp die gemotiveerd is om bij te dragen aan de groei van Schneider Electric. In deze functie ga je rapporteren aan de VP Strategic Segments.
Van de Business Development Leader wordt verwacht dat je als zelfstandige werkt en in teamverband doelen en doelstellingen realiseert. Je wordt ondersteund door de technische expertise van de organisatie.

Je gaat zowel op strategisch als tactisch niveau (werkvloer tot C-level) acteren en als leader deelnemen aan het ontwerpen van complexe voorstellen met een concrete waardepropositie om zo de WWW business te laten groeien.

Je voelt je thuis in een uitdagende en divers ingestelde werkomgeving met een no-nonsense mentaliteit en een klantgerichte focus.

Jouw verantwoordelijkheden
I.s.m. met het WWW team het opstellen en uitvoeren van het Industriële Automatisering businessplan en het bereiken van de verkoopdoelstelling.
Focus vanuit Industriële Automatisering op basis van onze EcoStruxure™ waarde propositie.
Het voorbereiden en leiden van contractonderhandelingen en afsluiten van orders in het industrie- segment WWW. Gebruikmakend van competitieve verkoopstrategie en uitvoeren van uitmuntende verkooptactieken.
Nauw samenwerken met de Schneider Electric Channel Manager om de betrokkenheid van onze partners op één lijn te brengen.
Nauw samenwerken met Industrie Marketeers om de Schneider Electric EcoStruxure™ WWW value propositie te verkondigen in de Nederlandse markt.
Nauw samenwerken met de verschillende Business Units van Schneider Electric vanuit een account- en projectstrategie.
Wat te verwachten @ Schneider Electric?
Je maakt deel uit van een vooraanstaande, wereldwijde speler die op een actieve manier meewerkt aan duurzaamheid en zorg voor de planeet.
Eindeloze ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden door het online learningaanbod van 10.000+ e-learnings over verschillende domeinen.
Een organisatie die zich hard maakt dat haar medewerkers worden gezien als de ‘beste erkende professionals’ van onze industrie.
Aandacht voor Wellbeing via trainingen en een Well-being Week.
De mogelijkheid om te zorgen voor een goede balans tussen werk en prive (bekijk onze global family leave Youtube video voor meer informatie).
Diversiteit staat bij ons hoog in het vaandel. Als organisatie voelen wij ons dan ook vereert om in 2018 zowel in de lijst van ‘Bloomberg Gender-Equality’ te zijn opgenomen en tevens de eerste plaats te hebben gehaald binnen de industriele sector van ‘Equileap Top 200 Gender Equality’.
Belangrijke vaardigheden in deze rol
Je bent een teamspeler en haalt het beste in mensen naar boven. Met zakelijk inzicht ben je in staat om georganiseerd en gedisciplineerd te werk te gaan. Tijdens je dagelijkse werkzaamheden hou je rekening met culturele gevoeligheid en blink je uit in presentatie vaardigheden. Luisteren is iets wat je constant kan en doet en interpersoonlijk ben je uitgekookt

Qualifications
De kwaliteiten en eigenschappen van de ideale kandidaat voor Business Development Leader
Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding in de richting van watermanagement met een zeer sterke affiniteit voor proces automatisering.
Ervaring in het sluiten van complexe oplossingsgedreven deals en begrijpen hoe stakeholder management werkt.
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden: van de shop-floor naar de top-floor.
Minimaal 5-10 jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare rol.
Je bent in staat om te werken in een sterk veranderlijke omgeving.
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift. Frans is een pre.
Customer First zit in je DNA en al je werkzaamheden zijn hierop gericht.
Ondernemerschap en het nemen van ownership is waar je in uitblinkt.
Competitie is waar je van houdt en verliezen is nooit een optie voor je.
Over Schneider Electric
Als specialist in digitale energiemanagement- en automatiseringsoplossingen staan efficiëntie en duurzaamheid voor ons centraal. Voor woningen, gebouwen, datacenters, infrastructuur en industrieën bieden wij toonaangevende technologieën, software en lifecycle services. Met ons open platform en geïntegreerde oplossingen helpen wij klanten bij het maximaliseren van beschikbaarheid, het versnellen van processen en het realiseren van energiebesparing.
De vraag naar energie zal naar verwachting in 2040 zijn verdubbeld. Bij Schneider Electric vinden we dat iedereen op de wereld recht heeft op toegang tot veilige en duurzame energie. Daarom zetten wij ons in voor energie-efficiëntie en duurzaamheid. Wij streven naar een innovatieve maatschappij en zijn betrokken, gepassioneerd en vastbesloten om onze ambities waar te maken. Dat noemen we ‘Life is On’.
Meer weten over Schneider Electric ?
Geïnteresseerd?
Graag ontvangen wij jouw cv en korte motivatie. Voor meer informatie over de vacature kan je contact opnemen met Milou van den Hout, Recruitment & Talent Manager via het telefoonnummer +31 23 5124 124.
Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Job Title: Global Strategy & Ops Mgr, Trust & CX
Job Description: eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with ten brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.About the business:Classifieds is shaping the future of local commerce by bringing people together through an enriched online experience that allows them to reach out to the community around them. We are comprised of more than 1,000 people who are passionate for local trade and maintaining the customer-centric nature of the Group, while exploring growth opportunities in both the countries where eCG already has a presence and in prospective markets.Our team:Trust & Customer Experience is eCG Global operations team working across different platforms (Marktplaats, Gumtree, Kijiji and more) in 6+ countries. We’re responsible for Trust and Safety, Customer Support, and we’re the voice of the customer for the local and global teams. As Strategy & Operations Manager you’ll have a global impact and report to the Director of Trust & CX. The ideal candidate has experience in crafting strategic scenarios, executive communication and partner management, and is a self-starter who proactively identifies and solves problems, driven by data. This individual has a 'willing to take action' mentality and thrives and enjoys a fast-paced and cross-functional environmentJoin us!Responsibilities:Develop a deep understanding of Trust and Customer Experience Operations that can connect the dots between teams and countries to identify areas for improvement, efficiency, and collaboration.Help form Trust & CX Operations strategy and vision for the future.Drive goal setting and performance management, and run rhythm of the business reporting and monitoring of key performance metrics.Develop executive-level communications and presentations for eCG’s leadership.Strengthen the Trust & CX community and build a better communications strategy.Explore new ways to measure and communicate the impact of trust & customer service contacts on businessSupport forecasting and budget process and cost optimizationOwn or support ad-hoc strategic projects, requests and/or analysis, as needed.Drive key leadership meetings and facilitate alignment on key issues and opportunities; follow up on action items and progress.Preferred qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Economics, Business, Finance, or other quantitative fields; MBA is preferredExperience leading strategy, operations and process improvement projects at a leading management consulting firm or in a relevant strategy/operations team.Experience in communicating with and making pitches to senior leadersExperience leading strategic projects and strategic analyticsProven partner management and influencing skills in a cross-functional environmentSophisticated analytical skillsExperience with Consumer Products, Trust & Safety, Community Operations, Customer Service area is a plus!Benefits:Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs.We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about our Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/Covid-19People are the heart of the eBay Classifieds business, and their health and well-being are our first priority.We continue to monitor local government guidance and partner closely with medical advisors to determine the safest and best next steps for everyone. As a result, most teams are working remotely, with a few teams able to collaborate in person with enhanced safety procedures. We will discuss the particular case for your region during the interview process. As a general rule, interviews will be completed remotely over video calls.eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.

Hunkemöller is a much loved social and inclusive brand and this has been rewarded by being voted by our Shero's as No 1 lingerie brand in Germany, the Netherlands, Belgium, France and Spain. Our vision is to make Hunkemöller the first choice for women in Europe with our whole focus being on designing our vision and strategy around our Shero. Building a brand that is truly social is a key part of our current and future strategy. We fully embrace social media when engaging with our Shero, our Marketing team is here the key driver.
As Social Media & Community Specialist you will support the team with the following:
Social Media:
Work closely with the Sr Social Media Coordinator on the strategic planning of social media marketing campaigns and in managing the execution of social media strategies, and campaigns
Work with PR, creative, and social team to create high quality, engaging, relevant, and timely content
Co-manage the social media editorial calendar and ensure the content is published by the stipulated deadlines
Contribute to foster and strengthen new relationships with key influencers within the community
Keep up with the latest trends on social media emerging social media platforms in the industry and within the influencer community
Increase brand awareness and audience engagement across a range of social platforms, and be able to report on the effectiveness of your activity
Analyze and provide feedback to optimize social media content (on a global level) for some of the key channels, including Instagram, Facebook, YouTube, Pinterest, Tiktok & Snapchat
Deliver insights and advice on social content strategy: for both organic and paid social channels; in alignment with content teams.
Grow and expand Hunkemoller social media presence. increase presence on existing platforms including but not limited to Facebook, TikTok, Twitter, and Instagram
Community:
Manage and develop Hunkemoller's online community. Act as the brand's spokesman and communicate with end-users within the community
Build the Hunkemoller's online presence and foster stronger relationships between the brand and the public
Be the point of contact within the social media community and strive to engage and provide support to members of the community for the company's social media platforms such as Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, Instagram, forum and blog
Communicate, provide support and interact with community members and customers in a professional, personable, and timely manner to grow and keep the community alive
Monitor trends and topics mentioned by the community and anticipate potential problems that may negatively affect brand reputation.
Generate comprehensive reports on overall community sentiment and notable trends and provide meaningful feedback
Deploy social listening tools to monitor positive/negative comments and topic trends, and strive to boost engagement and resolve any potential conflicts that may affect brand reputation
Monitor the social channels through Meltwater and other tools and work closely with customer service to effectively manage community engagement
Analyze the performance of social activations and hashtags, coming back to the objectives and identify successes and areas for improvement
Ensure social media KPI's are met each financial period
Come up with new creative (A/B) test options throughout the channels; and follow up on learnings.
Collaborate closely with our creative, PR, buying and merchandising teams for rapid and seamless execution
Our ideal candidate possesses the following skills:
Good knowledge about the social media landscape (especially Facebook and Instagram; others are a pre) and expertise in managing social media platforms
Ability to analyze and advice on creative content ideas
Familiarity with online marketing strategies and channels
Experience with social listening and community management tools
Experience with social advertising, paid social knowledge is beneficial, but not essential.
Ability to grasp future trends in digital technologies and act proactively
Excellent communication, writing and language skills; fluent English & Dutch (other languages are pre)
Multitasking, able to handle stress and has analytical skills (experience with Google Analytics is a pre)
Commercially and creatively minded
A self-starter with respect for others' points of view: The ability to work well alone as well as with different departments across the business
Process driven and demonstrate an ability to deliver in a timely manor
Energetic, enthusiastic, proactive and driven
Finished a Bachelor, HBO or Masters degree in (online) marketing/communications
Gained at least 1—2 years of experience in a social marketing role
Hunkemöller strives to be a much loved, social & inclusive brand. A place where people love to work, are proud of the brand, and where we create true brand ambassadors. Working in a passionate, energetic, design-led and performance-driven environment where our key customer persona 'Shero' sits at the heart of everything we do. Hunkemöller is certified TOP EMPLOYER of the Netherlands 2021, which underlines our people initiatives and achievements.
Together Tomorrow – Join a Retailer that's on the move to be better for our planet, better for people, better together! From diversity & inclusion, reducing waste, to product care and how we work with our suppliers, our Together Tomorrow initiative reflects what we do and helps drive change across our business. Ready to help us achieving our ambitious goals? Where ever you'll start working with us, if in Stores or our HQs, you can contribute!
Apply now with your CV (in English) and include a link to your social media channels. In case you want to share some (growth) success stories of social media channels in a portfolio or your CV, most welcome.

Ben je op de hoogte van de ontwikkelingen en trends op het gebied van recycling, weet jij kansen te identificeren en strategisch te benutten en nieuwe orders binnen te halen dankzij je commerciële kracht? Lees dan onze vacature voor Business development manager.Wat doe je als Business development manager?In deze rol ben je een belangrijk onderdeel van ons Sales team. Aan jou de verantwoordelijkheid om de internationale markt op het gebied van recycling in kaart te brengen en de afzetmarkt van Bezner te vergroten. Als Business development manager weet je niet alleen de kansen in de markt te identificeren, maar ook hoe je deze op een strategische manier kunt benutten en ben je in staat nieuwe projecten binnen te halen.Het genereren van nieuwe leads, benaderen van internationale (potentiële) klanten en het uitbreiden van het klantenbestand van Bezner.Je bent een gesprekspartner die met de klant meedenkt en weet de juiste vragen te stellen om een helder beeld van de huidige situatie en gewenste situatie te krijgen.Samen met de rest van het Sales team, welke bestaat uit technische collega’s, weet je de klantwens te vertalen naar een passende oplossing in een uitgewerkt voorstel, waarin ook de commerciële voorwaarden staan beschreven.Jij weet klanten te overtuigen van onze kracht en kunt ze, dankzij je technische achtergrond, precies vertellen hoe onze machines en installaties kunnen bijdragen aan hun bedrijfsdoelstellingen.Met de zelf ontworpen klantspecifieke oplossing in een uitgewerkte offerte, weet je klanten over de streep te trekken en nieuwe orders te schrijven voor Bezner.Wanneer passen wij bij elkaar?HBO/ WO werk- en denkniveau.Je hebt een achtergrond in de mijnbouw, procestechnologie of als chemicus.Minimaal 10 jaar werkervaring in een commerciële functie binnen een technische omgeving in een soortgelijke branche.Je bent commercieel gedreven, representatief, sociaal en zelfstandig.Je denkt in mogelijkheden, ziet kansen en durft beslissingen te nemen.Het is voor jou geen enkel probleem om internationaal te reizen om (potentiële) klanten te bezoeken.Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in zowel woord als geschrift. Beheersing van de Duitse en/of Franse taal is een pré.Gelukkig, we hebben nog steeds je aandacht!De thuisbasis voor deze functie is Heerhugowaard. Wij bieden jou een uitdagende functie in een organisatie die volop in beweging is. Daarnaast bieden wij een marktconform arbeidsvoorwaarden pakket; een salaris in overeenstemming met de functie, ADV uren, pensioen, doorgroeimogelijkheden en de benodigde opleidingen.Werken bij BeznerBezner is onderdeel van Heilig Group. Wij ontwerpen, bouwen, installeren en onderhouden machines en installaties voor het verwerken, sorteren en scheiden van verschillende afvalstromen. Met Bezner zijn wij actief bij afvalsorteerbedrijven, waste-to-energy afvalverbranding en recycling. Veel installaties worden turn-key opgeleverd.Werken bij Bezner is werken in een internationale, dynamische en informele organisatie. Je werkt in een enthousiast team met mensen op wie je kunt rekenen. Mensen die graag hun kennis en passie voor techniek met je delen. Met al onze medewerkers werken we iedere dag hard aan de beste concepten, uitdagende projecten en duurzame oplossingen voor onze klanten. Geen dag is hetzelfde.Is dit jouw droombaan?Dan ontvangen wij graag een korte motivatie met cv t.a.v. Annique Grooff, Corporate Recruiter. Heb je eerst nog wat vragen, neem dan telefonisch contact op (072 5716688) of stuur ons een mailtje! We zien je reactie graag tegemoet!Acquisitie wordt niet op prijs gesteld, wij zoeken en vinden zelf onze nieuwe collega’s.Soort dienstverband: FulltimeWerkschema:ma-vr

Role Summary
Our Workplace Services Leads are instrumental in driving our vision of “Creating inspirational, sustainable workplace experiences for our people and communities”. They must be visible and influential leaders of talented individuals and teams accountable for delivery of outstanding facilities and services. Their role is to design, communicate and deliver integrated, innovative and differentiated workplace solutions for our client. They have accountability for all strategic and operational activity including, but not limited to EH&S, client and customer interaction, work place modernisation and standardisation as well as managing the site-based teams for properties in their areas of responsibility.

The Workplace Services Manager for Project Apollo will be accountable for the delivery of the real estate portfolio across all service lines on the account, including Transaction Management, Portfolio planning and strategy, Project Management and Facilities Management

Overall Role & Major Responsibilities
Core Competencies
Build on the existing safety culture driving risk reduction, demonstrate a culture of care and be incident free

Drive the JLL HSSE program of “One Team – Safer Together”

Continuously deliver a reliable and compliant workplace, ensuring it is fit for purpose for local business requirements

Work with the EMEA Account Lead, Client and Key Stakeholders in defining workplace strategies to support the concepts of Hub, Club, Home and Roam

Rollout key initiatives including but not limited to systems and data utilisation.

Work with the EMEA Account Director and Finance Director to develop and manage budgets in conjunction with the site leads

Be a change champion in reducing the carbon footprint through energy efficiency and the adoption of renewable energies to achieve a target of net zero by 2030

Build, drive and report on initiatives to reduce waste, water and resources

Motivate our teams to deliver a workplace which inspires talent to succeed and nurtures their health and wellbeing

Manage Site Managers/Subject Matter Experts (SME) work streams to support the delivery teams across the region

Ensure consistent reporting and coordination regionally

Using data to drive strategic decisions

Support the EMEA Account Director to drive and achieve goals and objectives including P&L, risk, energy targets and the account SLAs & KPIs

Manage the sub-regional FM delivery ensuring standards are maintained and be a contact point for any FM account related issues, provide training, and support in issue resolution

Build and maintain client relationships
Work with local clients to develop, cascade, deliver and report shared goals and objectives and ensure these are cascaded at all levels

Develop strong relationships with clients, key stakeholders, customers including setting up regular customer forums to promote 360 feedback

Utilise the data suite to analyse and report opportunities for service enhancement and support the client in cost v quality making decisions

Ensure close contact is established with client organizations to remain abreast of current strategy, thinking, policies and procedures

In collaboration with the EMEA Account Lead embed a strong governance framework including presenting at– Annual, Quarterly & monthly governance meetings and ensure direct reports do the same for their areas of responsibility

Develop and Lead a high performing team
Work with regional Human Resources lead on recruitment and selection strategies ensuring roles are filled with top talent

Build a high performing diverse and inclusive workforce

Work with regional Human Resources to develop regional training and skills development programs, ensuring all staff have the right qualifications and training for their roles

Ensure succession plans are in place for key roles

Achieve financial results
Working with their direct reports drive the enhancement of local budget ownership and control by reducing cost without impact to quality

Working with the EMEA Account Lead compile and deliver monthly financial updates demonstrating control and knowledge

In conjunction with EMEA Account Lead, support the preparation of accurate budgets and forecasts

Work with the EMEA Account Lead to develop the annual client plans including driving Risk and opportunities

Deliver the contract commitments
Increase regional integration and collaboration through the vested culture to drive innovation.

Reduce the carbon footprint through energy efficiency and the adoption of renewable energies to achieve a target of net zero by 2030 or sooner.

Ensure account delivers against contract deliverables – meeting all KPI’s, budget targets and project commitments for all service lines.

Manage the change control process for own areas of responsibility

Ensure the delivery of engineering and maintenance services.

Drive the client’s workplace improvement strategies

Compliance and risk management delivery
Build on the existing safety culture to drive risk reduction, demonstrate a culture of care and be incident free.

Ensure all defined services are completed in accordance with quality operating procedures and statutory requirements.

Ensure compliance with company policies – guidelines and values, local laws and the guidelines of client’s organisation.

Too Good To Go is verkozen tot meest inspirerende bedrijf van 2020 in Nederland. We zijn een gecertificeerde B Corporation, groeien snel en zijn momenteel actief in 15 landen om de strijd tegen voedselverspilling aan te gaan. Onze missie is helder: iedereen inspireren en in staat stellen om actie te ondernemen tegen voedselverspilling. Dus we doen er alles aan om educatieve tools te creëren, onze kennis zo toegankelijk mogelijk te maken, nieuwe zakelijke oplossingen te vinden en zelfs de wetgeving te veranderen om voedselverspilling te verminderen. Via een van die oplossingen, onze app, hebben we inmiddels wereldwijd meer dan 60 miljoen maaltijden van de prullenbak gered - en dat is nog maar het begin!

We zijn trots op wat we tot nu toe hebben bereikt, maar hebben we al gezegd dat het probleem enorm is? Daarom zijn wij op zoek naar een Sales Leader die onze groei in Nederland helpt te versnellen door met een team van Business Developers nog meer partners en ondernemers te overtuigen om via onze app hun overgebleven eten aan te bieden.

Jouw missie

We zijn op zoek naar een ervaren, enthousiaste en resultaatgerichte Sales Manager met een passie voor het aanpakken van voedselverspilling. Iemand die energie krijgt van het door het dak laten groeien van nieuwe partners op onze platform. Direct rapporterend aan onze Head of Sales, word je lid van het NL Sales-team (20+ FTE volledig team met ook een Key Account Team) om onze ambitieuze missie verder te brengen. Daarnaast word je onderdeel van onze Waste Warriors-tribe van 850 medewerkers over de hele wereld, die samen voedselverspilling bestrijden.

Jouw rol

In deze rol geef je leiding aan een groeiend team van 10+ Sales Specialisten (Business Developers). De meerderheid van het team is gefocust op outbound sales, de rest op inbound sales. Met je Sales-team ben je verantwoordelijk voor de groei van het aantal individuele winkels (geen ketens) die via onze app overgebleven eten aanbieden op ons steeds groter wordende platform (4000+ partners).

Wat ga je doen?

Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de aansturing, coaching, groei en resultaten van het Independent Sales-team. Targets liggen rond de 20 nieuwe winkels per maand per medewerker, samen met de Business Developers zoek je naar mogelijkheden om deze te behalen en te overtreffen.
Tijdens wekelijkse 1-op-1's met je team stuur je op motivatie en resultaat en zorg je ervoor dat je team optimaal kan presteren.
Je werkt nauw samen met de Head of Sales om de markt in kaart brengen en de Sales strategie verder door te ontwikkelen. Strategieën om zowel het Sales-team beter te laten presenteren als om ons marktaandeel in Nederland te vergroten.
Je denkt mee over inbound lead generation en bent hierin sparring partner voor het Marketing-team.
Je geeft trainingen om je team te ontwikkelen in bv. pitch, presenteren en telefonische communicatie. Je doet dit zowel op eigen initiatief als met formats vanuit ons hoofdkantoor die in alle landen worden uitgerold.
Je ondersteunt internationale sales projecten en pakt daar in Nederland een leidende rol in.
Je deelt best practices met alles Sales Leaders uit de 15 landen en koppelt dit terug in samenwerkingen en ideeën naar het hele NL Sales team en visa versa.
Je hebt in samenwerking met het People & Culture team een actieve rol in het aannemen en inwerken van nieuwe Business Developers voor je team, we hebben flinke groeiplannen dit jaar en zijn altijd op zoek naar nieuwe initiatieven om meer actieve partners op ons platform te krijgen (zoals bv. het opzetten van een studenten of Field Sales team).
Je organiseert maandelijkse sales meetings en en presenteert tijdens wekelijkse en maandelijkse team meetings de voortgang aan het hele NL team.

Wie ben jij?

Je hebt minimaal 5 jaar werkervaring in sales, waarvan 2-3 jaar in een leidinggevende rol.
Je hebt een commerciële achtergrond en mindset en haalt energie uit het behalen en overtreffen van (team)targets.
Je schakelt gemakkelijk tussen de operatie en strategie en haalt energie uit het behalen van resultaten samen met je team.
Je hebt ervaring met cold calling en inbound sales en weet hierdoor je team goed te motiveren en te ontwikkelen als lead by example leader.
Je hebt ervaring met het gebruik van een CRM / Sales-tool en begrijpt hoe je deze kunt gebruiken om de processen en daarmee de prestaties te verbeteren.
Je bent in staat om met data en dashboards te werken en kan hieruit conclusies trekken en inzichten halen om te zien waar je je team kunt bijsturen.
Je werkt gestructureerd en vind het fantastisch om meerdere projecten tegelijk te hebben.
Je bent verbaal sterk en bent een verbinder door zowel met Marketing als met Sales samen tot resultaten te komen, je weet je groeivisie over te brengen aan jouw team en de organisatie.
Je werkt graag in een snelgroeiende organisatie waarin alles continu ontwikkelt en verandert.
Je hebt een enorme drive om voedselverspilling tegen te gaan.
Je spreekt en schrijft vloeiend Nederlands en Engels.

Wat bieden wij jou?

De ultieme kans om je commerciële sales kwaliteiten in te zetten voor een BCorp met een sterke missie om de wereld te verbeteren door voedselverspilling aan te pakken.
De ervaring om onderdeel te zijn van een snelgroeiende internationale Food Tech scale-up, momenteel zijn we actief in 15 landen en we groeien nog steeds hard.
Veel ontwikkelmogelijkheden zoals het volgen van een Team Lead training met verschillende Sales Leaders uit onze 15 landen.
Een internationale organisatie waar je veel kunt leren en veel verantwoordelijkheid en zelfstandigheid krijgt als je deze pakt.
Een centraal en bruisend kantoor in het centrum van Amsterdam (met dakterras!) waar we hopelijk snel weer naartoe kunnen.
Je wordt onderdeel van een groot internationaal Sales-team met veel support, kennisdeling, interactieve sessies en ruimte voor innovatie.
Energieke en ambitieuze collega's met leuke borrels en teamuitjes, in deze tijden natuurlijk allemaal online maar niet minder gezellig.
Een marktconform salaris met een bonusregeling.

Onze waarden

We fight together: voedselverspilling is een groot iets om tegen te vechten. We gaan samen de strijd aan als Waste Warriors zonder ego. Wij geloven in het werken als #oneteam.
We raise the bar: we streven altijd naar meer. We werken slim, doorbreken barrières en versterken elkaar.
We keep it simple: onze ambities zijn groot, maar onze oplossingen zijn eenvoudig.
We build a legacy: we zijn trots op de beweging die we in gang zetten.
We care: we dragen zorg voor elkaar. Betrokkenheid komt terug in de manier waarop we te werk gaan. We doen wat juist is.

Hoe kun je solliciteren?

Ben je op zoek naar een uitdagende rol waarin je echt impact kan maken? Wil jij deel uitmaken van iets groots en herken je jezelf in bovenstaand profiel? Overtuig ons dan van jouw kwaliteiten door te solliciteren en wie weet kom jij ons binnenkort versterken als nieuwe Waste Warrior. Een video sollicitatie is onderdeel van ons recruitment proces.

Acquisition based on this vacancy is not appreciated.
A Movement for Everyone
We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it's only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we're allowed to be ourselves, and we're committed to a culture where all of us belong.

eBay Classifieds Group is an innovative leader in online classifieds with ten brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.Classifieds are shaping the future of local commerce by bringing people together through an enriched online experience that allows them to reach out to the community around them. We are comprised of more than 1,000 people who are passionate for local trade and maintaining the customer-centric nature of the Group, while exploring growth opportunities in both the countries where eBay Classifieds Group already has a presence and in prospective markets.About the teamWe believe that solving customer problems and delivering value to our business can be done at scale. As the Global Capabilities Team (CAPS) we offer our local brands a portfolio of capabilities along the end customer journey that speeds up time to market across the eBay Classifieds Group. Our global teams develop and innovate a broad variety of central solutions and services. We closely partner with our local peers on efficient integrations of our capabilities that create valuable experiences for our end customers and the business. We are a diverse and highly motivated team. Data is the voice of our customers and helps us to define the common goals we work towards as one team.Being part of CAPS, the First Party Advertising technology team (iCAS) is looking for a Senior Product Manager to strengthen the team. We are building an internally used advertising engine combined with seller tools, to deliver shopping listings to the multiple platforms we have within the eBay Classifieds Group. Some of our complexities is the high traffic and volume demand, high uptime, handling click-fraud and optimising the listings being shown.DescriptionAs CAPS Product Manager you are responsible for the product evolution of our iCAS services. You know how to discover and tackle our customers’ problems and you are able to articulate this vision concisely. You will inspire decision makers as well as your central development teams to deliver against the strategic goals you set.As you are an ambassador of the company strategy, local business needs and the end customer, you empower your teams by setting the right priorities.Building effective relationships with stakeholders in a global setup comes natural to you. In close partnership with local business and product peers you ideate, define, experiment and craft impactful value propositions. You ensure reliable feedback loops from end-users to improve existing services and solutions or drive innovation in your portfolio.Together with tech and delivery leads you:create transparency of the teams vision, strategy, roadmap and key deliverables and ensure a continuous delivery of value to our end customers and our business;share stories of successful value delivery across the eBay Classifieds Group;provide context and easy access to knowledge for local markets and thus reduce time to impact globally.What we’re looking for:5+ years Product Management experience (preferably in Classifieds business);You can play a leading role in the overall iCas proposition;You are able to drive a compelling product vision and strategy for a complex product;You’re an experienced stakeholder manager on a global scale;Strong analytical and critical thinking skills. OMRON Healthcare Europe is looking for a QA/RA Officer to join our strong European Quality Assurance & Regulatory Affairs department. We offer you the opportunity to be part of our important mission to help realize healthier and comfortable lives for people around the world.
We are looking for an energetic, intelligent and hardworking individual with high integrity and willingness to learn and grow in the medical devices QA/RA domain to join our team. Do you have strong administrative and communication skills and excellent knowledge of the Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)? Would you like to work in a multinational professional environment? Then this might be the job for you!
The QA/RA Officer (position is 0.4 FTE), based in Hoofddorp, The Netherlands, provides administrative support to the QA/RA team with several Quality and Regulatory Affairs tasks and processes which are key for the continuous compliance of the OHE Quality Management System (QMS) with all applicable medical devices standards and regulations. The QA/RA Officer ensures that all reporting schedules are met, and customer satisfaction is achieved. The position proactively coordinates and leads the maintenance of Quality Records, the preparation of Quality documents, such as SoP’s, works descriptions and Forms, as well as the maintenance of the training matrix.
Your Key Activities:
Coordinate the process of reporting of Product waste materials (e.g. packaging, electronic waste, batteries etc.) as required by the WEEE and other related international, European or National Directives.
Monitor, maintain and report quality metrics and key performance indicators related to the OMRON Healthcare QMS and prepare the quality trending reports on a monthly basis.
Assist the QA/RA team with daily work activities, when required, or backup, e.g. authoring and revising Standard Operating Procedures, Work Descriptions and other Quality Documents, maintaining records and the training matrix etc. Participate in post-market surveillance activities when required.
Work directly with cross-functional teams and the OMRON 3rd Party Subcontractors in creating new or revising existing Work Descriptions for Inspection and light assembly activities. Provide training on the work descriptions to the 3rd Party subcontractors and monitor the implementation of trained items.
Participate and provide support during internal and external quality audits.

Desired Skills and Experience
The ideal candidate would have:
Bachelor’s degree
At least 2 years of experience in the QA/RA domain or general business experience
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)
Analytical individual with strong Excel skills
Proficient in the English language, both written and verbal (knowledge of other European languages is also welcome)
Good (interpersonal) communication skills
Basic knowledge of Quality Management systems under ISO 13485 is an advantage
Basic knowledge of the Medical Device Directive 93/42/EEC and the new Medical Device Regulation 2017/745 and other Medical device related international standards and regulations is an advantage
Risk management (ISO 14971) knowledge is an advantage

Job Title: Technical Program Manager - Accommodations - Data Platform
Job Description:
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more. Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission. We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.

With over 1.6 million room nights booked every day, accommodation represents the largest share of our business to date. We are responsible for accommodation growth, with clear ownership of all marketing, product and supply related to accommodations. Our mission is to deliver the best customer experience and most varied selection of properties.

The Data Platform team contributes to our Tech Modernization efforts in Accommodations, by developing a set of services to manage the property description datasets. We are seeking a sharp, talented and energetic Technical Program Manager to help build out a set of data services that manage the property description datasets and drive the adoption of the services across the business.

Our ideal candidate will have a strong TPM background, with demonstrated experience leading large cross-organizational software development projects, and will have a deep technical background in product development and service oriented architecture.

.

B.responsible

Be the driving force that collaborates with business and technical teams across Booking to make sure your teams deliver world class solutions that are highly scalable, secure, and flexible - all the while maintaining a strong customer focus.

Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints

As a Master Planner at Argent Energy you work in an industrial B2B environment and you are part of an international Supply Chain team. The main purpose of the role is:

Anticipate, monitor, and maintain inventory levels across all production units and storage locations on mid/long term. Ensuring the efficient utilisation of resources across the Supply Chain, both internally and externally. Advising on strategic planning and provide excellent customer service to all stakeholders, ensuring that customer requirements are met. Accurately maintain data across all systems. About the Job

Prepare mid/long term planning for all sites within the group in a strategic manner aligned with the commercial team.
Prepare and publish forecasting, delivery and production schedules across all sites, balancing customer demand with capacity restrictions.
Liaise with local supply chain planners on plans and support execution on local operations sites.
Planning and prioritizing operations to optimise performance.
Collaborate and effectively communicate within the Supply Chain to make key decisions and prioritise supply issues in a timely, cost effective manner.

About us


Argent Energy offers a solution for reducing greenhouse gas emissions and makes new natural raw materials and thus limits the use of fossil fuels. Upcycling natural raw materials such as frying fat and animal fats limits the use of fossil fuels. By producing biofuel, Argent Energy makes a direct contribution to climate change! Argent Energy has been part of the Swire Group since November 2018. John Swire & Sons Ltd. stems from a family business founded in 1816, which in 200 years has grown into a global company with various interests in aviation, maritime, food, trading and industry.

About you

Highly organised with an attention to detail and analytical approach.

To communicate in a clear, concise and timely manner to all key contacts.
To take appropriate and timely decisions that complement our customer’s requirements
Ability to multitask, prioritising tasks where appropriate.
Ability to work independently under pressure to meet deadlines, in a fast-paced environment.
Proactive and positive approach in the workplace.
Resilient attitude and a strong desire to learn.
Must have excellent written and oral communication skills.
Innovative thought process/out of the box thinker

Supply Chain experience gained in a manufacturing or FMCG environment.
Experience of working with Oracle or ERP systems.
Experience in Inventory management.
Experience of creating production plans
Experience of forecasting or demand management
Experience of using excel to advanced level.

Good primary and secondary employment conditions and an attractive pension scheme;
A social and dynamic working environment within a transparent organization with ample training opportunities;
More than 300 committed colleagues who use their experience and knowledge in the field of recycling organic residual flows, to minimize the burden and waste of the global scarcity of raw materials.

About Circle Economy

At Circle Economy, we believe it is time for a new economic approach: the circular economy. Circle Economy is a social enterprise with an international team that supports businesses, cities and policymakers to find practical and scalable solutions to accelerate the adoption of the circular economy. We are growing rapidly both in the Netherlands and around the world through strategic partnerships with governments, cities, and businesses.
Circle Economy has dedicated programmes for cities, textiles, the built environment, finance, and circular design and have partnered on projects in many sectors such as agrifood, mobility, construction, healthcare, insurance, and waste. Circle Economy also conducts trailblazing research on topics such as climate change, circular jobs creation, and societal impact of the circular economy. Marketing and communications play a pivotal role within the organisation to inspire and teach businesses and governments around the world. Over the years Circle Economy has contributed to the growing community of circular economy frontrunners.


About the role

The Communications Team is responsible to 1) ensure visibility and increase the brand awareness of Circle Economy to a global relevant audience of businesses and governments on city and national levels and 2) ensure that relevant, inspirational, and engaging knowledge and information is distributed and contributes to accelerating the global adoption of the circular economy.

Within the Communications Team, you are responsible to support the development of inspirational and engaging content advocating the circular economy. You understand the power of digital communications and the importance of making research more accessible to facilitate knowledge-sharing. You are able to effectively translate complex ideas into engaging and attractive digital content, from short social media videos to audio tidbits and infographics.
You will report to the Communications Manager, work closely with the Communications and Design teams as well as our internal Business Units to transform learnings and knowledge into highly engaging and inspirational visual content for all our channels.



Who you are

You are an energetic self-starter, able to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment, and are a great team player. You can make decisions independently while at the same time ensuring alignment with internal and external stakeholders. You are an expert on digital communications and love to stay on top of recent developments and innovation within your field and have an interest and passion for the circular economy or the field of sustainability. When searching for content, you understand how to separate the wheat from the chaff and are able to translate highly complex topics and information into easy-to-digest and activating digital content for a specific target audience. You are eager to learn, are not afraid to experiment and implement changes when needed.

Key Responsibilities and Duties
1) Marketing and Communications
Support the development of communications and marketing materials for Circle Economy’s core offerings.
Coordinating and creating standardised templates for marketing materials (e.g. presentations, boilerplates, communications kit etc.), working closely with our design team to ensure adherence to visual guidelines
Developing new formats to disseminate Circle Economy content, from interactive essays and videos to podcast, Instagram stories and new webinar concepts
Assisting with the production of all content, from concept to distribution

2) Website management

Lead on the implementation of structural improvements to the website to keep in line with industry standards in collaboration with our in-house Design team,
support regular website content updates in collaboration with the Communications team and assisting other content editors to make relevant updates, as needed
Coordinate development work with external developers

3) Analytics and Tracking

Improve overall analytics and tracking of Circle Economy’s audience and marketing efforts, from SEO and SEA to social media analytics, in order to improve and optimise,
regularly reporting on analytics from our communications channels to inform our digital content strategy, including social media engagement and website traffic and conversions.
Keeping the communications analytics dashboard up to date and evolving it over time to provide new insights, as needed
Setting up Google Analytics events and conversion goals as needed to provide insights on launch campaigns

4) Project Communications
Support the communications team in developing communication materials for specific projects and thematic areas,
support the communications and design team with translating existing research and insights as well as new project results and findings into digital content, including: social media posts, webinars, videos, infographics, presentations and websites,
introduce new concepts to translate our research into engaging online formats and coordinating the content creation across business units.
Skills and Competencies

Essential

Bachelor or Master's degree in communications, marketing or business-related field
(Near) native English copywriting skills and a good eye for design
Minimum of 6 years experience in marketing communications, preferably in sustainability or social/environmental impact driven sector
You have proven experience developing and maintaining communications and marketing materials and online content
Strong business analytics, relationship management, strategy development, project management, problem-solving and change management skills
Experience working with CMS systems and website management
Experience working with Google Analytics, Social Media Analytics, SEO
The ability to adhere to deadlines and work within constraints
Project management skills in order to keep track of external and internal budgets
The ability to think outside the box to offer new solutions
Being proactive and autonomous
Desired
Excellent communicator with the ability to influence and persuade across all levels of the organisation.
Experience working with the Adobe Creative Suite, digital and/or print design
An affinity with the topics of sustainability and the circular economy
Experience working with Canva, Asana
Basic familiarity with Dutch is a plus

De wereld om ons heen verandert. Steeds sneller en steeds fundamenteler. ManpowerGroup moet mee gaan in deze veranderende wereld (van werk). Daarbij hebben we 1 missie; het verbinden van het juiste talent aan organisaties.
Om dit zo goed mogelijk te kunnen doen hebben we de juiste inzichten nodig. Met die reden hebben we een nieuwe organisatie opgezet, namelijk CODE. CODE staat voor Centre Of Data & Engineering. Oftewel – de machinekamer van ManpowerGroup. Binnen CODE verbinden we processen, data, projecten en systemen aan elkaar. We definiëren kansen voor optimalisatie en borgen impact.
Onderdeel van CODE is de Proces & Projectorganisatie. In deze organisatie verbinden we data aan processen en zetten deze om in rendabele projecten en optimalisaties.
Als proces & projectmanager ben jij verantwoordelijk voor het coördineren van projecten bij grote en complexe klantvraagstukken, dit betreft zowel interne als externe klanten. De projecten kunnen uiteenlopen en zijn van zowel van tactische als strategische aard. Het is jouw kracht om het projectplan gedegen in te richten, stakeholders aan te sturen, timelines te bewaken en als een gedegen gesprekspartner naar alle stakeholders op te treden. Je handelt op basis van data en analyses en bent succesvol als het project onder jouw regie tot een succesvolle implementatie leidt. Gedurende een project weet je alle milestones en resultaten voor ogen te houden om tenslotte tot een excellent resultaat te komen.
Je kunt gedurende de uitrol van een project zowel de risks als commerciële kansen herkennen en weet hoe je dit het beste kunt adresseren en aanpakken. Omdat de samenwerking binnen onze internationale organisatie steeds nauwer wordt, zal je ook te maken krijgen met multidisciplinaire projecten die over landsgrenzen en de labels van de organisatie heen gaan.
Het procesgedeelte van deze functie komt voort uit de diverse performance data die we doorlopend analyseren. Op deze manier kunnen we patronen herkennen en in geval van afwijkingen proactief anticiperen. Hierbij is het doel om optimalisatie in de end to end processen door te voeren en de zogenaamde ' waste' er uit te halen. In jouw rol als proces & projectmanager ga je de op basis van deze analyses doe je verbetervoorstellen aan de organisatie om zo, in geval van een positieve business case, aan de slag te gaan met het implementatieproject.
Naast de projecten die voortkomen uit data analyse behoren klantimplementaties en projecten die voortkomen uit wet en regelgeving of markvraag ook tot je takenpakket.

Een proces & projectmanager die data gedreven is! Je hebt gedegen kennis van projectmanagement methodieken en weet als geen ander hoe je processen moet structureren en standaardiseren.
Graag zien wij ook het volgende in jouw profiel terug:HBO/ WO werk -en denkniveau;Certificering en/ of ervaring met Agile, Lean Six Sigma of Prince-II is absoluut een pré;uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden zowel in de Nederlandse als Engelse taal;excellent stakeholdermanagement op verschillende niveaus;meerdere projecten tegelijkertijd kunnen begeleiden/ coördineren;data kunnen vertalen in kansen met meetbare benefits, milestones, budgetten en timelines.

De kans om bij te dragen aan de opbouw en het succes van CODE en ManpowerGroup. Een combinatierol tussen proces en projectmanagement met een enorm palet aan diversiteit. Binnen deze rol kun je significante en structurele verbeteringen met impact realiseren. Je kunt deze rol als medior of als senior invullen en in beide gevallen zijn er doorgroeimogelijkheden.
Dit is wat wij nog meer bieden:een marktconform salaris;lease auto;ManpowerGroup performance bonus ;additioneel Benefit Budget met verschillende fiscale voordelen, waaronder de mogelijkheid tot het aankopen van extra vakantiedagen;mobiele telefoon en laptop ;pensioenregeling;(online) workshops en trainingen.

You are incredibly creative and have an appetite for learning and thinking outside the box.

Full-time · Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Accountable for copywriting, concepting and campaign development/planning

Write/Lead development of appealing copy/campaigns that attracts, inspires and engages our consumers throughout their entire fit journey by helping them achieve their goal and ambitions through fitness and nutrition
Lead creative brainstorms to develop campaigns that will propel the Body&Fit brand among our target audience and place us as a loved brand
Outline campaigns across channels in collaboration with the different channel managers

Partner with trade and performance to develop a structured and clear way of tracking and measuring impact

What you will bring to Body & Fit:

What we would like to offer you:

The opportunity to shape your career in our global organisation that is championing the healthy lifestyle movement!

Create your own nutrition formula with a discount on our products!


Are we the right fit for you?

Life is way too short to waste anyone’s time so there are a few things that we would like to be upfront about:

Politics, intrigue, gossip. We’re just way too busy for all that stuff!
Slow moving, corporate environment. We move pretty quickly here so we don’t have room for passengers.
Hiding in the background. If we’re to grow together we want you to step up and tell us how to do it. We need your voice!


Please note: To be eligible for this position you need to have a valid working visa / permit to work in the Netherlands.

About PVH Corp.
PVH is one of the most admired fashion and lifestyle companies in the world. We power brands that drive fashion forward – for good. Our brand portfolio includes the iconic CALVIN KLEIN, TOMMY HILFIGER, Van Heusen, IZOD, ARROW, Warner’s, Olga and Geoffrey Beene brands, as well as the digital-centric True&Co. intimates brand. We market a variety of goods under these and other nationally and internationally known owned and licensed brands. PVH has over 40,000 associates operating in over 40 countries and $9.9 billion in annual revenues. That's the Power of Us. That’s the Power of PVH.
The Team – STITCH
STITCH (stitch3d.com) is a Software as a Service (SaaS) startup on the journey to launching a commercial product. We’re on a mission to provide a 3D workflow that inspires fashion brands to spend more time on product while removing waste. We do this through our HUB digital asset library, STITCH Academy education platform, & Transformation services.
Pushing this vision is a close-knit, multicultural mix of people with experiences ranging from pure fashion business to infrastructure coding. Our product is constantly evolving. Nonetheless, here is a run-down of our latest tech setup:
Backend and asynchronous pipelines: Python and Django with Celery
Frontend: Vue, Konva, Jest
Infrastructure: AWS built with Terraform, deployed in containers on ECS and EC2s, frontends hosted with Cloudfront, all managed with CI/CD pipelines built with CircleCI
Process: Project-based work in a cross-functional team, led by product management
The Role & Key Responsibilities:
Translates the company’s commercial & product ambitions into the technology strategy and roadmap. Keeping a sharp eye on any technical risks that can affect the company’s goals.
Evangelises the possibilities of technology to unlock surprising solutions for our customers’ and users’ needs. Collaborate as one team with the Head of Product.
Challenges our talented engineering team to develop high-performing, reliable, secure and - most importantly - scalable solutions.
Always keeps an eye out for opportunities externally that could help achieve STITCH’s goals. Whether it’s experimenting with new technologies, levering your network in search of potential partnerships or uncovering new technology talent.
Sets the engineering principles; championing engineering best practices and driving the STITCH engineering culture. The aim is to ensure a good balance between code quality, the team’s productivity and long term stability/scalability of the product.
Defines the long-term tech talent strategy for STITCH. Team organization, recruitment and talent management are the important aspects of the role. You will be responsible for evolving the team’s organizational structure, driving high performance, collaboration and stimulating our engineers’ professional growth.
Is a member of the STITCH leadership team and will proactively contribute to the short- and long-term plans & vision for STITCH.
In short; this role sets the overall long-term technology direction while always leaving ample room for the engineers to contribute and grow. What do you think?
The Ideal Candidate:
You are a technologist at heart. You’re passionate about the space and can leverage this passion to motivate your team.
You have experience with both product development as well as system design.
You’re able to balance strategy with a hands-on approach, always willing to step up (hands on keyboard) when times require.
Strategic thinking and strong communication skills are essential for this role. You are able to translate the company strategy into a compelling story for the engineering team to rally them around STITCH’s mission. You’re also able to represent the voice of engineering with internal and external stakeholders.
You have a solid understanding of all disciplines of software development, which you use to constructively challenge the team to get better.
You understand how engineering impacts the bottom line of the company and are able to leverage financial metrics to drive improvement initiatives.
You have at least 2 years experience leading and scaling an engineering team. We are looking for a real team builder, someone who is highly collaborative, who gives constructive feedback and is always looking for ways to help the engineering team grow and learn.
Being a start-up, it’s critical that you are able to think on your feet, think in solutions (current and future) and are pragmatic by nature.
You’re excited by the challenge of taking on a successful product and maturing it into a commercial SAAS solution.
What You Can Expect from Us:
A beautiful state-of-the-art Campus, complete with our very own People's Place Gym and People's Place Cafés
A company culture that fosters development, offering training and learning opportunities through our very own PVH University
An international environment which respects diversity, equality, and individuality
A smart work program that empowers our associates to work at their preferred location within a flexible schedule
A chance to unwind with weekly social activities
PVH Europe and our brands, TOMMY HILFIGER and CALVIN KLEIN, are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. We believe we are bettered by all forms of diversity, and take pride in working with top talent from every walk of life and corner of the world. In the spirit of inclusivity, qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation.
