Company Description
Delta Group is the world's largest provider of switching power supplies and a major source for power management solutions, components, visual displays, industrial automation, networking products, and renewable energy solutions. Established in 1971, Delta Group has sales offices worldwide and manufacturing plants in Taiwan, Thailand, China, Mexico and Europe.
As a global leader in power electronics, Delta is committed to environment protection and has implemented green, lead-free production and recycling and waste management programs for many years. Delta's mission continues to be: "To provide innovative energy-saving products for a better quality of life.”

Job Description
We are looking for a Technical Content Editor for our service operations in EMEA region. You will be responsible for structured and standardized transfer, implementation and maintenance of product specific content and workflow into the knowledge management system. The content and workflows created will help the support specialists in remotely assisting customers service related issues.
Your Key Responsibilites:
Structuring and standardization of content created by Master Service Engineer and Level 2 Support Specialists
Implementation and maintenance of technical content incl. manuals, legal and safety requirements in the Knowledge Management system
Implementation of workflows, checklists and decision trees in the Knowledge Management system
Alignment of new content with Master Service Engineer
Maintenance of FAQs
Content deletion of EOL products
Super user for Knowledge Management system incl. user administration

Qualifications

8+ Years of experience handling content for Knowledge Management systems
Excellent knowledge of Knowledge Management systems and functionality
Good technical understanding
Highly proficient in English - proficiency in German or French would be an advantage
Excellent communication and writing skills
Good MS Office knowledge
Experience with SharePoint, Photoshop and video editing software would be an advantage
Additional Information
Our Offer
As an innovative and global company, you are offered a friendly working atmosphere and a constructive working environment leaving much room for new possibilities and ideas. Use this opportunity and show us your motivation.

We’re looking for a seasoned contributor that can deliver excellent design for our web platform and native apps. Detail and data obsessed, you’ll be happy working in a high ambiguity environment and possess the skills to raise the design bar at Greetz.Reporting to the Head of Product Design, you’ll be working on some of our most high value features, pairing with engineers, researchers and Product Managers as necessary. You’ll have autonomy over strategy and execution with guidance from a high profile leadership team and peers across the Product team.You’ll get the best of startup culture at a household-name company which helps millions of people each year show that they care.Your activitiesHelp manage and maintain Breekz Design SystemDefining and delivering intuitive, efficient and delightful user experiences across our website and appsWorking collaboratively in a flexible way with other Designers, Product Managers, Researchers, Engineers and StakeholdersHelping define design team processes through thought leadership and your ability to operate strategically as well as at a pixel levelWork closely with Product Managers to help facilitate ideation process, support limiting development waste and drive ideas validationProduce concepts and prototypes knowing when to deliver pixel-perfect solutions and when to make low fidelity sketches and prototypesHelping Product Design become even closer to EngineeringYour profile5+ years of experience designing high quality interfaces in App and Web devicesA strong understanding of interaction design, visual design, design patterns and user experience standardsWide range of prototyping techniques at various speeds and levels of fidelityExperience with Figma prototyping toolComfortable working in an agile, fast-paced environment to deliver high-quality work consistently in an iterative mannerHands on experience with UX Research techniquesUnderstanding of front and back-end technologies and capabilitiesAbility to communicate and defend design decisions in front of senior stakeholdersAbility to leverage data and formulate a compelling business case for design initiativesGrowth mindsetWhat we offer?We offer an inspiring job at one of Netherlands’ leading E-commerce organisations. We have an informal culture, with short communication lines. It is good to know that the office personnel works from home due to the Covid restrictions. We will hopefully get back to the office in the new year. This role will initially be for a period for one year, but with the option to extend.Application procedureThe interview process is intensive and consists of several steps. You will speak with the Greetz Recruiter and the Head of Product Design. Besides that we ask you to speak to the Product Design team and after that you will have to run through whiteboard exercises with your (hopefully) future colleagues. We’ll make it a ride, are you ready!About GreetzWith over 160 colleagues we work together on the same mission, delivering that smile to our customers. All our 3 million customers return to our online platform to look for that special present to surprise someone or to let somebody know that they’re thinking of them. We have a wide variety of products. We started 15 years ago by selling real cards online but have grown into the online platform for personal surprises such as flowers, balloons, photo gifts and cards. Since 2018 we are part of the Moonpig Group.Contractduur 12 maandenSoort dienstverband: Fulltime, Bepaalde tijdSalaris: €5.000,00 - €6.000,00 per maandAanvullende betalingen:BonusregelingVakantiegeldArbeidsvoorwaarden:GezondheidsprogrammaPensioenPersoneelskortingReiskostenvergoedingTelefoonplanVrijdagmiddagborrelWerk vanuit huisWerkschema:ma-vr

Job Title: Field Application Engineer (FAE) - Electrical Vehicle Charging Solution
Job Description:
Company Description

Delta Group is the world's largest provider of switching power supplies and a major source for power management solutions, components, visual displays, industrial automation, networking products, and renewable energy solutions. Established in 1971, Delta Group has sales offices worldwide and manufacturing plants in Taiwan, Thailand, China, Mexico and Europe.
As a global leader in power electronics, Delta is committed to environment protection and has implemented green, lead-free production and recycling and waste management programs for many years. Delta's mission continues to be: "To provide innovative energy-saving products for a better quality of life.”

Job Description

For our Electrical Vehicle Charging Solution (EVCS) Team we are searching for an experienced Field Application Engineer (FAE) to help grow our business in France from our office location in Hoofddorp.
Main Job Responsibilities:
Offer technical support to sales and product marketing in an accurate and timely manner
Support the process of tender preparation by creating proposals and advising on solutions
Support the identification of new market opportunities
Handling service requests and support resolving technical problems
Occasional on-site support for complex technical issues
Support the relationship management and service delivery for business accounts
Demonstrate a deep understanding of our company product lines

Qualifications

Bachelor/Master Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent
3-5 years experience within Electric Vehicle Charging Solution, Energy Storage Systems or Power Conditioning Systems
Fluent English and French skills
Excellent technical knowledge and understanding of Electric Vehicle Charging Solutions and Energy Storage Systems.
Outstanding problem solving, critical thinking and troubleshooting skills
Capability to work independently and in international team
Customer focus, good communication and interpersonal skills
Possibility to travel occasionally
In passions of a driver’s license
Additional Information

Our Offer
As an innovative and global company, you are offered a friendly working atmosphere and a constructive working environment leaving much room for new possibilities and ideas. Use this opportunity and show us your motivation.

About Sapient: We are a social business catalysing sustainable environmental and social impact actions in our society, through multiple projects and collaborations. Sapient Social & Environmental Enterprises was established in 2016 and consists of a team of bright, young inspired individuals, from across the globe who dedicate themselves to stop food waste, renew democracy, provide local green energy solutions, and help other social businesses in their path to positive impact.Healthy and Affordable: H&Aff is an independent social business from Sapient whose aim is to reduce the amount of food being wasted in Amsterdam, starting from its collection and ending in its new market launch. The unwanted food is first collected from food suppliers then dehydrated, frozen and pickled. Our new product is then ready to be repackaged and finally put on the market again. All the profit that we earn from the product sales is invested back into the fight against food waste in Amsterdam.Graphic Designer: Do you enjoy web design? Are you an enthusiast of creating banners and playing around with different software? Would you like to apply your amazing talent and make the world a better place? Then search no more because we are looking for you!Your tasks will include: Making illustrations, editing images, designing and updating page layouts and web pages through Wix.Creating social media posts and collaborating with other departments and projects.Offline communication design such as banners, ads, logos, flyers, stickers, t-shirts etc.Meeting with clients to gain an understanding of their needs.2D animation and video editing.Do you fit our profile?Good communication skills,Excellent English speaking and writing skills,Open-minded and willing to learn and jump into projects,A software enthusiast (we generally work with the Adobe Suite so it would be ideal to know the basics of the most popular programs: Photoshop, Illustrator and Indesign),Some knowledge about visual communication in terms of how things relate to each other (text, images etc),Time management skills,Enjoys working in an international, challenging and social environment.What we offer: This is a non-paid internship. So what’s in it for you?A more in-depth understanding of social business and its social & environmental impact,The opportunity to participate in a dynamic, proactive and young environment,Autonomy and flexible working hours,The power to make a difference,The opportunity to acquire new skills, learn and grow,Amazing colleagues.Internship Details: Currently, we are looking for a new intern to join us from mid-march for a minimum of 3 months.Unfortunately, the internship is unpaid, however, you can choose the duration that suits you best (minimum of three months). Also, you can choose your own working hours as full-time or part-time as long as you strictly follow the program you set for yourself.Due to Corona restrictions, it is possible to work remotely for this position.About the team: Our interns are called Padawans who are highly motivated to make the world a better place. The Sapient team consists of people who are team-oriented, goal-driven, proactive, independent and open-minded. We work both in teams and individually. So, we are looking for like-minded people to join our team.To keep the team spirit during the Corona times, we have team meetings at least once a week and once a month we organize Sapient Days with fun online activities in order to welcome new Padawans and to strengthen our sense of belonging.Contact information: If this sounds appealing to you please send us your CV, motivation letter and portfolio (all documents must be in English). Make sure to include “Internship Application (position) MM.YY – MM.YY)” in the subject header with the position you are applying for and your dates of availability. We look forward to hearing from you!If you are applying from outside the EU and you do not have a working visa, please ensure that you sort out how you plan to arrange your stay in the Netherlands. We do not offer any assistance regarding visas and permits.Please, be aware that we review applications as we receive them. Therefore, we strongly suggest applying early to maximize your chances.Websites: https://www.sapientsee.com/https://sapientsee.wixsite.com/healthyandaffordableVerwachte startdatum: 15-3-2021Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, InternshipWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.About the business:Every month Marktplaats handles over 8 million unique visitors and 350.000 new advertisements each day making Marktplaats the largest online trading platform in the Netherlands. Consumer and professional sellers offer a large and varied assortment of used and new products. But we want to go even further - we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. We are a mix of Dutch and Silicon Valley cultures; like both, we are an international team of passionate people who share a common interest in solving problems using software and data. We invite you to join us!This role is located within our User Experience & Design team, where you are part of a group of Product designers, researchers and other UX specialists. Besides that, you also work in a cross-functional team that is focussed on creating the best experience in the field of advertising. Your goal is to create the most wonderful experience for our users by balancing their needs and the business needs of advertisers. In this team you will collaborate with a product manager, mobile/front-end developers, back-end developers, product analysts, data scientists, marketing, customer service and more.We’re looking for an experienced Product Designer that:Shows leadership in defining, communicating and executing a design vision & strategy in delivering strategic objectives.Applies strong partner leadership skills to balance user and business needs.Encourage and collaborate with people from other subject areas, like product managers, developers and data analysts.Owns and is accountable for all aspects of the design process.Is experienced in designing a multi-platform experience for Android, iOS and web.Knows how to apply modern Design Thinking methods. You are comfortable organising and leading Design sprints and/or workshops.Is comfortable in combining research and data insights to drive decision making in the designing and the solution exploration.Validates design solutions using both qualitative and quantitative methods.Is Proficient in English.Bonus points: experience in the e-commerce and/or advertising domain.What we offer you:The User Experience & Design team is a young and quickly evolving team that focuses on continuous improvement, for example through team training.Together we create an environment with a lot of opportunity to express yourself, share your ideas and collaborate to make it happen.Learning, education and personal development are key when you work at Marktplaats & 2dehands. You have influence in your growth path with your own education budget.The position you have as a designer in your cross-functional team gives you the opportunity to be part of defining and influence the direction of the critical initiatives of your team.Interested?From the moment that you join our team we aspire to make your employment experience an outstanding and engaging one. If you are enthusiastic and thrive in a collaborative and friendly environment, just apply!Benefits:Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs.We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel Marktplaats is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about our Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/Covid-19People are the heart of the eBay Classifieds business, and their health and well-being are our first priority.We continue to monitor local government guidance and partner closely with medical advisors to determine the safest and best next steps for everyone. As a result, most teams are working remotely, with a few teams able to collaborate in person with enhanced safety procedures. We will discuss the particular case for your region during the interview process. As a general rule, interviews will be completed remotely over video calls.eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.

Company Name: DoubleTree by Hilton Amsterdam Centraal Station
Job Description:
Demi Chef de Partie
Altijd al willen werken in het grootste hotel in het centrum van Amsterdam?

DoubleTree by Hilton Amsterdam Centraal Station biedt prachtige uitzichten, buitengewone service en bruisende food & beverage outlets.

In ons hotel vind je SkyLounge Amsterdam, award-winning rooftop terras, pop-up restaurant Eastwood Beer & Grill, onze eigen Starbucks® store en het meest gevarieerde ontbijtbuffet van de stad. Natuurlijk krijg jij in al onze outlets 50% korting! Daarnaast kun jij naast je baan onbeperkt fit blijven. Onze fitness is namelijk 24/7 beschikbaar voor jou!

Als Demi Chef de Partie ben je verantwoordelijk voor voedselvoorbereiding op hoog niveau op een specifike sectie en het tegelijktijdig assisteren van de Chef de Partie bij dagelijkse werkzaamheden.


Deel uitmaken van ons team als Demi Chef de Partie, betekent teamlid worden voor een van de beste werkgevers van Nederland. Met name omdat de zorg voor ons team een van onze topprioriteiten is! Met een jong team van ongeveer 35 chefs is er voor iedereen een plek. Chef-kok Paul Stoop is een gerenommeerde chef die de keuken al jaren verbetert. Jij zou de toevoeging kunnen zijn die we zoeken om het nog beter te maken!

Van Wagyu tot T-bone, ons Eastwood Beer & Grill restaurant staat bekend om kwaliteit steaks. Natuurlijk serveren wij onze andere gerechten ook met de hoogste kwaliteit van zorg en creativiteit. Naast ons Eastwood Beer & Grill restaurant ben je ook verantwoordelijk voor de gerechten in SkyLounge Amsterdam. Hier worden je organisatorische vaardigheden getest en kun je laten zien of je kunt presteren in een drukke, dynamische omgeving. Van zelfgemaakte sushi tot ijs, het staat allemaal op de kaart.

Je bent mede-verantwoordelijk voor een bepaalde sectie, dit in samenwerking met andere (Demi) Chef’s. Als Demi Chef de Partie zal je ook verantwoordelijkheid dragen voor de kostenbeheersing, afvalbeheer en bestellingen. Specifiek zal je verantwoordelijk zijn voor het uitvoeren van de volgende taken:
Zorg ervoor dat alle voedsel voorbereiding voldoet aan de normen
Houd alle werkruimtes schoon en netjes en zorg dat er geen kruisbesmetting kan plaatsvinden
Voorbereiden van alle mise en place voor de relevante menu's
Het ondersteunen van andere afdelingen waar nodig en onderhouden van goede werkrelaties
Verslag en beheer van het onderhoud, de hygiëne en de gevaren
Wees milieubewust

Als Chef de Partie die werkt met onze DoubleTree by Hilton-merkstandaarden, werk je altijd namens onze gasten. Om deze rol met succes te vervullen, is het belangrijk dat je de volgende vaardigheden bezit:
Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Demi Chef de Partie of een vergelijkbare rol
Een actuele, geldige en relevante commerciële kwalificatie op het gebied van koken (bewijs vereist)
Uitstekende kennis van voedsel
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, met name in het Engels
NVQ Niveau 2
Behaald Basis-Hygiëne Certificaat
Een positieve, proactieve en assertieve houding
Vermogen om te werken onder druk
Zowel zelfstandig als in teamverband kunnen werken

In deze functie is het een pré indien je kennis bezit over huidige eet-trends en Intermediate Food Hygiene kennis bezit.


En, voor wij het vergeten, naast de vele faciliteiten binnen ons hotel kun je zelf natuurlijk ook genieten van de Hilton service, wereldwijd en met korting!

Altijd al willen weten hoe het is om bij DoubleTree by Hilton Amsterdam Centraal Station te werken? Bekijk dan onze team member video: https://youtu.be/2BaXEjZfbTI Demi Chef de Partie
Always wanted to work in the largest hotel in the center of Amsterdam?

DoubleTree by Hilton Amsterdam Centraal Station offers amazing views, extraordinary service and lively food & beverage outlets.

Our hotel includes SkyLounge Amsterdam, an award-winning rooftop terrace, pop-up restaurant Eastwood Beer & Grill, our very own Starbucks® Store and Amsterdam’s most extended breakfast buffet. You will, of course, receive a 50% discount in all of our food & beverage outlets. Moreover, you can stay fit next to your job. Our fitness is available 24/7 for you!

A Demi Chef de Partie is responsible for ensuring high levels of food preparation on a specific section to deliver an excellent experience while assisting the Chef de Partie with all daily tasks. As an employee of DoubleTree by Hilton Amsterdam Centraal Station, you will be a part of one of the best employers in The Netherlands. Taking care of our team is one of our top priorities! With a young team of about 35 chefs, there is a place for everybody. Executive Chef Paul Stoop is a renowned chef who has been improving the kitchen for years. You could be the addition we are looking for to make it even better!

From Wagyu to T-bone, our Eastwood Beer & Grill restaurant is known to offer the best quality steaks. Likewise, our other dishes show the highest quality and creativity. Besides our Eastwood Beer & Grill restaurant, you will also be responsible for the dishes in SkyLounge Amsterdam. Here, your organisational skills are tested and you can show whether you are able to perform in a busy and dynamic environment. From homemade sushi to ice cream, we have it all!


You will be partly responsible for a specific partie and working with the other (Demi) Chef de Partie’s on your section. A Demi Chef de Partie will also be required to assist with food cost controls like waste control and inventory management. Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:
Ensuring all food preparation meets standards
Keeping all working areas clean and tidy and omitting cross contamination
Preparing all mise en place for all relevant menus
Assisting other departments wherever necessary and maintaining good working relationships
Reporting and controlling maintenance, hygiene and hazard issues
Being environmentally aware
A Demi chef de Parti working with DoubleTree by Hilton brand standards is always working on behalf of our Guests. To successfully fill this role, it is important that you have the following skills:
A minimum of 2 years of previous experience as a Demi Chef de Partie or a similar role
A current, valid, and relevant trade commercial cookery qualification (proof may be required)
Excellent knowledge of food
Great communication skills
NVQ Level 2
Achieved Basic Food Hygiene Certificate
Positive, proactive and assertive attitude
Ability to work under pressure
Ability to work on your own or in a team
Excellent English speaking skills
It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:
Intermediate Food Hygiene
Knowledge of current food trends

Before we forget: next to our own facilities, you can also enjoy our Hilton service, worldwide and with a discount.

Would you like to know what life as a team member at DoubleTree by Hilton Amsterdam Centraal Station looks like? Have a look at our team member impression video: https://youtu.be/2BaXEjZfbTI

Accelerate your sales career with the best in the industry!


Every day, we help companies to make the world a better place. One of North America’s fastest-growing technology companies, our software empowers better corporate decision making. We do this by providing a window into an organization’s global supply chain and the factories in which their products are manufactured, to reduce compliance risks, environmental waste, and prevent human rights abuse.

As we continue to expand our European operations, we are looking to grow our team of high-performing Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) Account Executives. Our ideal candidates bring significant experience in developing relationships with senior executives, have a proven track record of success selling in a B2B, SaaS environment, and have professional-level proficiency in English and German. We are specifically looking for individuals who are driven to succeed and thrive on the challenge that comes with taking a new product to market.


What you will do:

Prospect and sell to new logos
Establish and develop an account-based sales strategy to achieve sales quotas
Follow a systematic sales process to progress prospect sales campaigns
Win new customers through self-sourcing activities, research, responding to leads, and building exceptional internal and external relationships
Manage a complex sales-cycle to prospective senior executives and/or multiple constituencies within an organization (Manufacturing Operations, Demand Management, Finance, IT)
Partner with Business Development to grow and optimize your pipeline
Manage all sales activity and forecasting of revenue in Salesforce


Join us if you:

Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator with excellent written and verbal skills in English and German
Have at least 5 years of progressive B2B SaaS sales experience
Have masterfully led SaaS sales cycles from end-to-end
Have demonstrable experience meeting and exceeding sales quotas up to $1M
Are skillful in penetrating accounts, developing relationships, and selling to executive-level decision-makers
Are able to identify existing and emerging client needs, and to articulate the corresponding benefits of Assent’s offerings
Are a tenacious, highly motivated, and persistent sales hunter
Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator and presenter
Have excellent questioning techniques, active listening skills, and analytical capabilities
Are highly capable and self-sufficient in the development and delivery of all sales cycle artifacts including presentations, proposals
Are energized by working in a start-up-like sales environment
Have experience working with CRM tools
Have a combination of education and experience that demonstrates the above


What’s in it for you?

At Assent, your contributions will be valued and have a bigger purpose - you will help make a real difference to our clients. Our team challenges each other to be better every day and we dig deep to build a culture of innovation and high-performance.

In addition to a competitive salary, you can expect to:

Love what you do as part of a fantastic culture and supportive team that really wants you to succeed
Accelerate greatness in a challenging position with high learning and development potential
Choose how you work best with a flexible work arrangement
Spend your days making a difference, not just working for a living. We help our customers all over the world by providing a real understanding of their supply chain data so they can protect their brands, remove market access barriers, and reduce operational and financial risk


All applicants will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check.

Reasonable Accommodations Statement: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the aforementioned duties and responsibilities satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.

eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.
About the business:
Marktplaats, 2dehands and 2ememain are part of eBay and the eBay Classifieds Group (eCG). It combines the energy of a start-up with the resources of one of the leading technology companies in the world. We offer the top 500 advertisers relevant ways to connect and communicate with our 11 million monthly unique users, customized integrations and partnerships. Consumer and professional sellers offer a large and varied assortment of used and new products. But we want to go even further - we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. We invite you to join us!
We are looking for:
Senior Integrated Marketing Manager to lead the development and execution of integrated marketing plans in NL/BE that drive business growth (via Acquisition and Retention tactics) and brand impact. Experienced marketing professional, who excels in turning ad hoc issues into opportunities by using strategic agility and strong executional skills, aligned with the vision and strategy of Marktplaats and 2dehands/2ememain.
In this role, he/she will work with a cross functional team of experts from Brand & Content Marketing, Precision Marketing, Insights & Analytics, PR, Product, Business owners (who all play a part in his/her success) to develop and execute annual marketing strategies, investment plans, and integrated campaigns across Paid, Owned and Earned channels.
He/she role will be responsible for the overall C2C marketing and brand performance of Marktplaats & 2dehands. His/her focus and knowledge of the market, consumers, culture and competitors will translate into deeper understanding of the market, what’s needed to win & ultimately contribute to execute relevant marketing plans and ROI driven investment strategies.
The role will be based in Amsterdam and will report to the eCG Benelux CMO.
Responsibilities:
‘Go-to-person’ for the overall C2C Marketing strategy, activation & ROI for NL / BE
Define market priorities, strategies, activation calendars, integrated campaigns briefs, messaging, channel mix & investments recos in close collaboration with various internal teams.
Work with Consumer Insights & Analytics stakeholders to develop market deep-dive analysis, define growth projections, audience understanding and required behavioural / mindset changes
Lead the development of Integrated Marketing briefs (for always on / adhoc campaigns) in close collaboration with content, precision, insights & analytics, PR, product…
Work with the above in the development and execution of fully integrated campaigns
Regularly report marketing and brand results against agreed KPIs
Lead recommendations of corrective actions to the plans during the year as needed
Understand NL or BE market in-side-out from a business perspective, keeps a pulse on what's going in that market (in collaboration with the Insights / analytics team), recommends plans adjustments during the year as needed
Share market learnings, further requirements and best practices across the wider eCG organization
Requirements:
Entrepreneurial, strong sense of ownership to build leading brands in NL/BE, and a drive to exceed marketing and business goals
Strong influencer and collaborator who can work with a variety of marketing and business teams in co-developing marketing priorities, calendars, plans and budgets
Analytical and data-driven to analyze category, competitive, consumer, product and brand data and identify the biggest marketing opportunities and goals for NL & BE
Strong knowledge of full Marketing Mix (Communications, Offline/Online/Performance Marketing Channels, CRM, PR, Front-End, App) to co-develop best-in-class integrated campaigns with relevant marketing teams
Strong project management to oversee the flawless execution of integrated Paid, Earned & Owned channel campaigns
Business results driven and financially savvy (ideally have had prior P&L or business results responsibility)
Strong interpersonal skills and leadership presence with the ability to influence and motivate people at all levels of the organization
Able to work independently and within a group to push projects to completion
Excellent organizational and project management skills
8-10+ years of professional marketing experience – ideally within ecommerce / pure player environment
Fluent English speaker
Masters degree in - ideally in Marketing, Economics

eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.
About the business:
Every month Marktplaats handles over 8 million unique visitors and 350.000 new advertisements each day making Marktplaats the largest online trading platform in the Netherlands. Consumer and professional sellers offer a large and varied assortment of used and new products. But we want to go even further - we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. We are a mix of Dutch and Silicon Valley cultures; like both, we are an international team of passionate people who share a common interest in solving problems using software and data. We invite you to join us!
Ask any Dutch internet user about their favourite Marktplaats story. Observe their excitement about the great deal they found or the interesting people they met. They have made Marktplaats the most popular site and the most downloaded app made in the Netherlands.
This is a big responsibility; you will work on high-availability servers, improve customer experience through innovation, impact revenues and advance our team and technologies. In turn, we will work with you to grow your career in Marktplaats and eBay.
Your growth will involve our highly-performant and high-traffic systems. During peak hours, our site's per-second throughput is OVER 1000 searches (which makes us the second most-used search engine in NL), 25K images and 4GB of data; Marktplaats handles over 1 million unique visitors, 350K new advertisements and 155K transactions daily. On an average month, we get 140 million visits, which translates into 2.5 billion page views. But our users demand more, so we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love.
What you can expect from us:
A collaborative, informal, international and playful work environment with self-organised, multi-disciplinary agile/lean teams
Managers and teammates who are invested in your growth as a technologist and as a person

The Company

For one of Europe’s most sustainable biodiesel producers and fuel suppliers, we are looking for a Senior Business Controller.
The Company was established in 2001 and is involved in the manufacture of large scale commercial biodiesel. The award-winning Company makes its clean, green road fuel by recycling wastes and residues from other industries - specifically waste from the food industry and tallow from the meat industry. It has also pioneered the use of low grade waste fats and oils such as “fatbergs” from the UK’s water industry.
As well as supplying bulk biodiesel to European customers, they specialise in the supply of high grade, sustainable diesel for fleet operators, delivering to over 100 UK depots. They provide the best economic value to their customers along with a range of greenhouse gas savings from their products.
By producing environmental fuel, their aim is to contribute to the global battle against climate change and help maximise the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions from transport. The Company has three manufacturing facilities for waste-based biodiesel and continues to invest in further growth.
In 2013 the group was acquired by a leading private investment company and in 2018 reached agreement to buy biodiesel production facilities, tank storage and cleaning facilities in the Netherlands. The addition of these facilities represents the first step for the company in replicating its successful business outside the UK. The company is now located in the Netherlands, Scotland and North West England.


The Position

The Senior Business Partner NL is the most senior financial role within the Netherlands. The position will play a key role in the planning and coordination of the annual budgeting process to create a business plan that reflects the organisation’s goals and long-term strategy for the Netherlands.
The Finance Department is currently creating a shared service center and has recently implemented a new ERP system. This role will work closely with the Group Head of Management Accounting to develop improved management reporting and analysis in the company, to drive performance imrpovement and support further investment. The role will play a key role in helping to implement an improved reporting system to complement the ERP system.
The main purpose of this position is to interpret financial analysis within the Netherlands in order to influence business partners to make timely interventions or to support commercial decisions. Working as part of a team, this role will contribute to the production of consolidated performance reporting and regular forecasts of expected outcomes for the group and liaise as a business partner with the relevant departments, this includes the traders.
You are also responsible for coordinating the budget process, gaining a deep understanding of the cost levers underpinning financial performance, support the growth and development of the management accountant in NL and will be involved in M&A related activities where relevant.
Please find the key responsibilities below:
Working with senior business partners to support delivery of departmental goals, as reflected in financial targets and budgetsCoordinating the annual budget process and securing buy-in from key stakeholdersProducing regular reforecasts using business knowledge of current performance trendsSupporting the production of longer-term forecasts that stretch beyond the annual budget.Analysing management reports to provide insightful performance commentary.Investigating the cause of deviations from target performance, working with the business partners to initiate timely interventions.Gaining a deep understanding of the cost levers underpinning financial performance and sharing this with business partners to initiate improvements where possible.Contribute to the ongoing development of the ERP system and other supporting tools to automate as much reporting as possible.Meeting with business partners on a regular basis to build successful relationships, resulting in better business knowledge and increased commercial acumen.Collaborating with other team members to maintain a high performing finance function.Contributing to the development of business cases and financial models for new investment opportunitiesSeeking opportunities to continually develop skills and management accounting expertise.Supporting the growth and development of the management accountants.Developing business cases and financial models for new investment opportunities which are consistent with business strategy.


Job QualificationsMaster’s Degree in Accounting, Control or Finance;Broad financial expertise gained in a process manufacturing industry e.g. chemicals or oilsExperience of working with business partners in an engineering or production management roleLeadership experienceAbility to analyse and interpret financial dataExperience of creating bespoke reports to meet a current business needPrevious use of ERP systems such as SAP or OracleExperience of using alternative data warehousing or reporting tools such as Hyperion, Power BI or othersUse of all Microsoft Office packages with strong Excel skillsGood communication skills – able to interpret complex financial data and explain it simply.Evidence of initiative – self-starter, developing new ways of reporting or analysing data.Analytical skills – comfortable working with large amounts of data from multiple sources.Interpersonal skills – able to form successful working relationshipsChallenger mentality – confident to challenge and drive continual improvement.Reporting skills – produce quality analysis or output that is meaningful to recipients.Ability to operate calmly under pressure.
Offer
Gross Annual Salary: EUR 90.000,- - EUR 110.000,- + Bonus + other benefits

Job Title: Global Procurement Category Manager - Security and EHS
Job Description:
Job Details
Location:
Amsterdam, North Holland
Posting date:
19 Oct 2020
Job type:
Permanent
Sector:
FMCG
Salary
£75000.00 - £90000.00
Global Procurement Category Manager - Security, Environment, Health & Safety

Market Leading FMCG Organization

Location - Madrid, Spain; Relocation required.

Salary - €75k-€90k + Comprehensive benefits (Car, Bonus, Meal Voucher, etc)

Contact - Rikard, JobsRL@bramwithconsulting.co.uk

Reference - 12781.2

As part of a major global business transformation, this market-leading FMCG firm is currently establishing a global procurement center of excellence out of their offices in Madrid. Bramwith Consulting is working exclusively with this organization to identify the best procurement talent in Europe to join this high-performance team.
One of the urgent requirements within the team currently is for a Global Procurement Category Manager for Security and Environment, Health & Safety (EHS) who will be responsible for creating and implementing the global and regional strategies for this spend area. The position will have oversight for over 80 countries where the business operates and will cover factory & office security systems, services, and technologies as well as a wide portfolio of EHS spend including Covid PPE, EHS Consulting, Waste Management, Facility operations and more.
This opportunity is excellent for individuals who have an expertise in Facilities Management Procurement with a specialist knowledge of Security and EHS spend who can deliver procurement best practices to this category at a global level. This is a very important spend category within the center of excellence as it directly impacts the day to day operations of offices and factories as well as the safety of all employees.
As the Global Procurement Category Manager for Security, Environment, Health & Safety

you will be expected to have the following skills:-

Proven track record of building regional and global category management strategies from scratch through internal stakeholder management and data analytics of facilities management spend
Excellent commercial and negotiation skills backed by a deep knowledge of the category
A solid understanding of corporate and manufacturing facility operations including hazards, safety, emissions and infrastructure
Ability to communicate effectively within a global matrix structured organization with a highly multi-cultural stakeholder base
Ability to generate consistent cost and cash flow improvements by implementing more effective sourcing and supplier management initiatives

If you are an ambitious facilities management procurement professional looking for an opportunity to deliver global impact within a market leading organization then this position should be your next career move. You will be exposed to C-level execs and be responsible for decisions that will impact the business on a global level across all their operating market. As the Global Procurement Category Manager for Security, Environment, Health & Safety you will take ownership of one of the most critical indirect spend categories that directly impacts all employees of the organization.
If you have the right skills and experience in global facilities management to take on this challenge then apply now with your most recent CV via the link above or directly to Rikard at JobsRL@bramwithconsulting.co.uk

Accelerate your sales career with the best in the industry!


Every day, we help companies to make the world a better place. One of North America’s fastest-growing technology companies, our software empowers better corporate decision making. We do this by providing a window into an organization’s global supply chain and the factories in which their products are manufactured, to reduce compliance risks, environmental waste, and prevent human rights abuse.

As we continue to expand our European operations, we are looking to grow our team of high-performing Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) Account Executives. Our ideal candidates bring significant experience in developing relationships with senior executives, have a proven track record of success selling in a B2B, SaaS environment, and have professional-level proficiency in English and German. We are specifically looking for individuals who are driven to succeed and thrive on the challenge that comes with taking a new product to market.


What you will do:

Prospect and sell to new logos
Establish and develop an account-based sales strategy to achieve sales quotas
Follow a systematic sales process to progress prospect sales campaigns
Win new customers through self-sourcing activities, research, responding to leads, and building exceptional internal and external relationships
Manage a complex sales-cycle to prospective senior executives and/or multiple constituencies within an organization (Manufacturing Operations, Demand Management, Finance, IT)
Partner with Business Development to grow and optimize your pipeline
Manage all sales activity and forecasting of revenue in Salesforce


Join us if you:

Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator with excellent written and verbal skills in English and German
Have at least 5 years of progressive B2B SaaS sales experience
Have masterfully led SaaS sales cycles from end-to-end
Have demonstrable experience meeting and exceeding sales quotas up to $1M
Are skillful in penetrating accounts, developing relationships, and selling to executive-level decision-makers
Are able to identify existing and emerging client needs, and to articulate the corresponding benefits of Assent’s offerings
Are a tenacious, highly motivated, and persistent sales hunter
Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator and presenter
Have excellent questioning techniques, active listening skills, and analytical capabilities
Are highly capable and self-sufficient in the development and delivery of all sales cycle artifacts including presentations, proposals
Are energized by working in a start-up-like sales environment
Have experience working with CRM tools
Have a combination of education and experience that demonstrates the above


What’s in it for you?

At Assent, your contributions will be valued and have a bigger purpose - you will help make a real difference to our clients. Our team challenges each other to be better every day and we dig deep to build a culture of innovation and high-performance.

In addition to a competitive salary, you can expect to:

Love what you do as part of a fantastic culture and supportive team that really wants you to succeed
Accelerate greatness in a challenging position with high learning and development potential
Choose how you work best with a flexible work arrangement
Spend your days making a difference, not just working for a living. We help our customers all over the world by providing a real understanding of their supply chain data so they can protect their brands, remove market access barriers, and reduce operational and financial risk


All applicants will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check.

Reasonable Accommodations Statement: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the aforementioned duties and responsibilities satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.

eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.
About the business:
Marktplaats, 2dehands and 2ememain are part of eBay and the eBay Classifieds Group (eCG). It combines the energy of a start-up with the resources of one of the leading technology companies in the world. We offer the top 500 advertisers relevant ways to connect and communicate with our 11 million monthly unique users, customized integrations and partnerships. Consumer and professional sellers offer a large and varied assortment of used and new products. But we want to go even further - we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. We invite you to join us!
We are looking for:
Senior Integrated Marketing Manager to lead the development and execution of integrated marketing plans in NL/BE that drive business growth (via Acquisition and Retention tactics) and brand impact. Experienced marketing professional, who excels in turning ad hoc issues into opportunities by using strategic agility and strong executional skills, aligned with the vision and strategy of Marktplaats and 2dehands/2ememain.
In this role, he/she will work with a cross functional team of experts from Brand & Content Marketing, Precision Marketing, Insights & Analytics, PR, Product, Business owners (who all play a part in his/her success) to develop and execute annual marketing strategies, investment plans, and integrated campaigns across Paid, Owned and Earned channels.
He/she role will be responsible for the overall C2C marketing and brand performance of Marktplaats & 2dehands. His/her focus and knowledge of the market, consumers, culture and competitors will translate into deeper understanding of the market, what’s needed to win & ultimately contribute to execute relevant marketing plans and ROI driven investment strategies.
The role will be based in Amsterdam and will report to the eCG Benelux CMO.
Responsibilities:
‘Go-to-person’ for the overall C2C Marketing strategy, activation & ROI for NL / BE
Define market priorities, strategies, activation calendars, integrated campaigns briefs, messaging, channel mix & investments recos in close collaboration with various internal teams.
Work with Consumer Insights & Analytics stakeholders to develop market deep-dive analysis, define growth projections, audience understanding and required behavioural / mindset changes
Lead the development of Integrated Marketing briefs (for always on / adhoc campaigns) in close collaboration with content, precision, insights & analytics, PR, product…
Work with the above in the development and execution of fully integrated campaigns
Regularly report marketing and brand results against agreed KPIs
Lead recommendations of corrective actions to the plans during the year as needed
Understand NL or BE market in-side-out from a business perspective, keeps a pulse on what's going in that market (in collaboration with the Insights / analytics team), recommends plans adjustments during the year as needed
Share market learnings, further requirements and best practices across the wider eCG organization
Requirements:
Entrepreneurial, strong sense of ownership to build leading brands in NL/BE, and a drive to exceed marketing and business goals
Strong influencer and collaborator who can work with a variety of marketing and business teams in co-developing marketing priorities, calendars, plans and budgets
Analytical and data-driven to analyze category, competitive, consumer, product and brand data and identify the biggest marketing opportunities and goals for NL & BE
Strong knowledge of full Marketing Mix (Communications, Offline/Online/Performance Marketing Channels, CRM, PR, Front-End, App) to co-develop best-in-class integrated campaigns with relevant marketing teams
Strong project management to oversee the flawless execution of integrated Paid, Earned & Owned channel campaigns
Business results driven and financially savvy (ideally have had prior P&L or business results responsibility)
Strong interpersonal skills and leadership presence with the ability to influence and motivate people at all levels of the organization
Able to work independently and within a group to push projects to completion
Excellent organizational and project management skills
8-10+ years of professional marketing experience – ideally within ecommerce / pure player environment
Fluent English speaker
Masters degree in - ideally in Marketing, Economics

eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.
About the business:
Every month Marktplaats handles over 8 million unique visitors and 350.000 new advertisements each day making Marktplaats the largest online trading platform in the Netherlands. Consumer and professional sellers offer a large and varied assortment of used and new products. But we want to go even further - we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. We are a mix of Dutch and Silicon Valley cultures; like both, we are an international team of passionate people who share a common interest in solving problems using software and data. We invite you to join us!
Ask any Dutch internet user about their favourite Marktplaats story. Observe their excitement about the great deal they found or the interesting people they met. They have made Marktplaats the most popular site and the most downloaded app made in the Netherlands.
This is a big responsibility; you will work on high-availability servers, improve customer experience through innovation, impact revenues and advance our team and technologies. In turn, we will work with you to grow your career in Marktplaats and eBay.
Your growth will involve our highly-performant and high-traffic systems. During peak hours, our site's per-second throughput is OVER 1000 searches (which makes us the second most-used search engine in NL), 25K images and 4GB of data; Marktplaats handles over 1 million unique visitors, 350K new advertisements and 155K transactions daily. On an average month, we get 140 million visits, which translates into 2.5 billion page views. But our users demand more, so we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love.
What you can expect from us:
A collaborative, informal, international and playful work environment with self-organised, multi-disciplinary agile/lean teams
Managers and teammates who are invested in your growth as a technologist and as a person
Work with cool modern technologies such as Scala, Java, Kotlin, Node.js, Apache Kafka, Elasticsearch, Cassandra and more in a fast-evolving Microservices architecture
Access to tools and resources to do your job (best-in-class laptop, IDEs, Safari Online subscription, conferences and meetups, all the coffee and soda you can drink, and much more)
Ability to join and participate in multiple internal interest groups in Marktplaats and across eBay Classifieds Group in trending topics like Machine Learning, AI, DevOps, BigData, mobile development, and others
Continuous Deployment through multiple environments to get rapid feedback about your work
Work on one of the most beloved brands in the Netherlands
The person we are looking for has extensive experience in on-line or related areas, with at least 6+ years of full-time employment. We expect the right person to be an expert in software engineering and have good knowledge of what it means to work with large and/or distributed systems. We also believe that to be a well-rounded developer, one needs experience with more than just one programming language. Furthermore, we need someone who lives and breathes Agile development, can focus on delivering, and wants to take a leading role in improving how we work.
What we expect from you:
Java and Scala development
Some exposure to mobile application development (iOS/Android/HTML5)
Unix / Linux
Test driven development
Agile methodologies
Affinity for e-Commerce
A degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Building great products
Your responsibilities will include:
Be a key team member in development and design of new projects
Coaching of junior and medior developers (guide them through architecture and procedures, be a mentor helping with skills development)
Think with your colleagues about architecture decisions and help work them out
Help to continuously improve development work in all areas (coding, processes, tools, testing, etc.)
Be a technical sparring partner for the organisation to help the business create efficient and effective requirements
Work with international counterparts across the worldwide eBay Classifieds Group
Preferred Qualifications:
Native mobile application development (iOS/Android/Windows)
Knowledge of alternative languages like Python
Processing big data
Benefits:
Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs.

The Company

For one of Europe’s most sustainable biodiesel producers and fuel suppliers, we are looking for a Senior Business Controller.
The Company was established in 2001 and is involved in the manufacture of large scale commercial biodiesel. The award-winning Company makes its clean, green road fuel by recycling wastes and residues from other industries - specifically waste from the food industry and tallow from the meat industry. It has also pioneered the use of low grade waste fats and oils such as “fatbergs” from the UK’s water industry.
As well as supplying bulk biodiesel to European customers, they specialise in the supply of high grade, sustainable diesel for fleet operators, delivering to over 100 UK depots. They provide the best economic value to their customers along with a range of greenhouse gas savings from their products.
By producing environmental fuel, their aim is to contribute to the global battle against climate change and help maximise the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions from transport. The Company has three manufacturing facilities for waste-based biodiesel and continues to invest in further growth.
In 2013 the group was acquired by a leading private investment company and in 2018 reached agreement to buy biodiesel production facilities, tank storage and cleaning facilities in the Netherlands. The addition of these facilities represents the first step for the company in replicating its successful business outside the UK. The company is now located in the Netherlands, Scotland and North West England.


The Position

The Senior Business Partner NL is the most senior financial role within the Netherlands. The position will play a key role in the planning and coordination of the annual budgeting process to create a business plan that reflects the organisation’s goals and long-term strategy for the Netherlands.
The Finance Department is currently creating a shared service center and has recently implemented a new ERP system. This role will work closely with the Group Head of Management Accounting to develop improved management reporting and analysis in the company, to drive performance imrpovement and support further investment. The role will play a key role in helping to implement an improved reporting system to complement the ERP system.
The main purpose of this position is to interpret financial analysis within the Netherlands in order to influence business partners to make timely interventions or to support commercial decisions. Working as part of a team, this role will contribute to the production of consolidated performance reporting and regular forecasts of expected outcomes for the group and liaise as a business partner with the relevant departments, this includes the traders.
You are also responsible for coordinating the budget process, gaining a deep understanding of the cost levers underpinning financial performance, support the growth and development of the management accountant in NL and will be involved in M&A related activities where relevant.
Please find the key responsibilities below:
Working with senior business partners to support delivery of departmental goals, as reflected in financial targets and budgetsCoordinating the annual budget process and securing buy-in from key stakeholdersProducing regular reforecasts using business knowledge of current performance trendsSupporting the production of longer-term forecasts that stretch beyond the annual budget.Analysing management reports to provide insightful performance commentary.Investigating the cause of deviations from target performance, working with the business partners to initiate timely interventions.Gaining a deep understanding of the cost levers underpinning financial performance and sharing this with business partners to initiate improvements where possible.Contribute to the ongoing development of the ERP system and other supporting tools to automate as much reporting as possible.Meeting with business partners on a regular basis to build successful relationships, resulting in better business knowledge and increased commercial acumen.Collaborating with other team members to maintain a high performing finance function.Contributing to the development of business cases and financial models for new investment opportunitiesSeeking opportunities to continually develop skills and management accounting expertise.Supporting the growth and development of the management accountants.Developing business cases and financial models for new investment opportunities which are consistent with business strategy.


Job QualificationsMaster’s Degree in Accounting, Control or Finance;Broad financial expertise gained in a process manufacturing industry e.g. chemicals or oilsExperience of working with business partners in an engineering or production management roleLeadership experienceAbility to analyse and interpret financial dataExperience of creating bespoke reports to meet a current business needPrevious use of ERP systems such as SAP or OracleExperience of using alternative data warehousing or reporting tools such as Hyperion, Power BI or othersUse of all Microsoft Office packages with strong Excel skillsGood communication skills – able to interpret complex financial data and explain it simply.Evidence of initiative – self-starter, developing new ways of reporting or analysing data.Analytical skills – comfortable working with large amounts of data from multiple sources.Interpersonal skills – able to form successful working relationshipsChallenger mentality – confident to challenge and drive continual improvement.Reporting skills – produce quality analysis or output that is meaningful to recipients.Ability to operate calmly under pressure.
Offer
Gross Annual Salary: EUR 90.000,- - EUR 110.000,- + Bonus + other benefits

Job Title: Global Procurement Category Manager - Security and EHS
Job Description:
Job Details
Location:
Amsterdam, North Holland
Posting date:
19 Oct 2020
Job type:
Permanent
Sector:
FMCG
Salary
£75000.00 - £90000.00
Global Procurement Category Manager - Security, Environment, Health & Safety

Market Leading FMCG Organization

Location - Madrid, Spain; Relocation required.

Salary - €75k-€90k + Comprehensive benefits (Car, Bonus, Meal Voucher, etc)

Contact - Rikard, JobsRL@bramwithconsulting.co.uk

Reference - 12781.2

As part of a major global business transformation, this market-leading FMCG firm is currently establishing a global procurement center of excellence out of their offices in Madrid. Bramwith Consulting is working exclusively with this organization to identify the best procurement talent in Europe to join this high-performance team.
One of the urgent requirements within the team currently is for a Global Procurement Category Manager for Security and Environment, Health & Safety (EHS) who will be responsible for creating and implementing the global and regional strategies for this spend area. The position will have oversight for over 80 countries where the business operates and will cover factory & office security systems, services, and technologies as well as a wide portfolio of EHS spend including Covid PPE, EHS Consulting, Waste Management, Facility operations and more.
This opportunity is excellent for individuals who have an expertise in Facilities Management Procurement with a specialist knowledge of Security and EHS spend who can deliver procurement best practices to this category at a global level. This is a very important spend category within the center of excellence as it directly impacts the day to day operations of offices and factories as well as the safety of all employees.
As the Global Procurement Category Manager for Security, Environment, Health & Safety

you will be expected to have the following skills:-

Proven track record of building regional and global category management strategies from scratch through internal stakeholder management and data analytics of facilities management spend
Excellent commercial and negotiation skills backed by a deep knowledge of the category
A solid understanding of corporate and manufacturing facility operations including hazards, safety, emissions and infrastructure
Ability to communicate effectively within a global matrix structured organization with a highly multi-cultural stakeholder base
Ability to generate consistent cost and cash flow improvements by implementing more effective sourcing and supplier management initiatives

If you are an ambitious facilities management procurement professional looking for an opportunity to deliver global impact within a market leading organization then this position should be your next career move. You will be exposed to C-level execs and be responsible for decisions that will impact the business on a global level across all their operating market. As the Global Procurement Category Manager for Security, Environment, Health & Safety you will take ownership of one of the most critical indirect spend categories that directly impacts all employees of the organization.
If you have the right skills and experience in global facilities management to take on this challenge then apply now with your most recent CV via the link above or directly to Rikard at JobsRL@bramwithconsulting.co.uk

Accelerate your sales career with the best in the industry!


Every day, we help companies to make the world a better place. One of North America’s fastest-growing technology companies, our software empowers better corporate decision making. We do this by providing a window into an organization’s global supply chain and the factories in which their products are manufactured, to reduce compliance risks, environmental waste, and prevent human rights abuse.

As we continue to expand our European operations, we are looking to grow our team of high-performing Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) Account Executives. Our ideal candidates bring significant experience in developing relationships with senior executives, have a proven track record of success selling in a B2B, SaaS environment, and have professional-level proficiency in English and German. We are specifically looking for individuals who are driven to succeed and thrive on the challenge that comes with taking a new product to market.


What you will do:

Prospect and sell to new logos
Establish and develop an account-based sales strategy to achieve sales quotas
Follow a systematic sales process to progress prospect sales campaigns
Win new customers through self-sourcing activities, research, responding to leads, and building exceptional internal and external relationships
Manage a complex sales-cycle to prospective senior executives and/or multiple constituencies within an organization (Manufacturing Operations, Demand Management, Finance, IT)
Partner with Business Development to grow and optimize your pipeline
Manage all sales activity and forecasting of revenue in Salesforce


Join us if you:

Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator with excellent written and verbal skills in English and German
Have at least 5 years of progressive B2B SaaS sales experience
Have masterfully led SaaS sales cycles from end-to-end
Have demonstrable experience meeting and exceeding sales quotas up to $1M
Are skillful in penetrating accounts, developing relationships, and selling to executive-level decision-makers
Are able to identify existing and emerging client needs, and to articulate the corresponding benefits of Assent’s offerings
Are a tenacious, highly motivated, and persistent sales hunter
Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator and presenter
Have excellent questioning techniques, active listening skills, and analytical capabilities
Are highly capable and self-sufficient in the development and delivery of all sales cycle artifacts including presentations, proposals
Are energized by working in a start-up-like sales environment
Have experience working with CRM tools
Have a combination of education and experience that demonstrates the above


What’s in it for you?

At Assent, your contributions will be valued and have a bigger purpose - you will help make a real difference to our clients. Our team challenges each other to be better every day and we dig deep to build a culture of innovation and high-performance.

In addition to a competitive salary, you can expect to:

Love what you do as part of a fantastic culture and supportive team that really wants you to succeed
Accelerate greatness in a challenging position with high learning and development potential
Choose how you work best with a flexible work arrangement
Spend your days making a difference, not just working for a living. We help our customers all over the world by providing a real understanding of their supply chain data so they can protect their brands, remove market access barriers, and reduce operational and financial risk


All applicants will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check.

Reasonable Accommodations Statement: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the aforementioned duties and responsibilities satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.

Follow a systematic sales process to progress prospect sales campaigns
Win new customers through self-sourcing activities, research, responding to leads, and building exceptional internal and external relationships
Manage a complex sales-cycle to prospective senior executives and/or multiple constituencies within an organization (Manufacturing Operations, Demand Management, Finance, IT)
Partner with Business Development to grow and optimize your pipeline
Manage all sales activity and forecasting of revenue in Salesforce


Join us if you:

Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator with excellent written and verbal skills in English and German
Have at least 5 years of progressive B2B SaaS sales experience
Have masterfully led SaaS sales cycles from end-to-end
Have demonstrable experience meeting and exceeding sales quotas up to $1M
Are skillful in penetrating accounts, developing relationships, and selling to executive-level decision-makers
Are able to identify existing and emerging client needs, and to articulate the corresponding benefits of Assent’s offerings
Are a tenacious, highly motivated, and persistent sales hunter
Are an articulate, persuasive, and passionate communicator and presenter
Have excellent questioning techniques, active listening skills, and analytical capabilities
Are highly capable and self-sufficient in the development and delivery of all sales cycle artifacts including presentations, proposals
Are energized by working in a start-up-like sales environment
Have experience working with CRM tools
Have a combination of education and experience that demonstrates the above


What’s in it for you?

At Assent, your contributions will be valued and have a bigger purpose - you will help make a real difference to our clients. Our team challenges each other to be better every day and we dig deep to build a culture of innovation and high-performance.

In addition to a competitive salary, you can expect to:

Love what you do as part of a fantastic culture and supportive team that really wants you to succeed
Accelerate greatness in a challenging position with high learning and development potential
Choose how you work best with a flexible work arrangement
Spend your days making a difference, not just working for a living. We help our customers all over the world by providing a real understanding of their supply chain data so they can protect their brands, remove market access barriers, and reduce operational and financial risk


All applicants will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check.

Reasonable Accommodations Statement: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the aforementioned duties and responsibilities satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.

You'll support the team with these daily tasks:
Prepare per quarter the Buying season, including preparation of the showroom and assortment overviews
Manage the online shops and catalogue content management
Develop an effective relationship with partners as well as internally with various stakeholders such as marketing, buying and logistics.
Monitor and report on sales, marketing and promotions performance
Following these insights, you will be able to further drive sales on article and account level
Ensure all products are online and merchandised appropriately for all our online channels
Keep the online collection up to date and monitor product performance using merchandise analysis
Ensure each site has up to date stock levels on category/season/bestsellers etc. and ensure stock management processes are followed by operations and logistics teams
Our perfect candidate has the following:
You're passionate about E-Commerce and gained ideally experience in this field or in Fashion (Retail)
You have a Bachelors' degree (minimum requirement)
Your results-driven and will need English language skills (written and verbal); as well as the ability to build relationships and to optimise your commercial insights with a strong focus on trading
You're an analytical thinker and highly numerate. You're also able to work flexibly & independently within deadlines

Hunkemöller is certified TOP EMPLOYER of the Netherlands 2020, which underlines our people initiatives and achievements.
Together Tomorrow – Join a Retailer that's on the move to be better for our planet, better for people, better together! Ready to help us achieving our ambitious goals? Where ever you'll start working with us, if in Stores or our HQs, you can contribute!
Apply now with your CV (in English) or LinkedIn profile only. In case of any questions, please contact our Recruitment team via (0031)35-646 5102.
For this role, we're not looking to work with external agencies.

We’re looking for an Online 3rd parties Coordinator (m/f) for our E-Commerce department, focused on Wholesale. Hunkemöller trades via several online 3rd parties such as Zalando, About You, Asos, Amazon and Wehkamp to name a few. The core task is to support the team across the entire fashion season: from the start when we present the new collection and collect the orders, until the in-season management of stock, and the optimization of the SALE phase. You do this through by combining solid account management and with operational excellence.

You'll support the team with these daily tasks:
Prepare per quarter the Buying season, including preparation of the showroom and assortment overviews
Manage the online shops and catalogue content management
Develop an effective relationship with partners as well as internally with various stakeholders such as marketing, buying and logistics.
Monitor and report on sales, marketing and promotions performance
Following these insights, you will be able to further drive sales on article and account level
Ensure all products are online and merchandised appropriately for all our online channels
Keep the online collection up to date and monitor product performance using merchandise analysis
Ensure each site has up to date stock levels on category/season/bestsellers etc. and ensure stock management processes are followed by operations and logistics teams
